text: |  Edinburgh to Charleston via Washington. The flights to Edinburgh were ok but the planes we were on were very old and filthy. I used the warm towel they provide before the meal service to wipe off the center console between the seats and it was black. Yuck! The flight attendants were nice and the food was fine. Our return flights were not good. Our transatlantic flight was cancelled but we were not notified until we were standing in line to check in. We got a nice hotel room amd meals and the flight the next day was on time. But again the plane was filthy, the blanket smelled like body odor and had holes in it, and the wool throw smelled like a wet dog. There is no way those had been cleaned between uses. Again the center console was visibly dirty. I paid almost $5000 for this? The flight attendants were unfriendly and we were made to feel that we were an inconvenience for them. Our connection was in Newark and the plane we were supposed to leave on was diverted to another airport. Flight was delayed for hours while we waited for another plane. That one was United Express and that plane was very old and the interior was not maintained. My husband wents to the lavatory at the back of the plane and said there was a crack in the interior plastic. Part of my armrest was missing. I have to wonder what the state of the mechanics on these aged planes is like if the interior that is visible to the customers is so bad. I will avoid United Airlines whenever possible in the future. Think twice before you book with them.

|  Lufthansa/United failed to put my luggage on the airplane in Munich, for some unknown reason. Despite filing a claim, my luggage was still sitting in Munich three days later. Eventually, they flew it to Charlotte, NC where I had stayed one night upon my arrival before traveling onwards. I called every night to track the progress (or lack thereof) of my luggage. Even though I had updated the address from the address of the first night's hotel to the new location, every single time I called they had the address of the first night's hotel. Three days after my luggage arrived in Charlotte, I called for the 7th time because I still did not have my bag. They told me it had been dumped off at the hotel where I had stayed 5 nights before, despite the fact that I'd updated the address over and over. So now my luggage is at some hotel I stayed at 5 nights ago that I am not planning to return to. After an hour on the phone with United this evening, he's told me (for the 5th day in a row) that I should have my bag by tomorrow. United is incompetent. Over and over I heard them say, "I apologize for that, ma'am." It would seem that they've all be trained to deal with issues in this way, rather than by actually sorting them out. Very, very unhappy with United/Lufthansa and not fly with them again, even if it means paying extra to fly on another airline.

|  Denver to Philadelphia. The plane was delayed because of a warning light about a fuel pump after the flight was fully loaded. It then took 20 minutes to get a mechanic and another 20 minutes to figure out the warning didn't matter and we could fly anyway. "its a redundant system", they told us. The experience was made worse by the fact that there was no air conditioning during the period of the delay on a hot day in Denver. The airplane was not cleaned after arrival in Denver from San Francisco. I was stepping on crackers left on the floor and there was garbage left in the compartment on the back of the seat. My family flies UA regularly but this had me thinking I should look for alternatives now whenever I can.

|  Tokyo Narita to Hobbs via Houston. I traveled alone with my 10 month old daughter both ways. No flight attendant helped me out in any way like putting luggage up in the cabin, picking up her toys for me, or even just being friendly. Everyone treated me like I was a hassle to deal with. One attendant refused to give me my bassinet because service had started, even though I had already been waiting for an hour. It only takes a few seconds to latch it on. One flight attendant actually made eye contact with my smiley daughter and waved, which was nice. One Japanese male attendant who I spoke to in Japanese, replied to me in English even though (he was speaking Japanese to the other staff so) I know he spoke Japanese. Why not speak back to me in Japanese? That is just plain rude. Other than that, after experiencing JAL last year, I thought the food was extremely disappointing. I also specifically made a phone call just to request a bassinet, but when I went to check in, there was no such request. I was baffled. I can’t say how disappointed and annoyed I was about the staff on both flights. If you are traveling alone with an infant, they will treat you like an inconvenience.

| Perfectly clear day. No weather problems. Delayed and we'll miss our connecting flight again. We have missed connecting flights several times with United Airlines. I hate to fly with them but this was the only option this time.

|  After arriving at the airport at 4:30am in San Diego we flew into Chicago. Little did we know we would not be leaving that airport for 36 hours. Our flight to our destination was scheduled to leave at 6pm. After our gate got changed 10 times and our flight got delayed further and further we scurried up and down stairs to each one. We then arrived at the last gate at 9:30pm. We sat and sat and were told no updates. We then were told we were waiting on the plane to arrive that we were flying out. The plane landed. BUT we only have one pilot, so we waited for another plane to land for a second pilot. Thenone of the flight attendants timed out on her shift and could no longer board our flight home. BUT by the time the other plane landed the staff timed out as we watched them walk right out of the gangway to the plane passed us never to be seen again. So, we waited on another plane for a whole new crew. We were assured for the first announcement over the intercom of the night that we were heading out soon! At this point it is 11:30pm. 30 minutes later, at 12am, we are notified that the flight is cancelled. after waiting 9 hours and running around the airport, it is canceled. This is not even the worst of it. We call United customer service to see what can be done 2 times (go ahead and listen to those calls- they are pathetic) only to be told there are no more flights to JAX and that we cannot be helped.  The couple in front of us got another flight booked automatically that left 6am the next day why our customer service experience was so different is beyond me. We ended up buying the only flight we could in a different airport. We ended up purchasing a flight from MDW in Chicago to JAX. Sometime after purchasing the flight I was so relieved to find one! That is until I realized the flight I purchased from Delta airlines was on September 27th when I need to leave ORD right then and there on now what is September fourth. So with even more stress added, I am out over $500 more dollars, I still have no way home, I have nowhere to stay no way to travel, I don’t have my luggage, I am defeated. So, after searching for some more time, there are no flights out of ORD to JAX for 2 more days. I ended up purchasing another flight for $935.60 from a different airline and airport in Chicago that did not leave until 1 pm the next day. We were left with no other choice but the sleep on the ground. So, it is now 1:30am. We are wondering where is my luggage that has everything I need in it and were told our luggage went to JAX already without us. It didn’t make sense. So, we then stood in another line and were told that our luggage is at ORD but if we exit to get it, we cannot get back in until the morning. So, we agreed to get our luggage in the morning before we spend another $40+ dollars to transfer to MDW where our new flight is.

|  Cedar Rapids to Toronto via Chicago. First delayed flight due to weather, then after boarding there was a plane “malfunction” meaning we would miss our connecting flight. Couldn’t get us anything until the following night missing a day and a half of our trip! Then when trying to see if we could get a partial vs full refund depending if we canceled our trip vs still going they said those seats for the next day were now gone! Forget it what a joke! They were so quick to take my money but didn’t refund me for a checked bag I didn’t even take because of the cancelled trip. Phone customer service was just as terrible saying I had to fill out online for a refund when I told them it kept coming up with an error, sounds like lazy workers to me! Will not fly again!

| Syracuse to Sacramento via Chicago. Never flying United again. If a representative is taking pain to go through the reviews (which I highly doubt), it’s high time to change your employees. What angered me was not the delays or inconveniences of last minute gate/terminal changes. That I can handle. What irked me was the sheer arrogance and attitude that each one of your employees show towards customers in general-especially the ones at Chicago O’Hare. I am yet to come across one who is civil and decent enough. As customers, we shouldn’t have to deal with your employees attitude and sarcasm. I give this airline zero stars. Nowhere else have I felt this poorly treated ever in my life.

|  San Francisco to Seattle. What a joke of an airline. The staff is rude and unprofessional. The whole experience was so stressful that I have sworn myself never again flying United. I don’t even think they care about customer service. The only nice people are the pilots!

|  Newark to Aruba. United cancelled my flight to give the seats to another group that was cancelled the day. Before then delayed my flight and cost me two whole days in an airport and 2 missed days of work . They offered a laughable 150 compensation to fly with them again. Please read before booking. They are over priced and have no one to speak to in customer service only emails and no phone calls or conversations. I will never fly them again and I suggest you do the same

|  Newark to Raleigh Durham. Flying United once again was a horrible experience. Even though a passing storm stopped several hours before the departure the outbound flight was cancelled. I had to go to a university to attend classes for one week and when I checked in on the rescheduled flight, the flight attendant made me check my luggage even though my luggage basically met the carry on requirement, which caused me to be late to my class though my rescheduled flight left at 6am and I had plenty of time to get to class by 9am. One the way back my flight was delayed 4 hours though only a 1.5 hour flight. Once I got back to my airport, because they made me check my luggage again, I was delayed another hour since the luggage were put into a room without alerting anyone. United airline operates giving zero consideration to the customer's time, paying good money. Their attitude seems to be ""we are doing you a favor"". The attendants are rude and I have never flown out on time nor reached my destination on time. United new carry on baggage policy is a scam. You have to board basically with nothing with you unless of course you pay more. It is a shame how United treat their customers so poorly and without much dignity.

| Pittsburgh to Denver. It wasn't enough for United Airlines to make your life hell on the plane, they've overachieved and ruined your day before you even check in! I got to the gate to check in and immediately was informed I was restricted. Yeah thanks for alarming me. Then I'm notified my flight was delayed, but received no notification that this happened. Great, now I'm at the airport 4 hours early. But then it gets worse. I researched the night before and United states you are allowed a personal item and a carry on (sizes are listed) but they don't mention that it depends on the class. If you have basic economy you forgo your free carryon rights and must pay to check it in. Now they've put a damper on my day, trip and wallet. Then my flight was delayed 2 more times just to really kick me in the knees. Bottom line, I would much rather give my nonprofit salary to any other airline.

|  San Francisco to Medford . The flight was fine but we paid a lot of money and still had to pay more for baggage and to go on an earlier flight. We also paid to get premium economy so as to have a bit of leg room. The airline check-in was a nightmare. We were coming in from overseas on a different airline and had to re-check bags and get seats. There were kiosks, which I assumed were for checking in bags only. We wanted to try to get an earlier flight so I started to approach the “additional services” counter. However, the attendants started yelling that the counter was only for missed flights. The whole time we were there, the people at the counter were yelling at everyone to use the kiosk. There was no-one there welcoming us and answering questions, they assumed that we should know their process and yelled when we didn’t. After being in the UK and experiencing the polite service there, it was disappointing that one of our major airlines is so rude to customers. Frankly, I would rather fly Southwest where they will be polite to me and won’t “nickle and dime” me like United. Unfortunately, few airlines fly in/out of our little airport.

|  Wichita to San Francisco via Denver. Horrible delays today without explanation from Wichita to San Francisco. Flight UA2188 from Wichita supposed to fly out at 6:25am, 4 hour unexplained delay. Missed connection in Denver. Flight changed to UA0733 that was also delayed 2 hours unexplained then canceled for flight UA3436 back to Kansas City at 3pm for connecting flight UA5312 to San Francisco which has now been delayed as well. Wide spectrum delays on United flights as a rule, come to find out, especially on the planes from Canada. The planes are old and in disrepair. I will have been bounced around 19 hours and missed a full day of work with expensive parking fees at San Francisco along with now ridiculous drive time. I will never fly United again and will not recommend them. I spoke with another passenger that stated they've been trying to get home for 3 days with United.

|  Newark to Delhi. Miserable employees especially entourage to lengthy nonstop destinations. Seems they should stay and work domestic. Hardly any courtesy or know how to respond to their customers. Maybe they are overworked. I had a terrible experience with a flight attendant who was rude and I mentioned other airline policies, she said well go fly with them then. I was simply asking her a question.

|  Paris to Newark. Very friendly staff (except one FA who was a bit cranky, but her colleagues more than made up for it). The food and beverages in business were good. The salads served for lunch and then for the pre-landing snack were fresh and tasty and the pre-arrival snack is a big improvement over the microwaved chicken or mystery meat wrap they used to serve. The seats on the 767-400 are still the old CO/UA BusinessFirst seats. Not bad, but not as comfortable as the new Polaris seats - which at this point you'd start to expect on NYC-western Europe flights, given what the non-US carrier competition now offers. However, we had plenty of pillows and blankets, including a cool gel pillow that was really comfortable. Star Alliance lounge at CDG isn't anything to write home about, but it was fine. The new United Polaris lounge the we used on our outbound flight is a huge improvement over the old United Club.

|  Tampa to Denver. Did not have a seat next to my daughter (she is 14). As I approached the service at the gate they ignored me for about 2 minutes and then told me rudely that they are not open yet. Second time after my trip in July which got me stranded in Denver overnight with no blanket or services or hotel room. I will try to avoid United and will never ever recommend flying United - service got extremely bad over the years.

|  United Airlines just lost a customer for good! Just finishing off a 2nd leg of a flight. The first leg from New York (LGA) to Houston (IAH) was an incredible 1st class flight with outstanding service. However, my connection from IAH to Lubbock, TX (LBB) was miserable. One would think that a tiny plane at 60% capacity with NO first class section would allow some flexibility, but apparently that’s not the case with UA. I ended up next to another 6’5 male in an already ultra-tight seating arrange (reason #1 I don’t fly United). I quickly felt like the ultimate “commoner” no longer in 1st class when asking to change seats to one of the 3 bulkhead seats with no passenger after the main doors were closed. “Sorry sir, only Gold and Platinum flyers are allowed” is not a comforting feeling after I just spent $1165 on a last minute first class ticket!! If that’s a company policy change it! That’s classless United Airlines. I didn’t request a first class seat. I requested a poor bulkhead with the tightest legroom of any carrier I’ve flown. I think the seat would have cost me $18, but it originally wasn’t available.

| San Francisco to Seattle. I’m appalled by the horrible attitude from the ground staff in SFO. I was one of the last few to board (with 25 minutes to spare before takeoff), and was told that there was insufficient space overhead bin for the remaining passengers’ bags. I was asked: “Will your bag fit in front of you?” by one of the male staff, to which I answered “Yes, it’s just clothes.” I was then yelled at for no good reason. He said “I didn’t ask you what was in the bag, I asked if it would fit.” I’ve never been treated like this by service crew anywhere in the world. You would think that there would be some semblance of service!

|  San Francisco to Birmingham via Chicago. Never again. Given a flight with an impossible connection. No way to travel over 2 terminals in 10 minutes. Logistics planner that sequences flights sucks as does customer service.

| Flew Orlando to San Francisco. I travel on a regular basis, but not normally on United, Now I understand why! The gate agents, flight attendants and baggage workers are some of the rudist people I've ever met. They seem extremely incompetent and give you the run around if you have a question. I lost my wallet on a plane and it took me over an hour to find someone who could help me. I finally went back to the airport, which was a $60 Uber ride away to figure it out on my own. In addition, my husband was checking a firearm and it literally took 30 minutes to complete after being sent to several different places by several different people. I booked in economy because I didn't read the fine print that talked about the inflexibility of this type of fare. When we inquired about changing, they treated us like we were second hand citizens. Its not like the ticket was free, even if it was, that's no way to treat anyone. Finally, there was a child screaming at the top of his lungs on our flight and not one attendant offered any help to the mother. In addition, they didn't even insist that either of them put on their seatbelts. Unbelievable! Things look pretty in the terminal and everyone is dressed very well, however, the customer service is horrible.

| I flew on a flight from Tokyo, Narita to Denver international, coming back from a family vacation. Our flight was a total of 10 hours and 10 hours and 20 minutes long. Departing time was 5:15pm - 12:35pm. The flight price was $1,394. I gave it a average of 7 stars, based on the overall stars of 21. I feel the value for money was not where you want it to be. The flight was bearable, but not extremely comforting, there were times where I had to really get creative in the position of my body to get at least 20 minutes of sleep. Leg room was mediocre at best. A passenger sitting next to me who was a little over six foot had 0 space between his knees and the seat in front, he sometimes had to press his foot against the seat in front. Seat Comfort = 2/5 - Value For Money = 2/5 In terms of the cabin crew, they were not nice, but they were not rude either. You could tell some flight attendants were a bit rough around the edges, wanted things to be done quickly. But some were more understanding and nice, but still have that edginess. That is all okay because they ended giving out some decent food. The problem I have with some airlines is that the food is just bland, and this is the same with United, but thankfully, they came with salt and pepper, good job. Dinner meals were okay, but breakfast was great. If your settling in for a long flight, try the omelette meal if they have it, the meal is rather delicious for airplane food. Cabin Staff Crew = 3/5 - Food And Beverages = 4/5. One thing I desperately have to mention is the washrooms in that airplane. I mean I had never seen anything like it. If your a person that frequently visits the washrooms, and does not like to wait, United might not be for you. On my flight, there was not a minute that the washroom was empty. There was also somebody in it, and there was also a lot of waiting, you couldn’t just sit at your seat and wait for someone to finish, because they’re people in line that will snatch that’s opportunity up right away. Man the washrooms on that flight were something I will never forget. My last topic is in-flight entertainment. I felt the roster of movies was pretty good, and I got to watch some very good movies, that are brand new. The only downside is the technology to watch it. It was a touchscreen tv on the seat, but to be honest it was challenging to use, a light press on the screen when you want to exit out will not work at all, and you might be stuck with thinking that your screen isn’t working and not watch a movie for the whole flight! But instead you had to press hard on every single button to get it to work. This is okay and is a lot better than the screen not working at all, but is frustrating. In-Flight Enternainment = 3/5 Well the flight was bearable, an above average flight as you can say, and above average is okay with me on a gruelling 10 hour flight but anything below that is a nightmare. Overall this flight was what you call plain mediocre. And if you have a bit of patience you’ll get though it fine, and if you don’t find another flight. Bearable, Above Average and Mediocre, are things that I feel itchy about, but for a 10 hour flight I would recommend it, but the price is a little bit out of hand.

| I had a flight from Calgary to San Diego via San Francisco. The flight was delayed and my connecting flight from SFO to San Diego was already left. I have to stay at the airport for whole night . No other flight was provided or even Accomodation. Worst customer service. Won't recommend to travel with United ever. I even know this review won't make any difference to United Airlines

|  Jacksonville to Washington via Boston. My husband and I stay in airport from 10:30am until we thought our flight was coming at 7:50 only for them to announce that the flight is delayed. They couldn't offer us to go on another flight, they couldn't offer us a pillow or blanket to keep us warm and comfortable while we had to wait. Uncertain why the flight was delayed, they claimed weather, but other airlines were flying to our destination with no delays, because we had an economy flight we were treated less than.

|  I am a mom of 2 kids flying today from Dallas to Chicago. United asked me to reschedule the flight due to bad weather. After rescheduling my flight they sent a message stating that now this flight has been cancelled. We tried to book again the previous one but it was full at that moment of time. It's a terrible day for me, due to long weekend we had so many plans and all have been cancelled last minute. My elder daughter is so disheartened. The customer service representative will just say apologies and won't even give any benefits to you. Please don't book any flight with United Airlines if you are traveling on long weekends or holidays.

| Hartford to Tampa via Chicago. First let me start by saying if United is your only option for an airline you may want to strongly consider driving to your destination, you will likely get there quicker. Second when your flight is canceled 90 minutes before departure because the aircraft is “not available” United will never tell you why, so do not ever expect any type of compensation for your loss of time or other expenses. Lastly, not only will you ever hear and apology, but instead the agents are rude and act like they are doing you a favor for rebooking causing you to lose an entire day of your time. Never again my friends, and yes please do use my real name! I rarely ever leave poor reviews but this is more than justified!

|  San Francisco to Frankfurt. Worst airline in the world is United Airlines. I'm a gold member for many years. The airlines constantly has flight delay, extremely bad or worst customer services - bad attitude of gate agent, attendants, and all known to everyone the worst food services among all the airlines I've experienced. I fly often with European and Asian airlines, even latin american airlines, all I have received much better services than from United. This is the latest experience I had just 2 days ago traveling from SFO to Reykjavik connecting at Frankfurt. Notified in the morning of departure, flight was delayed for 1 hour 15 min. I have 1 hour 35min connection at Frankfurt originally. Got to airport, the check-in agent said the flight should take off per new time and will arrive only 30min than original. It turned out flight was late departure for 2 hour 15min, and arrived 1 hour 10 min later than planned. And got text message at FRA saying they put me on the flight next day midnight arrival to Iceland. That is 1 and half day later. I only going to be at Iceland for 3 days. Then to make things worse, they couldn't get my baggage transfer to the new flight that I had switched to at FRA airport. Now I'm stuck at Iceland without any clothes and can't get out in the cold weather. Here is the contrast, at the SFO airport, a gate agent of United, at the elite / premium line, was extremely rude. I hand over my passport and he handed back and said "open to the photo page". With 1 hour delay, and line up, and even at the premium line, this is United's attitude. And to compare to the agent of Lufthansa airlines at FRA airport gate, the 2 ladies was very friendly, and went out of their ways to help me, and put me on a same day flight connecting to Iceland only 5 hour later than my original flight. They didn't send me to the United customer service, which is what I would expect any gate agent or airline services in US airports would do. They made many phone calls while asking me to wait and took care of everything and handed over my new boarding pass and told me they've notified baggage handling of my new flights.

| Charleston to Houston. I paid for a 7:00a.m flight not 8:15a.m flight. Every time I fly United it’s never on time. I would recommend Delta or Southwest. United is a joke. If you would like to land late every time you fly, then fly United.

| Booked to fly Baltimore to Syracuse. I cannot say enough negative things about United Airlines. This is is the second review I’ve left in the last four hours because I have very little to do since arriving in Newark. Delayed flights. Terrible customer service. Save yourself the headache. Every single time I don’t fly Southwest, I regret it. Do not make mistake I have made.

|  Rochester to Burlington. Absolute worst airline you could fly on. Found out our flight was over an hour delayed after arriving at the airport, however we needed to ask if this meant we would miss our connecting flight. Staff was completely unsympathetic. Gave us 2 options both would have us arrive at our destination a little less than 24 hours after our scheduled time. On top of that, the attendant was unsure if we would get a refund if we cancelled the flight. Again, completely unsympathetic. It’s 2018 United, try and figure out a better flying schedule so your flights don’t get delayed. In the future, I would happily spend extra money if this means I will not ever have to fly on United again.

|  Denver to San Diego. On July 22, 2018, I registered for the United MileagePlus Reinstate Challenge. It was my understanding that if I took a qualifying flight, then I'd reinstate 90,000 miles. However, after I took my qualifying flight, United told me that only 1,500 miles were reinstated. Given that they charged my $100, I asked for a refund since it was not worth paying $100 for $1,500 miles, but they refused. Their reinstatement challenge is a fraud so don't register for the program!

|  Houston to London. Worst return travel that never happened just because they were not able to match first name from a boarding pass to the name given on the passport. Instead of checking the surname on both the travelling documents and providing every possible proof that it was a booked by a family member who gave my Arabic initial instead of my actual first name. Every personal detail I entered and gave them such as passport no. DOB, Expiration date and ticket details all matched, but they still didn't let me go through. I'm baffled and wondering as to why didn't United rectified my ticket when I have given them my passport details and all. They took me to the TSA and adding salt to my injury, they kept me waiting for an hour, took me back to United Airlines and asked me to verify her details which the customer service on the phone did, but the United Airlines rep on the desk at the airport refused to verify it. The customer rep on the phone spoke to the rep at the desk and he still refused me to travel back. They have sucked the money out of me not only for the return ticket and $100 extra for an extra luggage I was supposed to take back to London today.

|  Portland to San Francisco. Worst airline to travel. They will try to suck money out of you in every possible way. They charged me extra $50 for 2 bags that were allowed free to carry on by all other 5 airlines in the itinerary. Also they insisted again and again that the “kind of ticket class” I booked, they are doing me a favor for everything. I am not sure how they treat economy passengers but it felt insulting at one point. It was unfortunate that I booked tickets through United Airlines. But I will not repeat this mistake again in future, it’s a lesson learned for me.

|  I was heading to Newark airport from Honolulu, with a layover in Denver. An electrical malfunction occurred on the flight causing the plan to land early in San Francisco. When I arrived at the airport, United Airlines' customer service could not find my reservation, they lost my luggage, and could not send me back on the same day. Please do not ever fly with United. It's really never worth the cheap price.

|  Los Angeles to Milwaukee via Chicago. Never again. Leave Chicago late because “someone forgot to engage the steering”. Sit there for 30 minutes and they still call it an on time departure. Land in Milwaukee and the grounds crew wont do anything because of a chance of thunderstorms. I am sitting on the tarmac watching Southwest park and unload their planes. With their delay I am taking the time to write this review.

|  Rochester New York to Washington. I was on a small plane (2 seats per side) and I being a large man was also sitting next to a large man (probably the two biggest guys on the plane). There were 3 of 4 exit row seats open. They wouldn’t let us move because they the flight attendant said we couldn’t because we didn’t pay for them. They were already paid for but they didn’t show up for the flight. So she decided to make it an uncomfortable flight for us and then leave the exit row seats open which is a hazard.

|  Portland to San Francisco. They charge you even for small carry on item. While delta allowed me to carry the small carry on bags United changed for both of them. This was the last time I did business with them. I think they will keep on losing customers if they do not focus on them.

|  Milwaukee to Washington. Terrible customer service. Because my ticket was purchased via 3rd party, it was deemed group 5. I tried to upgrade from economy time of purchase and check in but it would not let me. By the time you get to the gate you pay $50 for your hand luggage. Or you go back thru TSA to pay $25. Very hungry airline, seats are very tight. Stay away from them. Even Spirit is better.

|  Buffalo to San Juan via Chicago. My family and I were rerouted because we missed our connecting flight in Chicago when the first flight from Buffalo was almost two hours delayed. We were sent from Chicago to LaGuardia airport in New York and told that our luggage would be sent to LaGuardia. When we arrived at LaGuardia, our luggage didn't. We filed a baggage claim and were told that the luggage was still in Chicago but would arrive on a later flight. Since our connecting flight wouldn't be leaving until the next morning, we waited at the airport and when the last flight arrived around 11pm, still no luggage. We are now left without any luggage and we will be catching our cruise at it's next port of call. This means we will be without a change of clothes and toiletries during a one week cruise. United Airlines has only given us a lot of explanations why they can't help us. The only reason we will even be able to board the boat is because we purchased new tickets through another airline. After the humiliation and frustration that we have been put through by United Airlines, I would never recommend this airline. They give you a number to call but make sure that you can't contact a live person.

|  Maui to San Francisco We had a flight to Kauai from Maui which we could not make due to Hurricane Lane/ fires blocking all roadways to the Kahului airport. Because of this we could not go to Kauai. We had a return flight from Kauai to Maui connecting from Maui to SFO. We had already paid for our flight, we called in to see if we would have to do anything special with our bags. Then they informed us because we wouldn't be on the first plane in the flight arrangement they would need to "cancel" per policy and charge us additionally to schedule us a new flight, even though we already paid for two seats on a flight that is already leaving from Maui to sf which we would be on. United had "waived fees" for flight issues related to the hurricane up until the 26th August, but had no sympathy or sensitivity to the fact that our issue is directly correlated to the waivers they were issuing. Terrible customer service, terrible policies, terrible compassion, and overall I am not surprised with this experience given everything United has received heat for in recent history. Just want to express the unbelievable ridiculousness we experienced with UA policies, call, customer service.

|  Las Vegas to Miami. |  Newark to London. Get the seat comfort of Economy when you book Business class: the seat in business class was broken and could not recline. Quite annoying on a night flight. The crew tried to solve the issue but they did not manage to address it. The cabin was full, so no other options.

|  This is the worst experience I ever had. I was flying from Boston MA to Atlanta Georgia via Newark with the flight scheduled 7:30 am with destination arrival 1:18 pm. |  Houston to Newark. It was a very uncomfortable flight with rude flight attendants and a late ground crew. The snacks offered was a tiny bag of pretzels containing six small pretzels. The seating was cramped with absolutely to leg room and the aisles were too narrow. Never again United!

|  Chicago to Cleveland. The worst flight experience I’ve ever had. This summer alone I’ve flown on three separate airlines. |  Redmond to Los Angeles. This is the worst flight experience I have had in a long time, luckily I have plenty of time waiting in the airport to write reviews. |  It's been a terrible experience so far with United and Middle East Airlines getting my luggage back! |  London Heathrow to Los Angeles. I have heard several different things about United's long-haul product, so I didn't know what to expect. Whatever expectations I did have on United's long-haul product were exceeded. Due to the fact that it was a flight to the United States, we had to go through additional security checks and "recheck-in" at a United service counter. It was a quick and efficient process. Our flight departed Heathrow thirty minutes past the scheduled time. The flight was nearly full, and I had a window seat on this flight. The seat configuration on the 787 was a 3-3-3. Once in the air, a refreshments service occurred, which was followed by lunch. There were two options: chicken or pasta. I opted for the pasta, and it was pretty decent. It came with some sort of grain and corn salad, as well as a bread roll, butter, cheese and crackers. It was a good portion of food. The United Economy seat was very comfortable with heaps of legroom by economy standards. It is made of leather and reclines relatively far back. The inflight entertainment was outstanding, with plenty of choices and a very modern and responsive touchscreen. The seat was also fully wired with a headphone jack, a USB port and a power outlet below the seat. In addition, I would definitely recommend flying on the 787 because the windows are much larger and darken at the touch of a button. The inflight service was okay, not up to par with Lufthansa or Austrian. Although it was a day flight, I got four hours of sleep with the blanket and pillow provided, both very comfortable. Before arrival we were served a warm turkey sandwich, as well as fresh fruit, chips and a cookie. All of it was delicious, especially the fruit, which was a nice touch. We landed in Los Angeles 18 minutes before scheduled arrival. Overall, United's hard product (the seat and entertainment) are outstanding, however their service needs a little work. I would recommend United Airlines and I certainly look forward to flying them again.

|  Anchorage to Rochester, or at least a sorry attempt to get me there. Leave Talkeetna, AK to drive to Anchorage for Flight ~3.5 hours. Wait 1.5 to board for 6 hour flight to Chicago. But they need to solve their issues which would be done if many of customers won’t book with this airline!

|  Newark to Houston. This is ridiculous! My fiancé and I booked our flight together and had to sit in different areas. This made my flight very uncomfortable due to me having a fear of flying and he usually helps keep me calm. I checked in online and they wouldn’t even give me the curtesy of paying for my seats. This is not ok and I will not be flying with United airlines again.

| Denver to Las Vegas. My flight started with the announcement that the flight is over-booked and so someone had to leave, they offered $450, a flight next morning in first class and a hotel for the night. I didnt take it. I had boarding group 5 but somehow managed to board the plane first. Seats were actually better than at most of translantic flight, legroom was fine, width wasn't that bad too. Entertaiment screens was however just ads, so the only way to watch movies was to download the United app and then watch, but there was big selection of movies so actually a good entertaiment system, food was for purchase, drinks were free. The crew was nice too. We departed at time, and arrived earlier, we only waited 10 minutes on tarmac. I dont understand why is United so hated. I had an excellent experience.

|  Newark to Barcelona. The experience is horrible. The airline handled their difficulties very poorly. The did not check the plane until it was about to take of, they held us on the tarmac for 2 hours, announced a mechanical problem, than delayed the flight for another two hours, and then surprise! The flight attendants became out of legal hours - didn’t they know they are delaying the the flight over and over. They put us in line for hotel vouchers, a 3 hours line to get our vouchers, this is a true torture- the flight was suppose to leave 6 hours ago- it is now almost 2 pm. Everyone is exhausted and they don’t have enough stuff to put us in the hotel. Stay away from this unprofessional outfit. I’ll never use them again.

|  United delayed my flight by 3 hours and so I attempted to change my flight to an earlier departure as I had urgent business in NYC. After speaking to three different representatives on the phone who refused to help me, the manager of the supervisor of the original staff member I spoke to put me on an earlier flight and told me I was good to go. After arriving at my new gate, the O'Hare employee at the gate informed that I was never checked-in so I didn't have a seat on the plane and that I might not make it out. That flight was then cancelled, and my checked bag eventually flew to LaGuardia on my original flight and instead of offering to deliver it to my house, United insisted that I come back to the airport in two days to pick it up. Long story short, the customer service provided by this airline is terrible, I'm never flying them again and I can tell you if you're ever in need of help this airline will do absolutely nothing for you.

|  Los Angeles  to Honolulu. This wasn't the best flight I've taken. The seats were very uncomfortable and felt super hard leather. There was no exact entertainment system so instead you had to put your phone or ipad inside the holder which I didn't have with me. They didn't have that much stuff for breakfast. The United Wi-Fi was super expensive : $11 for 1 hour, $15 for 2 hours, $21 for full flight. They only offered one website free which was unitedwifi.com where for free you could stream a limited number of movies for free without being able to access the rest of the internet. I didn't have headphones so that didn't work out.

|  This flight was a "United by SkyWest" Flight From Boise, Idaho to San Francisco and then to Fresno California. The gate operations and boarding went fine in Boise, and we departed on time. The problem started in San Francisco (SFO). When arriving in SFO, the pilot came on the intercom, alerting us to a computer problem "Only effecting Skywest flights" and that the plane couldn't, leave the gate since without the computer they couldn't do anything, but don't worry we would have it all cleared up in 20 minutes. 1 hour and 40 minutes later, they started to taxi around the tarmac in an effort to look like we were getting somewhere. At 2 hours we did finally get into the gate. We were told that most outbound flights were delayed so, Hurry and get to your gate and you can probably still get your connection. I rushed, I made it onto the plane. After about 20 minutes I noticed that we were not moving. Within a few minutes the flight crew arrives. The pilot announces that since they had been stuck on the Tarmac just like the rest of us, that they were about to "Time Out:" and that they were waiting for another flight crew to come aboard so that they could take over in Fresno. A few minutes later they announce that "The Flight crew has arrived and they are waiting on the Jetway for paperwork." Another hour passes, and still no flight crew. At exactly 2 hours after closing the plane they open it again, this time to announce that since they don't have seats for the new flight crew (There was 2 Deadhead crew already on the plane) that they would have to trade out the flight crew now. (Why it took them 2 hours to make this decision I don't know) At this time a New Voice comes over the intercom announcing that "If You are going to get off Plane do so Now." No explanation just a threatening voice, with no offer to re-book on another plane. Around 15 minutes later the captain (1st Crew) walks back into the cabin to explain what was going on and says that the new crew would be on the plane in a few minutes. Around 20 minutes later the new crew does arrive, and the Captain announces that as soon as they completed the inspection, and they had completed paper work we would be leaving, "It should be about 20 minutes". We all had a good laugh. I have never heard passengers catcall the pilot before. Well after another hour (The flight is now 4.5 hours late in departure) they push us back from the gate and start the plane. We eventually take off and arrive in Fresno 5 hours late.

|  Houston to Saint Louis. No notification of delays. Delays for over 2 hrs. Zero customer service. Never will use again. Cheapest and poorest run airline I have ever flown. I wish I could change but not even given an option.

|  United lost my luggage on my flight from Los Angeles to San Francisco. Upon arrival at SFO they told us they have found the luggage at LAX and that they will deliver it in the evening since they have a flight every hour. After we went to our house we checked with the automated messaging system and that we get a message saying that it is out for delivery. We were waiting for the whole night since it had very important item in it but with no avail. Finally we contacted the agents but they did not have any communication with their drivers to tell us the ETA. On our earlier flight from SFO to LAX they lost 9 out of 10 luggage. We received those luggages three days later at our vacation destination. We had to endure those three important vacation days without required medication and daily requirement needs in our vacation. Of course no compensation for all those pain and inconvenience at all. In my view United is in-efficient with bad management to cause me this kind of inconvenience and pain for being it's customer. I would not recommend it for anyone unless this is the only airline that is left in the world.

|  Cancun to Montreal via Dulles. I am a frequent traveler, first and last time with United. Our flights from Montréal to Dulles and from Dulles to Cancun were OK, no more no less, had to pay for anything more than drinks. Staff wasn't particularly nice, nor rude, just doing their job. The way back, though. Another story. The flight from Cancun to Dulles was juste a few minutes late, no big deal. Pilot put the pedal to the metal and we were actually there in advance. Then our flight to Montreal was delayed. By 30 min, then 1 hour, then 2 hours, 2 and a half... Next thing we know, it is past midnight and our flight is cancelled. We waited at the ticket counter for 20 min to be transfered on another flight, only to finally have them tell us that they're re-switching us back on the same flight that they decided last minute to postpone to the following morning. Caused all kinds of problems at check-in after we spent the night at the airport hotel, since they gave the flight a different number. Needless to say the plane was 20 min late the following day. Never flying United again. Lost 8 hours of work because of their disorganization.

|  Los Angeles to Medford. Flight on time, but this aircraft is incredibly cramped, even in their so-called Economy Plus. In fact, I don't think it was any roomier than any of the other seats. The interior of the aircraft itself was tattered and worn. The flight attendant was very nice and professional, but her appearance could have been a bit more polished. I realize this is 2018 and working as a flight attendant isn't a beauty contest, but certainly there's a professional and corporate image to uphold, even at United.

|  Newark to Richmond. Just another classic landing without my luggage. Same as when i flew to Detroit, Chicago, etc. These clowns just cannot figure this not. Horrible horrible management. Never flying with United airlines  again.

|  Dublin to Raleigh via Newark. I have never left a review for an airline in 30 years of travel (first time for everything). Our flight experience yesterday was pretty bad, and after dealing with the customer service today, I feel the need to write this. First, dropping our checked bags at the Dublin airport took 50 minutes which I find ridiculous (thank goodness we arrived 3 hours early). The staff wasn't exactly efficient or in a hurry. Second, our flight was delayed 45 minutes to Newark. That's fine, delays happen, but when I tried asking a flight attendant if we were in jeopardy of missing our connection, it took 30 minutes for me to even flag someone down on the flight (even though my call light was on the whole time), and she was extremely rude and short. The flight attendants in general were less than friendly, especially when I asked if they had snacks for purchase and the attendant looked at me like I was dumb and said no. Got it. We finally arrive to our final destination in Raleigh and our bags did not arrive with us. We were informed they'd be on the next flight, but since we live three hours away, they said they would have them flown to Columbia, SC and would arrive Saturday night around 11pm, and then would be delivered to us.  No big deal again, we get these things happen. Well, here we are Sunday at 10:00am, and the bags are nowhere to be found.  It took me 30+ minutes to speak with someone in customer service and the language barrier is so bad, that I still don't know when our bags will arrive or why they didn't make the flight to Columbia last night. It’s not the poor man’s fault, sometimes it’s just too difficult for both parties. I asked to speak to a supervisor but was told he was busy and would call me back (doubtful). I also called back and asked if I could speak with someone whose native language was English to avoid the language barrier and frustration (two attempts failed). They finally told me calls are globally routed and I'd have to keep calling until a native English speaker answered (30 min wait time each call). This goes far beyond things out of United’s control happening, and today finally made me realize it’s just terrible customer service.  I am done making excuses for United and the people I have dealt with during my travels.  No desire to travel on this airline again. I’m flustered so I’m sure there are typos. Great trip where I got engaged and ended on a bad note. Now we need to buy a bunch of items just so we can go to work tomorrow morning.

| United must be trying to coerce Basic Economy buyers to upgrade by treating you like complete garbage. One of their rude staff members even told us our experience was the way it was (very very terrible) because we bought Basic Economy tickets. The staff from the DIA ticket counter to the gate were all unprofessional and rude. Our worst flight experience ever, and we've had many flights, was on this flight. This was the first time we bought a Basic Economy ticket, although unknowingly through a popular online reseller. So to start, we found out you only get one personal item and no small carry-on. Usually we have our small carry-on and personal item, which fit just fine under the seat with room to spare for our feet. Second, there is no online check-in, you will waste your time trying like I did. Third, when you go to the airport, numerous United signs tell you to use a kiosk to check in. That doesn't work either, as the kiosk instructs you to go to a ticketing agent to waste time. You have to look for a tiny little section off to the left that reads "Economy", where it is manned by a single representative. Fourth, once we got to the rude Economy ticketing agent, he pretended to not know why the kiosk rejected us so we had to show him. He quickly reminded us that we have the junk "Basic Economy" tickets. Then, we tried to hand our checked/labeled baggage to said rude agent since he had a scale one feet to his left, and he points to the other longer line and says "it goes over there". On to the bag line, the lady there was no better. She tells my wife in a rude tone (while also talking angrily to her coworkers), "License and boarding pass!" No "hello", no "how are you", not even a complete sentence, and they weren't even very busy so it surely couldn't have been that she was rushing or stressed out. After a very long security line wait with ultra slow TSA workers, we finally got to the gate and the door had just shut. This part was only partially United's fault due to lack of online check-in and their deceiving kiosk signs which wasted a good 30 minutes of precious time. The United gate agent was completely unprofessional and bitter and lacked any sympathy whatsoever. She kept telling me, in very stern fashion, to check my ticket next time as if I were new to flying. With a reluctant look on her face and body language, she got us onto a later flight. We lost our purchased seats, and my 8 year old was assigned a seat away from our group next to complete strangers. To conclude, making United staff do any extra work is a crime so steer clear of United Airlines.

|  Toronto to San Juan via Newark. This airline has very poor practices, and bad customer service. Our flight between Newark and San Juan my parents and I had paid extra ($75USD each) to pick our seats by getting economy plus. Upon checking in online, we discovered that they gave up our seats, and now we no longer had seats. We then called to get our seats back. This did not happen. They instead gave us seats close to each other. Okay fine... BUT when arriving to the airport we go to print our boarding passes and again discover that we DO NOT have seats! So we have been told on the phone to settle things at the Toronto airport, then we were told to settle things at the Newark airport, and finally we were told that they can’t do anything. Why did we spend about $250USD just to get shuffled around? Stop charging people for services that you are not providing. That is a scam, plain and simple. You said that it happens when aircrafts shift, but that’s your problem. I paid for this service and expect to get seats without the hassle that we have been through.

|  Newark to Los Angeles. 5 hour delay due to a missing crew member. Completely unacceptable and ridiculous excuse for delaying a flight for hundreds of customers. |  Newark to Rochester. The most unprofessional and arrogant experience. Flew into Newark, NJ and was immediately told our flight was delayed an hour. Several minutes later our flight was cancelled. No explanation offered. Absolutely horrible customer service at the counter. Exact words from our attendant "Mam I am not abliged to offer anything aside from a rescheduled flight at 8am tomorrow morning." They expect families with children and elders to stay in the horrible smelling and dirty airport for 20 hours. Despicable. Forever lost my business.
|  El Paso  to Houston. My family and I are never flying with United again! All their on time again and again slogans are bogus. Save yourself the hassle and your valuable time.

|  Phoenix to Denver. United has zero compassion for medical situations. Well, $200 change fee plus an additional $200 for a different day fare. Supervisor said “sorry nothing we can do”. I ate the original fare and booked her on Frontier, only to pick her up and take her back to our local hospital.  Thanks United for being so compassionate. I will never book a flight with you again.

|  Venice to Newark. Our 10:55 am Flight was initially delayed 2 hours and a food voucher was provided. At the gate it is announced the flight is delayed, for unknown reasons. Gate agents can’t provide any information on why we aren’t boarding, I was told they were making an engine repair, another woman was told they were replacing a windshield wiper. After more than 4 hours of being held hostage at the gate, we are finally provided with water. After six hours we are allowed to board. We taxi to the runway and are told we are 3rd in line for take off. Then the pilot announces they’ve exceeded ground hours and we are returning to the airport. Not a gate, but a small door. United has no gate at VCE, no United employees either. Baggage is delayed for about an hour, another hour in line for hotel voucher, another hour ride to the hotel, finally eat food at 9:30 pm. Back on the bus at 5:30am. Long day, tired, hungry, upset, no explanations. Not a good way to end a nice vacation. United offered no compensation other than the 600 euro as required by law. I would like to know why the flight was delayed, what was wrong with the plane, why so many small delays and no customer service.

|  Worst airline ever! Never will use them again! First, I bought a ticket in May for a wedding in September, the wedding was cancelled so I called to see what I could do. Then, I went on a trip from July 12-24 to Aruba, United cancelled out flight from Houston to Aruba and we had to fly all the way up to Newark, NJ and spend the night in the freezing cold airport in order to get to Aruba on time for our house check in. There is hardly any leg room, the workers are rude and very unhelpful! On the trip back we had to fly to Miami, we had to collect and recheck and repay for our luggage! $200 worth! Then, when I got home I checked the status of my refund only to find that they "can't refund my ticket" so now I am out almost $400 and they will be making money on the seat that I cancelled! Seriously wrong! If I was told I would get the refund, they should honor that regardless of the policy! That is misleading and theft! Worst airline ever! Do not use them unless you want to be screwed over, a lot!

|  My experience was horrible. I took 6 different flights with United Airlines within a 3 week period and they were never on time. Lost my luggage. I was upset about my lost luggage and when I entered Bangor a United employee told me to “change my tone or she would call the cops”. This is after I almost missed the second plane because there first one was yet again late. I chocked on the plane for 20 minutes because of how quickly I had to run to the next or I would have missed it. For the love of God avoid the steps on your vacation and take another airline.

|  Newark to Porto. I have never had an experience so horrible. The first day my flight was cancelled and rescheduled for the next day. I was told to file online and I have and still have not heard back. I have spent money on a train and a hotel I haven’t been there due to the delay and now I’m being told I probably will not be compensated. I am beyond furious and will never fly United again.

|  Newark to Venice. Never again will I fly United. This was the worst flight ever. For a transatlantic, red eye flight, the seats were unbelievably uncomfortable.  The padding was super thin, the headrests flopped over whenever you brushed against them, and the recline was non-existent in economy. I fly from NY to San Francisco a lot for work on American, their economy seats are like first class compared to these United seats. My United aircraft had the new Polaris design with smaller seats, it should be banned. The meals onboard were fine, for my son. I was jealous of his kids meal, dinosaur chicken nuggets and veggies. The adult meals, people were asking flight attendents what was in them, and the flight attendants didn't know. It was either "chicken", "veggie", or "pasta". If a flight attendant can't tell you what's in a meal, would you want to eat it? Seatback entertainment was above average, they had a good selection of TV and movies. And it worked well. I'm not flying United ever again. Maybe for a short flight, but not for an overseas or transcontinental flight. M

|  I broke my leg a week before a trip. Couldn’t get my money back so decided to go anyway. First they give you absolutely no option of extra legroom seating so a week after surgery I was stuck in the middle seat for hours. Not only that, I can’t walk and they made me feel like I was a complete burden. A wheelchair took forever even though we told them ahead of time we needed help. We flew Delta to our destination and it was awesome. United made the trip home 1000x worse. Like I was really planning on breaking my leg and having all the employees treat me like a joke. Never again will I fly United.

|  United Airlines allows their customers to be trapped at customs baggage claims for more than two and half hours with minimal information. We were told that it simply would take longer due to weather twice in that entire time. No information about missing flights was given. Due to the nature of customs people are told to not get in their bags or be on their phones. It also means we are without access to any food you may have packed. Unless it was less than 3.4 ounces, we have no access to drinks. If you want to not feel like a trapped animal, pick any other airline.

|  Denver to Wichita. It was my first time flying alone so you can imagine how terrifying it is to be stranded alone being a young woman in an airport. My flight was cancelled due to weather conditions so I'm told but I'm able to be on standby for the next flight out? I don't know how much sense that makes, because wouldn't the other flights be cancelled as well? Especially if the weather says it's only going to get worse. So i go to customer service, only for the lady to tell me my only options are to be on standby for a flight being that in the event a person don't show, I get to go home ? I paid about $500 for a flight that usually costs $120 only to be told the airline won't be doing what I payed them to do, their job. Instead I get a "sorry about that ", maybe 24hrs from now I'll get to go home! So I'm stuck in the airport until then, while I'm offered no compensation for wasting my time, being stranded, or causing me to have to call in to my job because the airline has failed me as a customer. Overall I'm still stuck and the airline hasn't taken responsibility for not doing their part as a business. My experience is ruined with this airline.

|  Columbus to Newark. Worst customer service in memory. Canceled original flight (UA4443) without any notification. When I inquired about what happened, the ticketing agent offered no explanation to me or the other two passengers that were at the counter with the same issue. Tried to book for a later flight, and the agent said he would oblige, but gave me a boarding pass for the next day, again without offering any explanation as to why. As a result of this debacle, I wound up having to pay for a hotel room that I did not use, and I had to cancel a meeting scheduled the following morning.

|  My wife and I are in our mid-60s and have flown extensively both on national and international flights, but our experience over the past two days with United Airlines is the worst flying experience we have ever had from an airlines. First, our flight on Monday from Geneva to Newark was problematic and when we landed we received a cell phone apology and told that we could receive a "token" concrete apology if we went online (no thanks). At Newark our direct flight to Milwaukee was first delayed two hours due to the crew not yet arriving and then it was cancelled entirely. UA first told us that we would not be able to fly out until Wednesday evening, two days later than our schedule and they would not pay for any hotel accommodations! There was a United flight to Milwaukee within the next two hours but it was full. When we again asked about flights to other airports they told us we could fly to Minneapolis, stay overnight at our own expense, and then fly to Chicago on Tuesday and then from Chicago to Milwaukee later that day. When we asked UA to pay for a Minneapolis hotel (they cancelled the flight!) the UA rep said that the cancellation was due to an "air traffic control situation" so UA wasn't going to do squat for us. We took the Minneapolis flight and the UA rep said our luggage would be put on that plane but when we arrived in Minneapolis the UA rep there told us our luggage was sent to Milwaukee! So no change of clothes or toiletries, just what we had in our carry on. The UA baggage chief in Minneapolis was curt and dismissive, and couldn't have cared less about us. We are now sitting in the Minneapolis Airport at 5 AM (and 4 hours of sleep in the hotel) after being in transit for 36 hours from Geneva, and can only wonder what is in store for us on the next two legs of our trip home. We have never experienced such poor service and no interest in customer care when foul ups occur on the airline's side. Avoid United Airlines! Our expenses are certainly piling up due to UA's actions (and non actions).

|  Seattle to Cody via Denver. Once again united has stranded thousands of people in Denver. They have no backup plan, no rooms available, no new flights to get you home, can't find your luggage. Last time I ever consider this want to be airline line for anything. Happens every time I fly them. Beware the difference between them and any other airline. Fly at your own risk and take a lot of extra money.

|  Seattle to Greenville. I called and asked United customer rep if the aircraft I was flying had a TV screen and they said yes. |  London to Chicago. Entertainment system didn't work, at all. The so called lunch consisted of one scrambled egg, no options. |  Montego Bay to Washington. I had a confirmed seat in row 32 with the rest of my family (With a paper to prove it) but this ridiculous airline changed my seat to row 12 with strangers and my family got to stay back. |  Bangkok to Seattle via San Francisco. Booked an ANA operated UA ticket from Bangkok to Tokyo, with inward connection on UA to Seattle via San Fran. I notified UA baggage services in Seattle and was told (very rudely) that because I didn’t have the claim ticket it wasn’t their fault but they would help anyway, which consisted of the agent logging my lost baggage in their “system” and washing their hands of it. The baggage agent in Seattle was shockingly rude and uncaring. Figuring that was the last I would hear from UA on this matter, I phoned ANA’s US reservation number and found someone who immediately took it upon herself to find a supervisor who called the Bangkok station manager. They found my bag and routed it to SeaTac airport on the next flight. I’m here picking up my bag, yet the UA bag tracking website and call center are still assuring me that, while My bag has not been found, they are attempting to locate it. I also just spoke to the same rude UA baggage agent, who rudely assured me again they are doing everything they can to locate my bag. What startling incompetence - it’s a wonder UA can keep the airplanes serviced and in the air. Thanks for nothing, United.

|  Newark to Seattle. Dreadful experience. Was booked on a 1615 flight to Seattle. The flight was cancelled on account of bad weather. United automatically rebooked me on the 1850 flight. | Flew United Airlines from Newark to Tampa. The worst experience with an airline I’ve ever had. They do not allow disabled people to board first, nor if you have a child over 2. |  Flight delayed from Denver to Helena 2 times! From the time I left to go to the airport in Colorado Springs and fly with United to Helena I could have driven in almost the same amount of time. |  Columbia to Tokyo via Denver. I checked into my flight 1 hour prior to takeoff as I had multiple connecting flights, first one was domestic to Colorado.
