Needless to say, I will never fly United Airlines again even if they offered free flights.

|  Not only was my flight delayed and I wasn’t notified, but then when I got on the plane in Portland bound for Chicago, they told me I would need to gate check my bag and pick it up at my final destination in Omaha. So now I am spending an extra 6 hours in Chicago and when I finally get to Omaha at nearly 11 PM ( originally scheduled to land at 5:09 PM), I need to go to baggage claim. Not happy and I will avoid flying United in the future at all costs!

|  Denver to Columbus. Nickeled and dimed, even for a carry-on. Customer support wasn't even interested in hearing it - they just kept spouting that if I had purchased through their site rather than Expedia, then I would have known better. Apparently half their flights don't even include one single carry-on. How on earth is someone supposed to bring clothing??

|  Dallas Ft Worth to Denver. The rudest crew and unfriendliest flying experience. I get it, that was an early flight. Eat some chocolate and chug a coffee, no need to be mean or rude when I or any of my other surrounding passengers didn’t do anything to deserve it. Especially when I’m tired and stressed, but still manage every please, thank you, ma’ams and sirs while smiling like I’m a morning person (which I’m not!). If you don’t want to work don’t be here

|  Newark to Phoenix. This was the worst airline I’ve ever flown. My husband and I were not seated together I was in row 28 and he was in row 38 with 2 gentlemen of about 7 ft tall. They were father and son basketball players the son with ASU. My husband was bruised on his foot by the lack of room in the seats. The bathrooms were locked for the first hour while the inept crew attended a woman with a seizure probably due to the excessive heat in the cabin. Another woman threw up and there was no cart service for the first half of the trip. When I spoke to the crew about the heat that was so bad most people were spillled over into the aisle as the seats were suffocating. I was told to turn on my air vent which was fully open. Duh! We were instructed to only use the bathroom in our assigned cabin, once they were finally open. The access to the bathroom was obstructed by the stretched out legs of the 7 ft man who should never been moved to the last row where the seat room is mallet due to airline design and lack of reclining seats although the row in front reclines into thenpassengers face

| Washington to Panama. Most horrible airline i’ve ever flown with. 20 minutes of storm means 12 hours of delay. They kept postponing the boarding time so you keep counting the hours down but then they keep adding them up. The resources or explanations are not given to any of the passengers, so we just get told to ‘sit down and relax’ like sitting ducks. While we are all here missing our next transit flights, but they couldnt care less.

|  Flew Los Angeles to Milan via Newark. What a horrible experience with United Airlines. This so called company is great at taking your money but if there is one bit of an issue, then you have to speak with a supposed customer service that is in the Philippines and all they do is say "sorry, so sorry you have a bad opinion of us". We've been stuck without any clothes or hotel and they basically wash their hands and blame it on the airlines. I used them once before and spent over $15K with them and more of the same. It was my mistake to comeback for a second round of abuse with this so called company.

| Our flight was delayed, then we boarded. After numerous announcements we would be leaving we were asked to reboard. Twice a flight attendant was rude, cart with water and snacks pushed away from me. We were offered a meal voucher which we never got because they took so long to distribute them and when I got close was told we were boarding. After everyone was seated and thought we were finally leaving we were told the plane needed 20 minutes to fuel. An hour later we were told there was another delay because commissary hadn't delivered yet. At that point passengers raised objections to the delay while flight attendants laughed at us. My wife and I were stunned at how unprofessional they handled the situation. We arrived 5.5 hours late in Houston.

|  We did not leave Melbourne until 1.5 hours after the departure time. Both my Daughter and myself did not mind but were concerned about our connecting flight. We were well treated and looked after on the plane and the staff were exceptional in their service to everyone. On landing we ran through the airport and yes we did miss our connection. At 64 years old its not an experience I wish to have again and not a nice start to our holiday. But this is nothing compared to the ignorant, arrogant and rushed manner that we were treated to all the way back to Australia on the return flight by a crew that treated everyone as if we should sit back say nothing and dont dare interfere with their time. I am not exaggerating their response. Should be ashamed of themselves. Shocking!

|  Charlotte to Newark. I will never fly United again, been here since 4.30pm to check in for a 6.30pm flight and right now it’s been delayed indefinitely until they can find a crew to come get us? It’s now close to 10pm and no word on when we will be leaving. I have been here for over 5 hours and counting for no reason regarding weather delays. They’ve provided water and snacks but that means nothing to us who have been waiting for hours and paid good money to fly with you.

|  The flight was frustrating. It left Seattle late and arrived late to Chicago. Connecting flight was cancelled. Teen traveling alone and she received very little help from United employees in finding new flight. New flight booked and then delayed twice as well. Gate assignment kept changing - very rough landing in Chicago as well. They refused to let her carry on her bag and when she finally arrived in Knoxville after a nightmare day of travel and United had lost her bag - left it in Chicago. My daughter felt like she never wants to fly United again!

|  Newark to Cancun. Worst nightmare ever, our flight at 7/16 was canceled at 9:30 am we were 10 standby so no flight that day. We setup for next day at 6:39 am and no advise that we had to go to another gate, we lost flight. Now we setup for 6:45 pm and we dont really know if we are going to meet our vacation deadline since we already missed the day. Some customer service are doing their job but some think their doing it free. They play with your pain and dont care about the customers, if they would call me about the canceled flight then everything would be different, we paid taxi 4 times already, food, aggravation, wasting our money in our vacation package all because United airlines irresponsible customer service that never told us that out original flight was canceled, this so aggravating. I hope no one has to suffer like we did and hope you get all this straighten.

| We were very disappointed in United Airlines! When we got to our gate at Salt Lake airport at 4pm there were travelers that had been waiting since 9am due to aircraft maintenance, (a hydraulic seal). It didn't delay our flight but put a bad taste in our mouth right from the beginning. The customer service on ground and in the air was just OK. After we boarded all the TV screens were flashing DirecTV propaganda. Saying to swipe your card now and then later saying it was $5.99 for flights under 2.5 hours and $7.99 for flights over 2.5 hours. But they offered a *very generous* discount of $2 each if you swipe the same card on 3 or more screens. They advertise that they have free wifi though! So we connected and downloaded their app with no problem. But after selecting a movie and pressing watch, it makes you enable airplane mode in case of a connection interruption. But after doing so and pressing watch again, it says it can't connect, the same thing happened on our return flight. Which I'm sure forces or tricks people into paying for the DirecTV, which was very glitchy and the sound quality was terrible. So I'm glad we didn't end up paying for that. We landed 10 minutes late and our connecting flight was on the other side of O'Hare and we had 15-20 minutes to get there. We got to the gate with 5 minutes to spare after running the whole way. On our return flight, there were tons of people in the gate room waiting because of another aircraft maintenance delay. This caused us to have to move gates which wasn't a huge deal but still annoying. Our flight was also delayed about 30 minutes. When we boarded the cabin it was very hot and stuffy and barely went away by the end of the flight. We were miserable the whole time. Needless to say their airplanes are not properly maintained and are way out of date, (they still had an ashtray in the bathroom). Compared to Delta, United couldn't be worse. Even Southwest and Frontier are better. 10 or 20 years ago all of this might not have even mattered. Can we say misappropriation of funds? In short, we will never be flying United Airlines ever again.

| I am a frequent flyer, but not with United, thank goodness. Top to bottom the worst customer service company I have ever experienced. I watched gate agents laugh while a senior citizen walked to a far gate location to find out his gate had been been changed. This company has a severe mean streak from flight attendants to gate agents to bag handlers. It is as though they hate their customers. I am forced to use them occasionally, but I have quit all of my overseas trips and 90% of my domestic. I cannot imagine any company that deals with customers that would even come close to being this bad.

|  Cancun to Houston. Our flight home from Cancun with United has been nothing but disastrous. We've been in the airport for hours with no guarantee of an expected arrival time or gate. We're definitely going to miss our connecting flight- and it looks like we "may" get home tomorrow. United staff have not been helpful or polite. Do not fly United, it's not worth saving the extra buck. I will never fly United again.

|  Boston to Chicago. Do not fly United! There are other airlines more committed to their customer service, value and accommodations with similar prices. Disappointment after disappointment. Long story short things change and I ended up needing to change the time of my flight. Their policy is a 200 dollar change fee which was just as much as the ticket. I even purchased the misleading insurance just in case this might happen and they ONLY cover it if the airline changes or cancels... useless. Other airlines including southwest and jet blue have change fees as low as 60 and some free! So apparently they have a better handle on how to accommodate their flyers. Then I get to the airport and your only allowed one personal shoulder bag or purse, no carry on. I had the tiniest purse and had to check my 15 pound carry on. I didn’t know Airlines don’t allow carry ons these days. (I purchased the basic ticket which was not that much cheaper than other airlines. Had I known this I would have paid more for the ticket with another airline and wouldn’t have to pay for a checked bag)I did not plan to check it and was supposed to change clothes for my destination to fit my busy schedule so was unable to do so. Much less value than other airlines with similar prices. No commitment to the customer experience, old unaccommodating policies and less value. I will absolutely not be flying United again since there is no reason to when I have multiple better choices.

|  I will never fly United again. My flight was delayed 5 hours and I received no notification so I arrived an hour and a half earlier than my original flight. I needed to get to my destination by a certain time for a very important and critical doctors appointment. They rebooked me to a flight that wasn't leaving for another 6 hours and the lady at the gate was so incredibly rude when I approached with questions. I have severe anxiety and was in tears and she complained to the baggage people on the phone aboute while I was standing in front of her. Worst flight service I've ever received.

|  San Francisco to Phoenix. I wish I could give this airline negative stars! I used to travel all of the time using any of the major airlines. I have gone through a lot in the last 5 years. Travel has been very scarce. I booked a 2 week trip overseas. My mistake was to let the touring company book the air for me and my second mistake was letting them choose United. They gave only a 45 minute wait between my 2nd and 3rd flight and the plane left over an hour late. Strike 1. My final flight of the day was with Lufthansa. Fortunately Lufthansa got me on another flight but I had to wait 7 hours in an airport. Thank you Lufthansa. Strike 2 United. Coming home from my trip the touring company booked me a 5 hour layover in San Francisco. I already had 24 hours of real traveling time scheduled. After 3 different gate changes in San Francisco they finally said they were having plane maintenance issues. An 8:00 pm flight has now been moved to 10:20 pm at yet another gate. The time I'm leaving this flight is later than my scheduled arrival! United Airlines cannot be trusted to take their passengers to their desired destination in a timely manner. For domestic flights I will now go with Southwest and for international I will go with Delta or Lufthansa.

|  Frankfurt to Miami. I checked in at the Nice, France airport with Lufthansa and received my three boarding passes. I didn't have to go through security at Frankfurt and after visiting the Lufthansa Star Alliance Lounge I walked to the boarding area. When I showed my boarding pass I was told that I needed to go to Document Check. I then got back in line and there was another problem so I went to the counter. I was told to go back to the end of the line and try again. I'm Group 1 so I wasn't happy about that. The third try I still could not get in through the gate. I was told that because I had an exit row seat I had to go through a different entrance. Good Grief. United is the only airline that I know of that seats 10 across in Premium Economy on a 777-300. The seats are tight with a 17 inch width. About 35 minutes after take-off, they turned the fasten seatbelt sign off. First came a bag of bread sticks, then came a small bottle of water, then came my food with plastic tableware and then the beverage cart with a complementary glass of wine or a beer. There was no hot or moist towel. After all food items were picked up, they came by with another glass of wine or beverage. The fasten seatbelt sign came on several times during the flight because of a very light chop. United has changed the recorded announcement to "Please fasten your seatbelt." The German speaking flight attendant had a very loud voice which would have made sleeping difficult, but in the economy cabin, they never turned off the lights or asked people to close their window shades so it was impossible for me to sleep. Prepare for landing, which means the fasten seatbelt sign is on and seats need to be upright was 50 minutes before landing, which makes for a long 50 minutes. When flying to Europe, I would recommend Lufthansa. On my flight a month earlier to Europe, Lufthansa turned off the fasten seatbelt sign seven minutes after take-off and it wasn't turned back on until 25 minutes to landing, a very quiet flight.

| Flew Houston to Ft Lauderdale. I do not usually write reviews on anything unless it stands out to me. This airline was the worst flying experience of my life. I travel often and have seen a lot but I have never ever had such an awful flight. Rather would stay home. I would pass up a free ticket for this airline. Beyond awful. Don’t fly United.

|  Atlanta to San Francisco. One of the most inconsiderate customer service experiences that I’ve ever had before with United Airlines! My family and I booked a one way flight from Atlanta to Reno, NV where we were catching a connecting flight in San Francisco on 7/10/18. After boarding the flight in Atlanta at 7:35a, we sat in our designated seats for nearly an hour due to mechanical difficulties that they were having with the plane. When nearing San Francisco, the pilot and his flight attendants informed us that we were behind schedule by 25 minutes but he had informed the supervisor of our late arrival due to multiple passengers with tight connecting flights that were boarding while we were still in flight. Our flight landed at 10:17am. Due to the pilot landing at the wrong gate, we sat on the plane an additional 10 minutes before they finally allowed us to exit which was approximately 10:25a. Our connecting flight also with United Airlines allowed passengers to board between 10:15a and stopped boarding at 10:25a. Again, we were under the impression that our flight was being held for us. Upon approaching the gate, the 2 people at the gate and customer service desk were the absolute rudest and the most inconsiderate. They stated that they never got word from the pilot about our late arrival. They attempted to split my family (my husband, myself, and our 7yo son) apart to catch different flights then recanted and stated that they were full. Our son is competing in the USA National Karate Competition in Reno, NV and had to be checked in by 4pm. We explained that to them. Still no remorse or apology or anything. Instead, they attempted to book us for a 9:30p flight which we refused. The only thing left for us to do as parents was to rent a car and tackle the 4hr drive! Of course the rental was over priced because it was last minute and being dropped off in a different state! This whole experience was absolutely horrible!

|  My last experience with UA was just utterly gross. I sat in economy on the way from Chicago to Maui (9 hour flight) with no inflight entertainment, they do offer WiFi that you have to pay 35 bucks for if you want to use your computer and they offer a movie streaming service which you can use in your own personal device (you can’t use this on your phone unless you have the United airlines app which you can download but you’d have to do it before your flight because on the flight you have to pay the internet in order to download it from the App Store. For your computer, you have to install certain softwares in order to stream them from your laptop. They offer food that they charge you for because it’s the passengers responsibility if they get hungry on a 9 hour flight apparently. The seat was tiny with the smallest amount of leg room you can imagine. Luckily I sat in the aisle seat so I was able to stretch my legs out into the aisle from time to time but if I kept my legs out for to long: a flight attendant would walk by having no promo em stepping on you or “inadvertently” kicking you as they walk through without any contrition. The flight attendant (I dread calling them that because they seldomly attended) would make her way down the aisle with a tray of coffee or tea, run out by the time she got to row 10 and never attend to the people passed that point. Finally when she did make it to me with her cart (which was 15 minutes before landing) I asked if I could get a coffee and cranberry juice and she snarled at me with the response “ok I really have to keep it moving”. Overhead compartments was so small and people were playing a really tricky game of Tetris to make their stuff fit in. The electrical outlet was humongous so my charger for phone and computer kept falling out and the only way I could charge is if I physically held the charger in the outlet. The food that I ended up paying for was gross and cold and the bread was stale and difficult to chew. They put up a sheer curtain between first class and economy so that you’re teased by the huge personal TVs and vast space they have. Clearly a ploy so that you only buy first class tickets since the alternative is physically painful. The bathrooms had toilet paper all over the floor (clearly no one tends to them during the flight). The call lights I would press for the flight “attendant” were just promptly turned off without anyone swinging by to see if there was anything that I needed. Honestly, so many more issues to list, it was mortifying flying with UA and I really do not know how they are still in business when you compare thEm to other American airlines

|  Absolutely horrible experience flying United from San Antonio to Cancun! I understand that things happen but United seriously dropped the ball today. Every flight was over and hour late, over booked and hot! Worst customer service when trying to get a new flight due to a 108 minute delay on our first flight causing us to miss our connecting flight. I was hung up on when trying to get a new connecting flight. Overall nothing has been pleasant about this trip. Unacceptable for how much money we passengers pay. If we can punctual for the flight so should the airline!

|  Newark to Ft Lauderdale. I’ve used United Airlines a lot this year (even flew from Florida to Hong Kong with them) and it has let me down every time. It has by far, the worst customer service. The staff is rude, super unhelpful and definitely not prepared. Absolutely every flight I’ve tried United has been delayed and I’ve had lost my connections. They never give updates on any information and when you ask for some they simply answer “they don’t know”. They do not care enough to help you fix things they just treat you like trash and relocate you, making it worse. Super awful experiences. I do not recommend United Airlines to anyone.

|  I want to acknowledge the special treatment that was given to my special need son while we flying from Frankfurt to Washington yesterday. The United airlines staff was very accommodating right from the moment we had to check in at Frankfurt. My son was given a priority tag on his wheelchair and consequently our whole family was treated the same way along with our son throughout. The guide stayed with us until we boarded the plane. The boarding counter lady was super nice and was really worried about getting us in first of all after the business class got in the plane. In the plane the flight attendants offered us every help possible and kept asking if my son is doing okay throughout. The lady attendant also brought my son a banana and some delicious chocolates, probably from the business class menu items. When we finally reached the destination not only we promptly received our son's wheelchair but also another special need helper was there with my sons name on an iPad displayed to guide us our way to the luggage carousel. I am super impressed they treated us throughout. We were a little hesitant to use the airline at first but now will use it over and over again.

|  Manchester to Houston via Newark. Never in my life have I had a worse experience with an airline. My two flights from Houston to Manchester were both delayed by three hours, but that's not even the worst of it! My flight back from Manchester was delayed over 5 hours! It was so bad that I missed my connecting flight to Houston and had to wait an entire day for a returning flight. And just when I thought I might finally be able to go home, that flight was delayed three hours too. When we finally got on the plane it took another hour to actually take off! I missed all my plans for the day at home because I was waiting 29 hours for a returning flight, and I now hate United Airlines with a flaming passion. Whatever you do, never ever fly with United Airlines, it is a massive waste of precious time and money and the awful service is nowhere near worth it.

|  My flight from Hong Kong to Newark then Dallas. However, on July 3 the storm would not let this plane landed, they had to fly to Boston instead. Although I had some difficulties but United did take care of me although they had many people to care for. They first gave $20 meal voucher, then after a few hours they could not find new plane, they booked me to a hotel and booked me through American Airline to fly me back from Boston to Dallas the next day. This is the first time I experienced this problem, but they did take care of us. I want to say thank you.

| Boston to Orlando. My overall experience was absolutely terrible, my inbound flight got delayed four times and a total of 3 hours. When I finally got to my destination and asked for help at customer service they said they couldn’t help me, not to mention that I had to wait two hours to get my suitcase worst start to my vacation ever! Wait but it’s not over getting home my flight ended up taking off late but I wasn’t surprised at all! Then getting to the airport my suitcase was put on the wrong airplane and I had to wait a hour and a half again. Overall experience was terrible and unless I can feel valued right about now I will never be riding with United and will recommend to anyone not to take that airline either.

| Flew roundtrip Chattanooga to Portland, ME I have not flown for several years, so prepared for challenges. Well, kudos to TSA recheck. Made security one big breeze. The plane in both directions were very small and had no overheads to accommodate the regulation size carryons which was included in my fare. Flying Economy Plus? Not sure, they have so many different levels depending on what a la cartes you picked! First the ticket agent in Chattanooga made me check my carry on and pay  $25. When got to gate the same agent gave everyone in boarding area baggage tags to check them for free on the jetway! Did file complaint with United and they have responded to my issue with a refund, so one plus for them. But, the agent, hopefully, will be reprimanded. It was dishonest to charge me and I did not realize till I boarded plane. Return flight, we got in early. They did not have bags in jetway as we deplaned! Instead, we waited 45 minutes after 11 PM for bags to enter carousel in baggage claim. Very exhausting that time of night. Why did they not make it convenient for us to grab as we got off plane? Overall, flying pinched inside a tiny seat with little leg room was awful. the plane was 57 degrees on return flight and stewardess said they were working on -  did finally begin to warm after 2 hours, just before landing. Did not partake of the free drinks and pretzels, so can't speak to snacks, seem crazy in short legs of flight. Would not look forward to flying again and booking online. Too many options you can pick from that just keep adding up and seem annoyingly presented on entire page to get you to spend more. Used to fly a lot, and will not miss it if never go again.

| United's flight from Denver, 1.5 hours late. Missed airport pickup, had to pay for another ride $28. Pilot said we were waiting for mechanics to come to tighten some bolts (I do not know if he was speaking seriously). Food on board not as described on menu: hamburger had no lettuce, tomatoes, or pickles as promised. As small as it was and served bare it was just like a 99c white castle hamburger. Seats comfortable and cabin crew kind and gentle. Agent at PSP kept trying to get money from me: first he claimed I'd have to remove 3 lbs b/c suitcase was 73 lbs. He had another bag on the scale. After removing it he said I was 1lb over and I said that 23 kilos is 51 lbs. He didn't care. Then insisted I pay $25 to check a suitcase even though was making an international connexion to one of their partners, but the swarthy 20-year old doesn't know what qualifies as a connexion. I couldn't convince him or his supervisor and they refused to call a ticketing expert. I was firm and insistent but because this supervisor told me I was rude (limited vocabulary), I paid the fine. I am constantly baffled that people who hate coming into contact with the public and who have no talent for customer service seem to be hired by United again and again.

| Our group was returning to the US after two weeks of international travel. At the United terminal we endured an overbooked check-in with rude ground agents. Some of our group waited for seat assignments until the plane was almost fully loaded despite the tickets being purchased a year in advance. The inflight service was just as rude as what we experienced in the terminal. Air New Zealand (the service we used in Australia and New Zealand) by comparison was staffed with a pleasant, polite and accommodating in flight crew. United needs to revisit customer service training of their entire staff. Improvement is sorely needed. Very disappointed and dissatisfied!

|  Norfolk to San Diego. Worst experience I've ever had flying. Every gate they told me to go to was wrong. I had no forewarning over the PA or on the website, flight gets delayed. These people have no care for your time and provide no real service or anything they just want your money. I'm never flying with United again. I've never had an experience this displeasing flying across the country.

| Palm Springs to New York via San Francisco. You always know discourtesy is coming when the airport clerks refuse to wear their name plates. Charged me $25 for suitcase even though am making an international connexion. Agents don't know LGA and JFK are "co-terminals" in NYC and that an Intl connexion in North America is 12 hours. Although I was the only customer there they refused to call their international desk but instead called me "rude" because I was firm. I just paid the fine because I know the next step after they call you rude is to call a SWAT team to arrest you. This is usual customer service in 2018. They just want money and they want a lot of it.

|  First time flying with United and last time. Horrible experience our flight was canceled just when we were on the plane ready to leave, not delayed, canceled! They kept giving us the runaround, they aggravate the customer even more with their senseless behavior. I don't recommend United.

|  Terrible customer service. My wife missed her connecting flight because of a delayed flight and had to sleep at the airport because United would not get her a hotel. Not only that, but they did not offer anything else for the inconvenience. Will never being flying United again. They do not take care of their customers at all!

|  Newark to San Antonio. Worst airline ever, 3 hours delayed and still sitting. Pilot and staff have no idea when it is going to be on air. I frankly don’t know how it is in business with such low ratings.

|  Traverse City to Newark. This is the worst airline I have ever flown. Every time I have flown United there has been delays. The weather is perfect both in my departing city and arriving city. There are no mechanical problems with the plane, but now we are sitting in the runway delayed for 1 hour. They give no explanation for the delay and no compensation Is provided. I am on a very small plane with only 3 seats in a row and no room for overhead storage. This airline should be ashamed.

| Las Vegas to Chicago via Los Angeles. On a business trip. Aircraft were relatively old and nothing special about the crew or the flights. The problem occurred when was flying from ORD to NYC LaGuardia LGA flight was supposed to leave at 5pm suddenly flight got cancelled without further information except due to weather conditions. The 4pm flight is going ahead and the 6pm flight as well. To my surprise the 3pm, 5pm and 7pm flights are cancelled to NYC however the 4pm, 6pm and 8pm flights are normal operation. Then the chaos started tried to rebook myself on a standby for the 6pm flight didn’t work out checked with the United staff and they are probably deaf or not listening or helping not knowing where my luggage are or how to locate them or where to go. No one from the ground staff is helping and all they say it’s due to weather we can’t help you and there’s no further flights to NYC till tomorrow afternoon while I have to attend an important meeting at 8:30AM. This situation was just a joke. Eventually located my luggage which already been sent to LGA on the 6pm flight which I don’t understand how would they send luggage without the passenger being on board the flight and had to queue with my colleague for almost 2 hours to rebook ourselves. When we reached the counter the only option the clerk gave us was to rebook to Hartford which is 2 hrs away from NYC we had to accept that and sort ourselves from Hartford then that particular flight got delayed which makes it arrive in Hartford at 3am which impossible for us to find our way to NYC. Eventually we booked ourselves on a different airline and paid 500 USD each for a one way ticket from Chicago to New York City. Seriously the most unorganised airline in the world. Later on we discovered that they had a system failure and that’s why they couldn’t operate certain flights but to avoid compensating passengers or booking hotels for them they delcraed it’s due to weather. Will never fly with this airline ever again. It’s the first and last experience with them.

| Fort Lauderdale to Houston. Somehow United managed to turn from one of the best airlines in the US into the worst. Dated website and check-in portal that looks like it was developed in the 90s and has not been changed since then (especially the online check-in), non-transparent seating assignment for basic economy. I somehow end up at the very end of the plane almost every flight and sometimes separated from other family/friends on the same itinerary, despite early check-ins. Anyone from United can explain that? The airline has a low grade low-coster feel to it - old planes and dated looking everything. Did I mention the prices.... the ridiculous prices they charge for everything - even for basic economy airfare? Well there is a flex-economy, and a premium economy, and maybe an economy plus and economy XL to be added sometimes soon, but don't be optimistic with the names of tariffs. The price for airfare is ridiculously expensive, especially if you are based in Houston and out of luck as you don't have access to other airlines (United must be lobbying this very hard). Even the most basic economy option is way too expensive for domestic flights, especially if you want to pack up a swimming suite with you in a small suitcase as there comes the baggage fees, extra baggage fees if you take your small checked suitcase on board, pay if you want to sit next to the isle or window, or your family member, pay for obsolete entertainment options: lack of free wifi yet extremely slow if you finally decide to swipe your card for it. My favorite - pay if you want to watch Direct-TV on a contrast lacking micro-screen in front of you - a paid streaming TV on board of a plane - You. Must. Be. Kidding. Me! Culmination of this "entertainment" system happened on my recent night flight from Houston to Miami. The system glitched completely and was stuck in startup loop during the whole flight blasting that 100% brightness Direct-TV logo on and off (in my face!) the whole night without possibility to turn that screen off. Now to the meals and snacks! - What snacks!? - Ah the mini-pretzels and and that is it. At least soda and the lavatories are free for now! I have flown many airlines, and can confidently say that Easyjet, Southwest, AA and Delta are all better airlines then United, by all means - price, comfort, entertainment, convenience and transparency and fairness to its clients. How come I am able to fly between Miami, Vegas, LA and NY for 200-300$ with other airlines but it costs me at least 300$ to fly to the nearest major destination out of Houston, which most of the time is half the distance of the above-mentioned flights? How come low-costers in Europe can get you from Norway to Spain round-trip for 100$ while this behemoth is crying going out of business if they lower the prices. Unfortunately I am currently based in Houston and don't have much access to other airlines due to long lasting monopoly of this company on the local market so have to unwillingly stick to it. On the positive side I can mention ground and cabin crew. These folks are always welcoming. I used to like United Airlines back in the days, but if today you ask me to characterize and summarize this airline in 4 words, those words would be: expensive, dated, unfair and non-transparent.

| This is the worst airline, I thought it was Spirit but no its United Airlines. I flew basic economy and they give you nothing. If you do not pay for a bag you get treat like a third class citizen. I was not allowed to check in online I had to go to the airport to check in and then see an agent so she could check my bag to make sure it wasn't too large to fit in the small box. I asked for assistance, the agent was very rude, she never came to help I had to figure things out myself and then on top of that I still didnt even get an assigned seat. After checking in you have to go to the to the gate and let the agent give you a seat after everyone else is assigned, this is only one step above standby. Everyone was scattered throughout the plane and no one was sitting with their family, people had to switch seats on their own. I paid for a checked bag for my wife and her bag never made it into the plane. We were told that they would have to deliver it. We arrive oh are at 7.30am and the bag wouldn't be delivered until after 2.30pm. We had to contact her doctor to call in her prescription to the pharmacy because it was in her bag.

| Flew United Airlines from Nashville to Alaska via Denver. Worst flight ever. Cable didn’t work, headphone port was broken, sat on the tarmac for over an hour after landing and crew was unsympathetic and rude. This is why I fly American.

| Buffalo to Chicago. Terrible is not even close to how bad this airline is. To begin, my flight here was delayed a full hour. Now my flight was cancelled last minute and after trying to contact the company they said our only option was to travel back home 2 days after  our scheduled date. We asked about stand by and they said there was no way we could do stand by because the flights were completely booked. First of all that's a lie. Then they said they'd be able to get us on separate flights one at 11am and the other at 550 the next day. So we accepted since it's better than waiting 2 days. we decided to go to the airport an hour after talking on the phone since we weren't near the airport at that time and the man on the counter said we were able to get on a flight that same night which was the flight after the one we were scheduled to get on but since the other lady had already booked our separate flights it was no longer an option. So already beyond annoyed at this point. My friend then goes to the airport at 8am the next day for his 11am flight and they tell him that there's plenty available space on the 830am flight!  How was this not mentioned the day before. He barely made it to the 830am flight and then I decided to head to the airport straight after to see if I can get on the next flight home. They finally allowed me to do standby but 2 flights later still no space according to them. I am missing work and important meetings because employees don't care about their customers. I will never fly United again.

|  So disappointed! Actually the cabin staff were great, but there is no support of the company if the flight got delayed and you end up losing your transfer! I am now in Washington airport and I need to wait for one day, my flight in Beijing delayed for 2 hours, and consequently I lost my flight to Brazil, the company gave me no help, no place to stay overnight, only gave me a coupon that I could call a number so I could get discount for a hotel. I called the number and there was no available room, they gave me two choices: or you call the number and stay in a hotel or you spend the night inside the airport. Which kind of airline company does that? I unfortunately wouldn't recommend this airline due to this issues.

|  Tortola to San Francisco. United have no regard for their customers. We (group of 6) booked our flight 6 months ago. In that time our flight has been changed 4 times. A little over a week ago our flight was changed again and we called the airline to make sure that we would make it to our connection in time. we were assured that we would. Yesterday, halfway through our vacation, they changed our flights again. Now we are not on the same airplane and don’t have seats together and United are claiming they “cannot” upgrade us to economy plus so that we can all be together without charging us extra money even though our flight situation is all due to their screwup. they put us on a flight which they claim is illegal due to the narrow connection time being impossible to make. My family is done taking United flights and we are closing our United credit cards. this airline has gone so downhill it is in no way worth the cost.

| An absolute nightmare. I am a 1k premier member only due to business travel. United has the absolute worst customer care in the industry. A result of grossly deficient leadership in the corporate office, where accountability is a foreign concept. I feel for those United employees that truly do care and try to help customers. I fly approximately 25 flights a year with United. 70% are delayed or I experience an issue. I dream of the day when I no longer have to board another United flight. It is very sad to see what United has done to a once proud and enjoyable carrier called Continental. I have attached a picture of the customer care counter where four agents were available despite 13 kiosks.

|  Los Angeles to Newark. Worst airline. We booked basic economy on orbitz and we did not know this had no carry on and we had a 6 month old baby. They made us feel terrible because we asked to take one carry on which had the baby stuff. My husband and I had to sit in different area on the airplane even though we have a baby and they were very rude to us.  Never ever will fly this airline.

| Tokyo to Washington. Poor value. We paid over $10,000 for round trip from Louisville to Ho Chi Minh. The flight over was via ANA with the usual excellent experience. The return is via United and I am not at all happy with the business class cabin. I’m in an inside seat with a row of four. I’m 6’2” and I’m not able to lay in this park bench seat. Do your research before booking. I’m going to spend the next 14 hours stuffed in a sardine can.

|  My parents and I flew from San Francisco to Honolulu with United. The flight was operated by a B737 and did not have flatbeds in the premium cabin, but the seats were comfortable enough to sleep during the flight. The crew was very nice and greeted us with an Aloha. As probably everybody else on the plane we were on vacation and everybody on the aircraft was in a good mood. The service and the crew were perfect and I enjoyed my salmon. The departure was punctual and everything was to our satisfaction. I would choose United on my future flights and recommend this airline.

| Calgary to Flint via Denver / Chicago. I had six different flights. Of the six, 5 left late for a variety of reasons. I am highly disappointed in United Airlines. I had to rush and rush and rush, to get to my gate, and the flight was delayed. I was not pleased by all this lateness.

|  Kansas to Frankfurt via Chicago, connecting to Cairo. My wife broke her hip in Jerusalem requiring a hospital stay and an immediate return to Kansas as well as a cancelling of vacation stopovers in Athens and Germany. United charged us an additional $9500 which was approximately the same as what we prepaid for both of our First Class tickets. They would not bargain, at all. As my wife was in great pain and an immediate return to the US was needed I had no choice. I contacted United upon my return to no avail. United is now my last choice for flying overseas. We are returning to Europe soon and have friends there. We always will fly First Class, just not with United.

|  Los Angeles to Pittsburgh via San Francisco. It was a rough trip flying back home to Pittsburgh. My family and I woke up bright and early at 4am to avoid LA traffic. Our flight was originally around 6-7am but then I was notified of a delay. Because we had a layover, we would not make our second flight home. I had to change my flight last minute which was fine because we were only maybe an hour behind schedule. My family and I were finally on our first flight and I was getting ready to sleep for the next 5 hours before landing in DC. I believe it was the autopilot who came on to talk about how they were having issues with the plane but he assured us that they are working on it. First they had the maintenance people come, then there was something about paperwork needing to be signed and finally, the autopilot mentioned that the gas was in the wrong area or chamber. I've sat on this plane for maybe an hour and half and now I'm rushing to call customer service to get me on the next flight ASAP because the flight was cancelled. Apparantly, the next two flight to SF was booked but my family of 3 can be waitlisted in case someone canceled. Did I mention that one man was absolutely going nuts when we all got off the plane? He mentioned something about his brother is on life support. There was also a huge line of people waiting to be waitlisted. However, I manage to book a flight for 12:58pm. At this point, my family and I have been at the airport for 7 hours. Finally, we get on the 12:58pm plane and we land in DC on time for our flight to Pittsburgh. It was storming on and off while on the first plane with plenty of turbulance. We were also delayed on the second flight! I thought they were going cancel our flight due to weather but they didn't and we did manage to get to Pittsburgh around 11-12pm. United Airline actually gave my family $300 for our next flight but the chances of us flying ever again is slim. This whole trip was an absolute nightmare with the delays and cancellation. On top of that, sitting in economy class is the most uncomfortable place to be. Honestly, take some advice from people who make genuinely comfortable lounge chairs with cushions in it please. There was absolutely no support at all and no room on the plane. The only good thing about the flights was that I was given free apple juice. I will never fly again if I can avoid it.

|  Newark to Reykjavík. This is so far the worst airline from my experience. The flight was supposed to depart at 10:30pm and it’s delayed for 7 hours. It’s worst of all worst airlines. We were not given any food/water and place to stay. I have decided not to fly through united irrespective of the cost.

|  Los Angeles to Melbourne. United just don't get it despite what their competition is doing. I've just paid over $8,000 for a business class ticket return Melbourne Los Angeles and get asked to pay for "premium" scotch in their new lounge. We're not talking about top shelf scotch either - try standard 10 yr Glenfiddich at about $50/bottle. For free one can have some bottom of the rung local bourbon. United don't seem to function with anything other than a penny wise, pound foolish philosophy. I am looking forward to booking with Virgin Australia or Qantas for my next similar flight. On the flight over I was underwhelmed by the cramped business class capsule. The seat was comfortable but I'm slim. And I felt that I just fitted into the seat width. Service was non existent. Had to ring the service buzzer twice for water. Never handed out bottles when lights go out like other airlines. Neither did they go around asking selfish passengers to close their window blind when most were trying to sleep with daylight outside. On a 14 hr flight this is detrimental to all the other passengers wellbeing as it made it hard to sleep. There is basically no storage in the capsule in front of one, or to the side. The limited storage is behind and to the side, right where all the cables for headphones and chargers sit. Their business class cabin looks cheap. It is serviced like a cheap budget airline. But they know how to charge like a premier airline. They can't even offer a business class passenger before departing on a 15 hour flight a free scotch. Except you can have a very cheap bourbon. Cheap seems to be their mantra.

|  I was scheduled to fly from Washington DC (IAD) to Newark (EWR) with United Airlines and then continue via SAS from EWR to Copenhagen. Due to weather issues in the greater NY area the United flight was delayed by 6 hours and my connecting flight had left when I arrived at EWR. At IAD I had explained to United agents that my luggage was checked in all the way to Copenhagen, and that I needed guidance regarding if/how/where I needed to pick up my luggage when arriving in EWR. I was simply told to explain my situation to United agents when arriving at EWR. Following guidance from the United flight crew I stood in line for two hours to speak to a United agent at the United EWR customer care booth located next to my arrival gate. When I finally talked to an agent I was asked to go to the United baggage claim booth. After having waited another hour the United baggage claim agent informed me that she had located the luggage, but that I had to wait at least another 5 hours for my bag to be brought to the United baggage claim area. I was then told to show up 8.30 AM the following day to collect my luggage (*note that after arriving at EWR Scandinavian Airlines had manage to re-book me via American Airlines to go to Miami and then via a SAS flight to Copenhagen). By the time United told me to leave without my luggage it was 12.30 AM in the night – 12.5 hours after departing IAD airport. I was offered no hotel options. After having spent 35 min a cab to reach a friend’s apartment in NYC I spent another 30 min in a cab ($150 out of pocket) and returned to EWR 7.30 AM the following day to collect my luggage. A third United agent then told me that they could not locate my luggage in their system and that it likely was with SAS. I was then told that since the SAS office only opens 9 AM the right thing would have been to wait the five hours the previous night. This conversation took 30 secs and it was made very clear that this was not United problem and that I was advised to board my American Airlines flight without my luggage and file a lost luggage complaint with SAS upon arriving in Copenhagen, which I then did. I arrived in Copenhagen 8 am and had to continue straight to my air-bnb and then to the university. At this point I had slept 2-3 hours since my departure at Dulles on the 19th (2 days ago) and I had no new clothes to change into. Upon returning to IAD from Copenhagen on June 24th I still had not received my luggage. After being passed from one United agent to another at IAD I was told that my luggage was at EWR. I filed a lost luggage complaint with United and since received around 10 text messages saying that my luggage was not located. Early morning 12.39 AM on June 27th, while asleep, I get a text by a private company contracted by United stating that they are “attempting to deliver my luggage” and I am asked to call/text to confirm my address. 6.02 AM I write back to confirm my address and I text the private agent to call me before dropping off my luggage. I leave my apartment 6.40 AM only to discover that the private agent had left my luggage outside my building without notifying me.

|  Washington to Frankfurt. United Airlines continues to disappoint, which is why I have not flown them on an International flight for 4+ years. Was attracted by the "hype" of the new Polaris service, but it is much-ado-about-nothing. IAH President's Club is a joke. The beer & wine selection is limited to 1 or 2, or they want to charge $9 for a drink - nice touch after you have paid $5,000+ for a ticket. Food offerings consisted of some trail mix, some cold veggies & some soup. How United believe they can compete with this type of inferior International service is lost on me. No United Execs have apparently never flown on the International competition, or they would be embarrassed to hype Polaris. Flight attendant came around 1 time during the 1st hour of the flight - once. I had a glass of red wine, but when she returned for her 2nd visit, she announced they had already ran out of red wine for the remainder of the flight. This fairly well sums up the entire United approach to their International business class product. Won't fly them for another 4 years.

|  Los Angeles to Houston. Yet another dumpy old United plane. Further underscores why I never fly United for my International trips, and rarely fly them domestically. The only consistency with UAL is their continuing ability to disappoint. Both in equipment and service delivery. Even if you have a 1st class ticket it does not gain you entry to the UA Club Lounge, but that is no big loss, since UA's lounges are below mediocre at best. United, like American and Delta, are the best sales promotion tools that International airlines have.

|  Phoenix-Skyharbour to Chicago O’Hare. My flight departed from Terminal 2, which was a nice and quiet terminal without the regular airport hassle. There was no line at check-in and no line at security control. My flight was early in the morning and I had a light breakfast at the United Club. Interestingly enough, UA operates their won lounge at Phoenix: Staff was nice and the food offerings more than sufficient. It was a nice and calm lounge and the staff was very friendly. Even though it was before noon, the bar was already open and I had a drink or two. Boarding process at the gate was on time and professional, with us boarding in our boarding groups. The flight was good and the Economy Plus seat was comfortable and offered enough space. The A319 was stylish and had leather seats, Wifi and personal entertainment. Friendly crew, tasty food. I cannot complain and would choose United again.

|  Chicago to Munich. I reserved a seat in the Economy Plus section (emergency exit). Boarding was punctual and efficient.  I slept almost the entire flight. A friendly flight attendant woke me up for dinner to check if I would need anything. Whenever I woke up a couple times during the flight I saw that my empty water bottle had been replaced by a fresh one. I missed the ice cream but the flight attendant had reserved a cup for my breakfast. Seat was comfortable enough. I just used the TV the last hour before landing but the variety of programs is good. All in all a good flight with a friendly crew. I recommend United Airlines.

|  Houston to Frankfurt. Seats are much too narrow - you’ve got to hug yourself in order to leave your neighbor alone. My girlfriends entertainment system kept crashing. Everything seemed to be outdated and a bit dirty. Legroom in Premium economy was alright, but no space for the shoulders - it almost felt like a livestock transport. Service was nice, but I will avoid United in the future.

|  Las Vegas to Greenville. Never notified that flight was cancelled until checking bags. I didn’t get home until next day, had to sleep in airport, lost wages from job because returned a day late. I didn’t get a sorry, or a comp or anything I was thousands a miles away from my kids in Las Vegas scared and very bad experience for a first time flyer. I had a horrible experience and I have called and emailed headquarters and top officials and no reply or call back. Very unprofessional, very bad and unpleasant experience.

|  After a recent business trip to Tucson, my coworker and I received the worst customer service from not one, but two United representatives. We arrived at the Tucson airport about an hour and a half early and while we were heading to our gate we received a push notification that the flight was delayed so we went and grabbed food, and set up at a charging station a few gates down. When it was getting close to the time that we would need to start boarding, we walked over to the gate and found out that the flight left at its scheduled time. No updates, no announcement for boarding, nothing. The woman at the gate laughed it off saying that when the pilot wants to leave the pilot leaves. With no more flights leaving from Tucson that day on United, we were infuriated. The woman was not empathetic, wouldn’t look us in the eyes, and gave us no other options but to stay in Tucson (not comped by United, mind you) and arrive to Cleveland at 3pm the next day. We called the customer service line and the representative literally said “I don’t understand why you weren’t at your gate, you should have been there”. After he also unempathetically didn’t even try to help us, I asked to speak to a manager. I’m pretty sure I spoke to the same guy who just changed his voice into a higher pitched tone. He said the same and wouldn’t even give me a refund, gave me a hard time about missing the flight and said that he knows that they make courtesy announcements before taking off. Apparently you don’t, or I wouldn’t have been stranded in Tucson. After finally calling again and speaking to a much nicer woman, we were able to get a partial refund and bought tickets on American Airlines flying just a few hours later. I’ve never had such a poor customer service experience in my life and will never fly with United again unless absolutely necessary. Taking my business elsewhere!

|  Absolutely terrible service and we will never be flying with you guys ever again. We called the night before to make sure everything was okay with the flight and it was. So, we think that we will just be getting on another flight so we will still be able to get to our destination that day. We stood in line to check in for about 35 minutes and then the person there, after failing to put in our confrontation code 3 times, told us that our flight has been rescheduled for tomorrow and that we might not even be able to get on that flight. I’m really disappointed in United Airlines in their lack of communication. We weren’t even told why the flight was canceled. They wasted our time and lost our business. Not that they truly care but my mother’s family who were suppose to pick her up took the day off work and my mother, who hasn’t seen her family for many years now, is forced to go back home and wait because United Airlines can’t get their priority’s straight. Your customers should be your main priority and clearly they aren’t.

|  MBS Airport to Reno. Will never fly with United again. There were multiple maintenance issues - 2 on one layover at Denver, and 1 in chicago. The first time we called they hung up on us. All in all we were almost 7 hours late to our destination. I'm guessing they aren't using great planes if they had that many issues and awful customer service. Will not recommend to anyone.

|  Chicago to Phoenix. Due to a mechanical issue the airplane was delayed and we sat on the plane for 30-45 minutes. While I would have preferred an ontime arrival, delays can happen. The crew was very professional and served snacks and water and informed us continuously and the doors were reopened just in case somebody wanted to leave the aircraft. United proactively rebooked me on a later flight just in case the issue would not have been fixed. In the end we did depart with a delay. The rest of the flight was uneventful. I was flying Economy Plus and the seat was comfortable and offered enough legspace. United Economy Plus is the same seat and same onboard service as it is in regular Economy but with some inches of more legspace. I just flew with a different us carrier in the Premium Economy Class/Comfort Plus class and they also offer a free alcoholic drink and a premium snack in the Economy Plus section. United should do the same thing and upgrade the Economy Plus section.

|  Absolutely horrible, will not be flying United again even if I have to pay more. Terrible customer service. My plane way delayed for 5 hours because they were waiting for another plane to arrive. This caused many of us to miss our connecting flights, and minimal information was given. They did nothing to make this situation better for their customers. No company should be able to treat paying customers like this.

|  Denver to Albuquerque. From now on I will always pay more to avoid this airline. I’ve flown twice in the last month with United and both times were absolute terrible experiences. Long delays with minimal information provided as to why. You can’t bring a carry on if you’re flying basic economy class but they don’t have a good system for keeping track of baggage apparently because they managed to lose mine on a 45 minute direct flight. Pay extra to fly a different airline because this is trash.

|  I’m a small business owner, and if I treated my customers the way United Airlines treats their customers I would be out of business. I spent $2800 to fly my family to Turks and Caicos from Denver. When I asked why couldn’t it just be handled right now she said that is United Airlines policy. I’m sorry, but when your policy causes agitation to a customer, and you have no explanation besides it’s your policy then that is something that should be changed. I found it comical that United airlines employee tells me that I need to post on social media about how negative my experience was. I doubt that will do any good. Amazing that a company could be this big and provide such terrible service. If I could give them zero stars I would, I will not use United Airlines if I have a choice.

Houston to St. Louis. I never leave negative reviews. I typically do not think it is worthwhile. However, the treatment I received today was so incredibly rude I feel I need to share my experience. | Chicago to Ottawa. Got delayed 5 hours in the airport for a flight that takes 1 hour and 45 minutes. Not impressed with the airline at all. I am not even sure if there was even a scheduled flight. it seems like they are booking flights for nonexistent planes and crew.

|  Austin to Reno via San Francisco. This is the worst airline. My plane was delayed 4 hours in San Francisco the was my only first stop I was going to have. While we were in line one lady the was going to bord with us was checking the depart screen she said our fly was delayed by 4 hours and on the screen it says the this fly the leaves at 2:00 am it’s on time ugh even worst we waited for more people so they could have there plane full so they wouldn’t have to use 2 planes. |  This has been a horrible experience! My flight got delayed 15 hours. Then we waited for a new plane, which arrived but the crew has left already so they delayed it until 11:00 AM until the next morning. They did not provide a hotel, did not provide an alternative earlier flight, and refused to give a refund.

|  We arrived at 10 A.M. for a 12 am flight because that’s what you are told to do. We get to the airport only to find out it’s delayed for a little over an hour. No big deal we can still make our connecting flight well of corse not they delayed it another 30 min. We miss our connecting flight they can’t get us on another flor 4 hours. (9 hours) then that flight is delayed another hour. So 10 hours in airports to go to a place that would have taken me 8 hours to drive to. If I fly a discounted airline I expect this type of service because you get what you pay for but United although gives cut rate service their prices are not cut rate. Then I paid for upgraded seats but they said that didn’t matter anymore. This is the fourth time in a row flying United and having major issues. I can care less about food, chairs or even the way the flight crew treats passengers but don’t charge me to get to a destination that I could have driven to in a lot less time. I will be asking for some money back. Not a voucher either because I will never take united again unlesss I have a sudden urge to spend a whole day in the airport.
