I can’t even rate value for your money because they should pay me for my whole wasted day.

|  I have always thought that United is the worst, but for some unknown reason, I keep giving it another chance. I am currently sitting on a boarded plane that is delayed by six hours, and we have just been told that because of the massive delays, the crew can no longer fly us directly to Newark. We now will be going to San Fran in between. Oh and no one on board knows when we will actually take off. According to multiple flight attendants, there are no updates? So, we are stuck here on the plane with no options, no plan for leaving, and a required additional stop that was unplanned. United should take a hard look at airlines like EVA and Cathay, and learn a thing or two. It's shameful to pay for such abysmal service. Please do yourself a favor and choose any other airline.

|  Newark to Orange County. What a gross experience. The aisle was way too tiny to pass even for someone who is very petite making going to the filthy bathroom a chore. I had to go back to my seat in order for the snack cart to pass by. The economy plus really was a minus because we still didn't have ample leg space. What happened to the barf bags (just in case someone got sick) and the blankets and pillows? I think that we were overcharged for baggage. The aircraft loads by groups. We were in group 2. A fellow and his daughter, who were in group 4, got on the group 2 line. When he got to the gate, the attendant told him that he was in the wrong group but she would let me board "this time." He had 3 rolling cases plus a large backpack. The flight instructions specifically say "only one rolling case allowed per person". He was allowed to bring all 4 cases on the aircraft while people boarding in later groups had to check their carry on bag due to lack of room.

|  The ground service is really bad. I was on the flight from Denver to San Francisco via United Airlines, and was going to connect to another international flight. However, the flight from DEN to SFO delayed an hour and half, which made me only 30 minutes to get to my connection. Right after I got off the plane, I asked the ground service to give me a delay certificate, and they told me they didn’t have, and said that I should have asked when I was in DEN, but I was stuck on the plane for almost an hour, who can I ask for a delay certificate? The ground staff didn’t do the job well. They were supposed to know the situation of the flight and assist the passengers. When a flight delayed for an hour and half, they should have prepared delay certificates or at least told the passengers where to get the certificates. In the end, I ran to catch my coming flight and made it, but my luggage didn’t. It seems like United Airlines doesn’t care about their passengers if they can’t catch their connections.

| Washington Dulles to Philadelphia. This flight was delayed almost 3 hours because it originated in Orlando and they could not take off due to severe weather. I must mention that the airport staff once we were notified of the delay immediately brought plenty of water and snacks to distribute to all of us that we’re waiting and kept everyone informed with PA announcements and the gentleman at the desk was extremely patient answering every single question from all who came up to him. It really looks like United is trying to do the right thing. Once the aircraft arrived the flight lasted under an hour, we quickly boarded the aircraft and no time we had taken off and landed in Philadelphia. Kudos to United for a job well done!

|  London to Washington Dulles. My experience onboard was very pleasant. Usually on an international flight you get the better crew, everyone was very friendly, polite, and genuinely happy. The airplane looked and felt old, the screen to watch movies was a little bit larger than my iPhone X however the entertainment options were very good. On this 7.5 hour flight I was served one hot meal, one hot snack, a small snack, and unlimited beverages. One flight attendant was extremely nice to me and even brought me two ice cream’s. I upgraded to economy plus for around $200 and the only thing you get is more leg room. The seat is the same as in the regular economy cabin and the service is the same. The Internet I thought was very expensive around $30 for the entire flight so I passed on that option however I would definitely fly United again. Good job United it looks like you’re trying to fix your reputation!

| Flew Houston to St. Louis. This airline is terrible. They hit me with a last minute bag fee of $25 and I only had one bag. My return will include another $25. I had a very small bag but had large shampoo bottles in it so needed to check. Employees are rude. Plane was gross. Avoid United Airlines if possible.

|  Washington  to Seattle. Bad experience through out the journey with United Airlines: We booked the tickets with the infant who is going to sit in my lap. His name was not included in the boarding pass and we had to suffer standing in the long waiting lines. It's just common sense that when you give us an option to online check in, and we use it that means we want to avoid standing in lines. Since we are travelling with an infant on lap, and the flight had to start with 1 hr delay and we were on the runway, we asked if they can help me with something to keep my baby's milk fresh, they gave us the airsick bag full of ice for which I was happy, but unfortunately the bag was not water proof (not plastic, it was paper bag). We did not knew this and all our other bags became wet as the ice melted. This is a 5 hr 41 min flight, which means passengers expect some food on the flight. The male attendant was not at all cooperative with me or any of the passengers around me. I don't understand why they have a menu with 5 or 6 pages with different types of food options.May be they are using the same menu across all their domestic and international flights to save money from printing different menu cards for different routes. All over we had a very bad experience with United airlines and definitely will not take the flights nor recommend to anyone.

|  San Francisco to Orange County. I will avoid flying United at all costs. Their customer service is terrible and you have to pay to check in a bag if you buy economy. Didn’t even know that until I tried to check-in. They will find any way to nickel and dime you. I rather pay more and fly on another airline.

|  United Airlines at LAX literally the worst service I’ve ever received in my life and I have flown more than 3 dozen times. They forced me to check a small backpack for no reason other than I had a purse on me which they counted as another personal item. Many other people did this with much larger purses and carry on items. Complete and total garbage customer service at LAX. Will not fly United ever again even if it’s cheaper, especially in Los Angeles.

|  London to Denver. After flying BA and AA on this route I can safely say United Airlines is the worst airline. Certainly not the friendly skies! Food was poor. Aircrew were by comparison unattractive. Basically, after looking forward to flying on the Dreamliner, the way united have configured the plane and the service ruined my experience. Although leg room was fine, the seat width is dire. Also insisting on dimming the windows after lunch on a daytime flight with a daytime arrival at the destination is just plain dumb. If you have a choice, fly AA. I won't be choosing United for my next flight at all costs.

| Sacramento to Port of Spain via Houston. Worst trip ever. This was a nearly 6 hour overnight flight to Trinidad. We paid for extra leg room and got an additional 2 inches. No food was offered except a small bag of pretzels or small packages of food for fee. The seats were incredibly uncomfortable and some genius designed them so the controls for the video screen are on the top of the arm rest where most people put their elbows. My neighbor unintentionally reset the video throughout the trip. The video flashes endless ads for paid streaming access while you're trying to sleep. Even once I figured out how to turn it off my neighbor's elbow would turn it back on again. Who thought this was a good design idea? Finally, no pillows are offered and the courtesy "blanket" more closely resembled an oversized tea towel than a blanket.

|  Columbia to Chicago. United Airlines cancelled my return flight from Chicago to Columbia without any notice due to "operational difficulties." Ok, fine. Something occurred that may have been out of their control. Their response, however, was very poor in my opinion. I needed to change my flight into STL and rent a car to get to Columbia. This cost me an extra 170, plus gas. United didn't care at all to compensate me for these costs. Very poor customer relations - left a bad taste in my mouth.

|  I booked a flight out of Savannah to Philly. The flight flew to Newark, and I was informed at the last minute that I would have to take an Amtrak train from Newark to Philly as the 1 hour train ride was apart of my flight. Then on my flight back they made me miss my original flight because I did not check in at the Amtrak station. They then put me on another flight that was that was delayed for maintenance issues. Overall worst airline experience ever.

|  This was the worst experience I have had on an airline.  Our flight out of Aspen was delayed due to rain, which is normally for an Aspen Denver flight, however every person on the flight had tight connecting flights. The crew knowing many passengers needed to get off, would not open the door off the plane for 22 minutes. After majority of the passengers now need to run to the other side of Denver Terminal B (and for those who don’t know that’s close to a mile) we are told our plane will be waiting for our bags to be put on before take off. They were not. Not even put on the next flight, they will be arriving two days after our arrival. United so kindly asked us to pay for their drop off as well. Aside from incompetence, the aircraft themselves have abominable service, we flew first class and were served Mac and cheese as adults.

|  I strongly caution against flying United Airlines. They do not care about their customers, their customer's time, nor their money. On May 21, 2018, the United Airlines flight was canceled for 4 passengers, in which my husband and I had purchased all four tickets. This was the worst travel experience that I have encountered. The customer service of United Airlines is at most, deplorable. To begin, the flight that was canceled on 5/21/18 from BNA to IAH was canceled due to weather conditions that were non-existent. The cancellation was only reported 3-4 hours before the flight was set to take off. This placed us in a compromising position as we had a connecting flight to Honolulu (HNL) from Houston (IAH), the only flight for this destination, for that day. We had to scramble to find a nearby flight from Hunstville, AL, which is two hours away from where we reside. We attempted to call a United Airlines representative to help us find seats for all four passengers, but we were unsuccessful. My husband and I were the only couple that could fly from Huntsville into Houston and then into HNL. The other couple was forced to fly from Huntsville, to Denver, to San Francisco, to Los Angeles, and then to Honolulu. The customer service that we received over the phone from the representative was atrocious. The representative was ignorant when giving information on the flights, she rudely retorted comments back that reflected her ignorance, and due to her procrastination our travel plans were further delayed. We had to drive to the HSV airport and leave our car in long term parking. All of these incidents incurred an extra expense, for which should be compensated for by United Airlines. All we received was a measly flight credit of $75.00 for my husband and I and we purchased four tickets!

|  It has been more than three years since I have flown United Airlines. I stopped flying because of old planes, no in seat entertainment on long legs,poor service and surly flight attendants. Nothing has changed in these years. On my four hour leg (IAD to SEA) the entertainment system & wifi was down. Again, another United negative experience.

|  Los Angeles to Arcata via San Francisco. Absolutely the worst organization I've ever experienced, and I've been flying since I was 3 months old (24+ yrs). Every trip in the past 2 years has either been delayed or cancelled there's no point in even making a reservation because we end up renting a car and driving 8 hours anyway with little to no compensation for the flight. Have had multiple bags lost or 'misplaced'. I don't know how they can even keep business. Imagine if this was a 400$ hotel room and you get there to find your room isn't ready for 6 hours and they over booked so you have to stay in a budget hotel anyways, just ridiculous. meanwhile the executives are taking home million $ bonuses chartering private planes cause they don't even want to fly on their own airline. I feel bad for the employees who have to deal with all the customer service bs while they are just trying to do their job. The only positive thing I have to say is that the employees do try and are nice a majority of the time so please don't make it hard on them.

|  Shannon to Newark. Worst airline experience I’ve ever had. Flight was delayed because of mechanical problems and we were stuck for an hour and a half extra on the plane before departure. Then another hour after landing waiting on a gate on the other side of the airport and most everyone missed their connecting flights. Our connecting flight was then delayed again another hour and when we finally  arrived, we were stuck in a foreign country without our luggage because it “didn’t make our flight”. We had to call multiple times to get our luggage delivered. Will not fly again.

|  Worst flight experience I’ve ever had. When I got to the airport to drop off my bag (after self check in) it took 25 minutes for them to put a sticker on my bag and put it on the belt and I was the first one in line. There were only 3 people working and very long lines and wait times. When I got to the gate to fly out I heard that I would miss my connecting flight I went to talk to gate agents to see what my options are. They were not very helpful the only thing they did was rebook my on a flight for the morning and told me I’d have to figure out my plans once I was in Houston. They were condescending and blaming everything on policy. When I got to Houston, the customer service agents there were very helpful in getting me a room and other accommodations. But when I went to receive my checked bag for the night in the hotel, I was told that I was unable to get the bag and couldn’t have access to it til tomorrow. United is the worst airline I have flown, regarding everything from check in to reliability. At the Nashville airport there were 9 total delayed flights and 8 of them were United. I’ve also heard from several other guests that this is a common occurrence and had happened to them earlier this week. United needs some serious change in their operations as well as retraining employees.

|  I booked my flight along with my husbands flight 9 months in advance. The day before my flight I discovered I was only getting one boarding pass. My husbands flight booking was under a different conf #. This would be fine however the united miles plus card no longer applies to him, therefore he looses priority boarding AND United took it upon them selves to change our seating assignments to where we were no longer seated next to each other for 14 hr flights. I have never had my seating changed by any airline after choosing a seating assignment if they "cant be guaranteed" there is no advantage flying United over Southwest aside from paying more money. They had availability to accommodate to economy plus but of course wanted more money. we had to change flights adding a 4 hour layover and pickup arrangements just to sit next to each other. No wonder United ranks so poorly in customer service. I will avoid flying this airline at all costs in the future, its more important to try and suck another $300 out of a customer than accommodate and make it right. I will also be canceling my United Plus card as it serves no benefits. It does us no good to travel together if only one person on the card gets priority. I was on the phone for over an hour and 30 min with costumer service that is a joke. My time is money but obviously United does not care about that.

|  Chicago to Birmingham. Every time I fly with United it is an awful experience. They have the most rude, arrogant, and unhelpful agents at the gate and on the plane. If you want a pleasant experience avoid United.

|  My parents and I were travelling from Frankfurt to San Francisco with United Airlines. United has a dedicated check-in area in Frankfurt, with dedicated counters for premium cabins and frequent travellers. The check-in is operated by trained Lufthansa agents and was quick, friendly and easy. Thanks to our UA status we were allowed into the Lufthansa Senator lounge at Frankfurt airport and enjoyed our pre-boarding snack and drinks. I love United´s unique and efficient boarding process. We were seated in the Economy Plus section and had plenty of legspace. The food in Economy is okay, snacks were served throughout the flight and wine and beer is available in all travel classes for free. The staff was very nice and the flight was enjoyable. Good selection of movies, internet and power outlets are available. Condition of the airplane very good (well, the B747 is retired now and it’s the new 777). Overall a very pleasant flight with on-time arrival in San Francisco.

|  Las Vegas to Newark. So they waited until 30 minutes before boarding to tell us about a 3 hour delay. After this delay, they let us board. After letting everyone get boarded and situated, they announce another hour delay. Instead of waiting another hour to board, they packed us in like sardines and continued to delay the plane. I understand delays are our of their control, but tell us as you find out. Dont trick us into being stuck on the flight. Nothing was added for a 5 hour delay, 2 of which were spent on the plane, sitting still at the gate. We paid for a flight that leaves at 11:15am. So, if you can't accommodate me, let me know. Don't drag me along. Get better at organizing flights before you have a whole company that screws over thousands of people. Never flying United again.

|  Los Cabos to Portland via San Francisco. Absolutely terrible service. The employees in Mexico spoke better English then all but one person I encountered in San Francisco. Was told the incorrect gate multiple times causing my pregnant wife to have to trek from one end of the terminal to the other. Smallest amount of legroom yet and the leather seats are awful.

|  This has been the most inconvienent experience I have been through. The customer service was extremely difficult and did not provide any help whatsoever. I was sent back and forth across the airport to talk to different people and every worker I encountered was horrendously rude and inconsiderate to my situation. My original flight had been cancelled and I was informed that I may not be able to catch another flight for three days and that they would not be providing a hotel. I retrieved a ride and made it to my destination (13 hours later than I was supposed to be there) and proceeded to follow up with phone calls to ask where my baggage might be since the workers at the airport did not answer any of my questions. The people I spoke with on the phone were just as rude and inconsiderate as the other United Airlines workers I had previously spoke with. I will not be flying with them again. (I also did not get my money back and I purchesed traveler’s insurance).

| An incredibly disappointing experience on United. Traveling to the Bay Area for a conference, I booked this flight on a 777-200, thinking it might be kind of fun to fly on a domestic widebody and that the cramped 3-4-3 configuration would be fine. How wrong I was. There was a half-hour delay prior to departure — annoying, but not a big deal. Once on board, however, I noticed that the TVs had been removed and replaced with personal device entertainment holders. However, we were informed that the Wi-Fi did not work and, as such, we wouldn't be able to use the Personal Device Entertainment. A six hour flight with no TVs or Wi-Fi. Unbelievable. Throughout my whole experience, the crew was incredibly rude and inattentive. Upon landing at SFO, we waited on the taxiway for 50+ minutes since (as the captain told it) United operations had screwed up and didn't have a gate for us. There were a number of passengers connecting on to other destinations, many of which there is only one flight a day to from SFO. All told, we arrived at the gate around 1.5 hours late. Combined with our delay leaving BOS, many of my fellow passengers missed their connections and had to be put up overnight. My experience on the return flight was slightly better — the Wi-Fi/personal device entertainment worked and the crew was more courteous — but the damage had been done. If I have any choice, I'll never fly with United Airlines again.

|  This was my first time flying United and it was a nightmare! After being delayed for several hours we never got an update for the reason as to why. We then ended up missing our connection. Stood in customer service for over an hour. Not that it would have changed anything, but they didn’t even apologize. We then got on our flight and sat on the runway for 2 hours. There wasn’t one update at all! I mean come on. I thought I was being pranked. I asked the workers and they said they would let us know. Never did we hear anything or get an apology. Not even a free cocktail. Heck I would have been happy with some water when waiting for so long. This was terrible and I would never fly United again. I fly 100 times a year and this is by far the worst. Do not make the mistake flying United. I thought it was just bad luck all the negutivity surrounding them but it all makes sense. We then had to have a United employee help us find the new best route possible. We thought the experience was going to get better, wrong! He ended up booking us on to the wrong flight which we didn’t figure out until we were supposed to leave. I could keep going but I think you get the point. Whatever you do never fly United. Even if you have to pay a little bit more it could save your trip.

|  My husband and I are platinum members of this airline yet we have been truly shocked by the rudeness of the ground staff in so many cities - ORD, SFO, HKG, DTW, BOS and Milan come to mind as places where we have had multiple bad experiences. |  Newark to Tampa. Why are couples split up all over the plane? It is so rude and inconsiderate. Every couple we have met, including my husband and I are all split up. On top of all of this, we have been delayed for two hours because the pilots aren’t here, but the plane has been here an hour. Oh, and they made people check their carry-on luggage and pay the baggage fee. This is the most disgusting experience ever and it will be our last with this company.

|  Mexico City to Tulsa via Houston. My flight from Mexico City to Houston was delayed an hour. The women boarding the plane just picked random names. I’m confused on why the names aren’t in order! They should be first come first on a plane! So I didn’t get on it and was stuck in Houston until the next morning at 8am. But I’m mainly writing this review because everyone that works at United airlines in Houston TX are miserable. Everyone I’ve talked to has had an attitude and I don’t understand why. It’s your job - I’m just asking a question because I have no idea what to do! I’m by myself in a city I don’t know and a massive confusing airport, that likes to change gates regularly.

|  Las Vegas to Houston. Worst experience flying in 20 years. Flight delayed 4 hours and counting, notification was not sent until after the 2hr required time to be at the airport. The poor man behind the counter asked for help and with a line of 2 carrier and his supervisor said, "Just excuse yourself, they can wait." We asked for a pass to the lounge to pass the next 4 hours and they wanted to charge us 69.00 like we were walking in off the street. The inflight entertainment was not accessible and our tablets are brand new and we had to pay an extra 100 just to be able to sit in our seat without the person next to you sitting in your lap plus we paid 50 to check one bag a piece. I have always flown United but this may be our last trip for the price of our flight I have much better expectations. I have flown internationally and all over the US on many carriers and this has by far been my worst experience and this is the 2nd time this has happened to me at this airport. I am very disappointed.

|  I have not flown with United in years. My experience flying from Chicago to Detroit reminded me why. The flight stays option does not label information which causes confusion when reading. Not as if they were hungover from partying the night before. Hair a tangled mess and makeup smeared. Her attitude towards customers was welll below par, making faces after one gentlemen ordered extra and snarky with her responses. Needless to say I will not be returning.

|  My son traveled as an unaccompanied Minor from Harrisburg to El Paso with a stop in Chicago. I paid for him to have an escort & the airline did not provide an escort & left him alone the entire time. My son called me very upset that he couldn’t find the terminal or gate. It’s about time we stand up against the airlines for stealing our money & putting our children at risk!

|  Sioux Falls to Louisville via Chicago. |  San Francisco to Newark. We boarded the airline and within a few minutes it was announced that the hydraulic system lights malfunctioned, we waited inside the plane for 2 hours. |  This airline sucks, tried calling and they have a telemarketer and you have to speak to it instead of pressing numbers and they can't ever get anything you say right. |  Orlando to Washington. |  My flight was pushed back to 1 hour causing a chain reaction of people missing flights. |  Chicago to Maui via San Francisco. Not good. We were delayed by United. Upon finally arriving to our connecting flight we were forced to be late waiting for a gate to disembark. |  Worst customer service I have ever received from start to finish. I was told by the rep that they had no way of contacting the airport to let them know that there were passengers delayed from their first flight but would be arriving just as boarding closed. I asked to speak to someone else and the rep said "I can't transfer you, but you can call back and wait through it all again", not impressed. Then at the Buffalo airport we were reassured that we would make our second flight as long as this first one left on the scheduled time still, and if not we would be given a hotel room for the night, refunded for our hotel missed and sent out at 8:40 am the next day. Well what do you know, we missed our connecting flight by 5 minutes as they closed the gates, the "hotel" we were told we would be given was actually all booked as their was a rally in town and we were told we could "sleep on the safe airport floor" by the Supervisor at Washington-Dulles. Also, the 8:40 am flight we were told we would be on was actually 12:00 pm. Now for the "reimbursement" we were told we would get, that was a joke. We were told we would be reimbursed for our hotel that we had to stay in (IN VIRGINIA), the hotel we missed, our cab rides etc -  we were not. We were offered flight vouchers (I will never fly with them again) and then offered to be reimbursed for one night, and the cabs. Disgusting customer service. Everyone told us something different, and in the end we were out over $250 in the hotel room we missed, data overages to find accommodations and food. Book with anyone else, it is not worth the cheap ticket price.

| Kansas City to Chicago. Terrible experience! Total chaos. Time to board and everyone got up and assembled a line. Then, flight was delayed an hour, then it wasn’t. People were worried about getting their carry-on bags on because they kept announcing that it was a full flight and they were worried about space. So people were trying to get on plane as fast as they could to secure space. People were cutting in line and being super aggressive. The people in charge could have cared less. I have never seen a group of flight attendants so checked out.

|  I have a medical condition, as a result of neck injury, that requires medication that makes me very nauseous. It is always a problem when flying. I have vomited on the airplane in the past. However, my seat was changed and all United personnel refused to help me find a seat to accommodate me. Then when I arrived at my assigned seat 17D, I discovered the seat did not recline. Therefor I cannot wear my neck support either. I will never fly united again. They should be ashamed of their disregard for customer safety and comfort, as well as their terrible customer service.

| Check in staff were friendly and polite. There was a 20 minute delay due to congestion at Dulles. | Newark to Santa Barbara via San Francisco. Worst. Experience. Ever. From start to - and not even at our final destination yet. I’d give them zero stars if I could. Flight from Buffalo to Newark was delayed for 2 hours (understandable as I’ve traveled extensively in the past.) While waiting, the company tag line used on the plan to the passengers was as follows: “seems like its an electrical maintenance issue on Newark’s part. Sorry everyone.” Still relatively understandable. This made us miss our 2 other connecting flights moving forward. When trying to reroute our flights once we finally got to Newark, we asked the customer service rep for the airline to put us up in a hotel in San Francisco because we’d be stuck at the airport until 8:45 am (after landing around midnight as it was the earliest flight to Santa Barbara/home.) “No. It was because of weather. Horrible attitudes with the employees at the gate as well. Finally we were able to get on to our re-routed flight (which, by the way, was also delayed for almost 2 hours as well.) I have a roller bag that easily fits in the overhead compartment. Before the plane was even 1/2 full, they started pulling luggage to check in. At the gate, I explained explicitly said that if I check my bag, I need to grab it from the gate itself and not have them send it directly to our final destination (Santa Barbara) or the general checked-in luggage. There was plenty of overhead space by my seat, mind you. Nope! We had to leave the gated area to the baggage carousels, where the flight attendant told us to go, and nothing. No bag. Apparently they were “holding it” to get it on our last flight which leaves in 7 hours! I have things in there I need! And now the security checkpoint is closed so we can’t even get back into a nice quiet area to find a place to sleep for even a little bit because of the sheer lack of communication, horrible customer service, and complete lack of empathy. I will never again fly with United and I hope nobody else will either.

|  Boston to Newark. I used to fly United 50 weeks a year for 5 years and earn platinum status. I needed verification for luggage check in and I waited for more than 10 minutes.

| Worst airline ever. Midland airport is a joke, the lady working at the check in counter is the rudest lady ever. I always fly Southwest but had a Jamaica trip that required United. |  Delhi to Newark. Worst customer service. This is my second trip from India back and forth to America in 2 months due to unforeseen circumstances. First I thought that few of the crew members were rude. Now since I have flown so much in 2 months and I have not met one nice united crew members.
|  Washington to Paris. The Boeing 787 was the best part of this trip. It was comfortable and fresh. Service was good with on time departure and arrival. I thought food served was scarce though.

|  Miami to Las Vegas via Houston. Worst customer service ever and made me and my sons experience horrible. I missed my boarding time by 5mins even though my friend was on the phone with me while I was running to the gate because they told her to call me and tell me to hurry. So she got on the plane since they told her to and once she was on they told her they canceled me and my sons flight. There was no reason to not let me on the plane and and the lady I was speaking to was rude and also the lady my friend spoke to on the plane was rude! |  My flight from Chicago to New York La Guardia was supposed to leave at 5:00PM. Since then, the departure time has changed 6 times via the text updates. |  San Francisco to Tokyo Haneda. I've had mixed feelings about this airline. I was careless enough that the ANA ticket that I purchased was actually operated by United Airlines. We checked in Day of our flight with our luggage weighing less than 50 lbs, 5 luggage due to my star alliance gold status, along with my brother's normal traveler status. We were informed that the luggage will be offloaded in Haneda. This is a conflicting to the information I was provided few hours ago. The check in agent said "You can just re-check in to your next flght" I asked her, "are you sure", she was proud to answer "NO". Why suggest with utmost certainty to do such thing without verifying your sources. I had asked for supervisor and I was replied with "We do not have a supervisor, he is busy!" I am at my point of my fumes reaching to the airport's ceiling on the way how I am being handled. Finally, the supervisor at that time came and handled our baggage with manual baggage tags. These words were also added to our fiasco Agent: There is no way I will write manual airport codes with these baggage tags, they will get lost for sure. |  We were flying from STL on United to ORD. The STL departure was 10 minutes behind schedule. When we arrived at ohare at terminal B, our connecting flight started boarding at terminal F. | Two customers and I missed connecting flights to Orlando by 10 minutes due to a previously delayed United Airlines flight from Paducah. United does not care about their customers whatsoever. |  Worst experience ever. This is the second time my international flight gets messed up because of aircraft maintenance. | I would like to start off by saying I have never been treated so rudely by any other airline staff. I was supposed to fly from Newark to Miami on May 15. |  I traveled from Houston to Boston via Washington, DC on United Airlines in basic economy. |  Houston to San Francisco. I had an absolutely horrible experience with United (as I almost always do), but this time will never use them again. |  Albuquerque to Raleigh Durham via Denver. This has got to be the worst experience with an airline. |  Chicago to Charleston. Traveled with Frontier Airlines this weekend and it was delayed 7 hours and wasn’t sure if the flight was even going to leave the airport. | Are you joking United? On my flight TO EWR from SEA, I had a 3 hour delay. | Heathrow terminal 2 was pleasant enough and boarding started on time. The plane is old and lacks in a few places: built in screen was tiny and showed movies on a loop. |  I had the smoothest and the most comfortable ride on my flight back to Denver from Dallas. The flight crew was great. The only problem I had was at security at DFW. |  San Francisco to Chicago. If you fly United you better get used to delays. Worst airline service ever. I fly almost every week, mostly of the time by United, but thinking seriously about a change to Delta.

The staff on the flight from Houston to Frankfurt were surly, unhelpful and generally more concerned with chatting in the galley than taking care of customers in Business Class. Food quality has been in steady decline for years as has the wine choices. No drinks offered before departure even when specifically asked for. compared to the other airlines, United has become a budget airline but with premium prices. Management please take note! Now let’s get to the cabin itself. Foot rest was broken, literally in half. Seat sound system did not function. Time to change my allegiance.

|  Los Angeles to Honolulu. I had the most stressful time trying to rebook a flight I wasn’t going to make. I talked to three agents and my phone dropped the call twice. Finally I was given a phone number to call and the person that answered was amazing, he helped me out in finding a new flight for the best price, even though it wasn’t with United, and refunding me for the flight I had missed. After a stressful morning it was so nice having his help and it makes me want to fly with United more!

| San Francisco to Washington Dulles. They made us go to baggage claim for your carry-on. This is nonsense. We wanted to avoid baggage claim so we did carry-on but they made us to do baggagw claim anyway because the cabin is full. This is a bad design and bad customer service. They didn't even bring the bags to us which they took from us involuntarily. Very narrow seats and uncomfortable.

|  San Jose to Chicago. No food provided on the 4 hour flight. I was in row 35, and they ran out of food by row 30! It was an early flight, so no chance for breakfast, then I connected to another United flight will no time for food between. So, very poor performance. No apology from the staff - not their fault, though. Also a crummy little plane with no room, considering the length of the flight. No screens for movies, and no is to charge my phone. It was on time, so that's the main thing.

|  Norfolk to Los Angeles via Washington. Going into Norfolk was ok. But coming back was the worst experience ever. No room for my small carryall on the flightfrom Norfolk to DC do it was sent cargo all the way to LAX. I asked for a fragile tag and was told they would put that tag in my expensive carryall. That was not done. My carryall was scratched.  My seat on the flight to LAX was truly a nightmare of discomfort. The phone charger under the seat. And you had no mobility. No food — just pretzels. You need to pay me for replacing my carryall and the broken things. Very irresponsible. I dislike United attitude.

|  Chicago to Tucson. Nice people, clean planes. Entertainment is lousy. On American Airlines I can download the app in flight. On United you have to download the app before the flight, no one tell you this until you get to see it at 10,000 feet. I purchased the inflight internet. It is so bad, I still can’t download the app. Thanks for wasting my time. I’m not approving any more United Flights.

|  Newark to West Palm Beach . They make you check your carry on, saying bins are full. You get in plane and lots of bin space to put carry on. No one using common sense - bad customer service, flight attendant agreed with me and apologized. Had to wait at luggage claim for carry on.

| Washington to Nashville . Today, I remember why I avoid United Airlines at all costs. Not that I hadn't forgotten their unfriendly behavior in the past before, but you would think that after so much bad press and negative publicity, they would care to be more courteous to their customers and try to accommodate them more (at least more than competing airlines). You would think, but you would be wrong. United acts as if they are a "preferred" airline when really, I cringe at the thought of ever having to fly them. The only reason to consider them is cost, but you are giving up severe customer service while on board, while on the phone, or while trying to accommodate any emergencies that may come up. Their cancellation policy is bizarre and it isn't even clear on how you can cancel a flight on their website (it's not under their refunds/cancellations tab).

|  Houston to Detroit. I encountered the rudest and most unprofessional flight attendant. About 20 minutes after take off I had to use the restroom. I'm sitting towards the front of the plane in economy just next to the lavatory. It's lock and I haven't seen anyone go in or out. I look around the plane people are moving about and using the rest room in the rear of the plane. I proceed to head to the back of the plane to use the facilities when the flight attendant tells me to return to my seat. I explain my urgency and she proceeds to call me out over the intercom. I used the lavatory and proceeded back to my seat. She is now standing in the isle with the drink cart at my seat. With a disgusted tone she looks at the other attendant and says "Let me guess he's sitting right here" They both look at me like I have an arm growing out the side of my head and proceeds to tell me that there is a restroom right here, like I'm incapable of figuring that out on my own. I explain that it is locked! She flips the lavatory sign up and unlocked the door. What has happened to customer service these days?  I guess you get what you pay for.

|  Houston to St. Louis. Was 25 mins before board time and was not allowed to get my boarding pass, despite an empty security line and short walk to the gate. Customer service was rude and then thought replacing my ticket with a flight 7 hours later was acceptable. I was trying to see my little sisters college graduation, and I decided to try and catch my first flight and switch tickets back once I got to the gate. However, United had sold my seat in less than 10 mins, which makes me wonder if I actually had the seat in the first place? Overall, horrible experience. I ended up driving to a different airport and catching a flight on Southwest. On my way back to Houston, I wasn't allowed to print my boarding pass because I checked the box marked "no checked bags." Customer service lady was rude again and told me I would be charged $25 at the gate if I did not check my bag (which was a backpack). She proceeded to tell me that my "cheap" ticket did not come with guaranteed overhead bin space. Went to the gate and had no problem with the staff or using bin space. Didn't make sense why she would tell me that. I've always flown southwest and for some reason ended up with these United flights. They will be my last.

|  My family and I were traveling from Denver to São Paulo via Houston, and our international flight was delayed (11 hours) due to mechanical problems. United provided accommodation, but the staff was unnecessarily rude with passengers. We were all tired (we waited for almost 3 hours inside the plane until they decided to delay the flight for the next day), but little information was provided. For the ones who had connecting flights (that would be missed), the staff simply stated that they were off duty. I’ve heard and read about United lack of care with customers, but the way we were treated was lack of human decency. United never again!

| After a 2 hour maintenance delay and then having to deplane then reboard after another hour, I barely made my connecting flight and had to run through O'Hare to race to my gate. I barely made it to my connecting flight. Then I got on my plane to Honolulu which is a 9.5 hour flight. They told us there would not be wifi or entertainment available. 45 minutes later the pilot comes on and says we might need to deplane and there could be an hour delay because of some problems they were having with their entertainment system. I'm frustrated because I am anxiously going to see my husband coming home from a 7 month deployment. I also spent a lot of money on this flight. Worst flying experience ever. Never ever flying with United again.

| Charleston to Newark. I have flown with United for 4 years consistently now and have never had such a horrible experience as today. Customer service was terrible, no help was given, and no solution so I am now flying Delta. I arrived almost an hour and half before my flight - at 5:30am, bags paid for online and check in online done. All I needed to do was put my bags on the flight and get on security line - the line was so long that they pushed the 6:50am flight customers to the front, but when one woman complained about it, they sent us back and said that the flights would stand by for us since so many of us were on those flights. Being sent to the back of the line made me not get to security until 6:25am, with boarding ending at 6:30am. Furious no one could help me or would, and I managed to run to the gate and miss my flight by 5 minutes. I planned according as I have done for every single flight I have ever taken out of Charleston, and missed my flight because of incompetence and the disregard of United and airport employees. When I called to try and book another flight the representative was also extremely unhelpful only offering the most expensive routes or flights for tomorrow when I needed to be home today. When we mentioned I would be taking Delta he started badmouthing Delta and how it would be better to take United - rude, unhelpful, and disrespectful. The horrid stories of this airline disregarding customers needs or even attempting to be helpful have never been more evident than today and I am overjoyed with the care and kindness shown by Delta airlines. There is no doubt in my mind I will never fly United again.

|  Houston to London. United is horrible. We paid $1,100 to upgrade to First Class 8-9 months prior to the flight. Get to the airport and we are NOT upgraded. They say we paid to be in a waitlist.  They say they will refund our money (and 40,000 miles) ASAP. I get my credit card statement and they have only refunded $550! Why? Both our flights were on the same ticket. I’ve complained three times, only to get emailed back by three different people. They have not offered me one little thing for a big inconvenience of not flying first class, much less trying to scam me out of $550. We fly pretty often and we are done with United!

|  Grand Rapids to Brussels via Chicago. Our first plane was grounded for maintenance, and were stuck in GR for 4 hours. We missed a day of vacation, lost our personal pick up, lost a day at the hotel and our first class Euro train tickets. I paid for German airlines and United messed up so bad we had to take United to New Jersey. Our New Jersey flight was taking off late but had to be returned do to an passenger not being able to fly. I had to rebuy my euro train pass for twice what I originally paid and later then my original ticket. When we got to Brussels there was an extra security check just for United. Our seats were not on the ticket, even though I bought the tickets 4 months ago. On the way home from Brussels the scheduled the flight so tight that we had to rush to make the plane. You were not able to buy any food on the plane either. When we got to Chicago, again the transfer flight was so close we barely had time to get through customs with a few minutes to spare running through the terminal. But it was ok because they didn't have a plane to fly. We were another 2 hours late getting home due to no plane and when they got a plane it was held up for maintenance problems again. Most of the time me and my girlfriend didn't even get to sit next to each other. So after paying for a hotel stay we didn't use, extra 100 dollars in taxi fees, airlines I specifically paid for and was not able to use, an extra 300 dollars in euro train fares and lost time visiting my very close friend I had not seen in 6 years. United said the best they could do was give me 60 dollars in food vouchers. It was a horrible experience. I feel so bad for the two employees out of 15 that actually were nice.

|  Las Vegas to Newark. Flight was delayed 45 minutes to board and another 45 minutes in the aircraft for take off clearance. I was very anxious because i had a connection after Newark and it was doubtful i could make it. I asked the flight attendant and she couldn’t care less - she told me call your travel agent. Can you believe that. At that time a male flight attendant also on business class told me that if there is a problem United will book me on the next flight and told me not to worry. How hard was what be did? He was probably the only one paying attention to the training. Also the power socket on my seat was off. Again the female attendant turned her head the other way. The male attendant just said give me your cell phone i will have it charged for you. Again so simple.

|  Miami to Seattle via San Francisco. This was the worst flight we’ve ever flown on and we were a party of 7, 5 children and two adults we had to sit on the plane for three hours before it took off and they didn’t take off - going to San Francisco should have it gone to Denver to refill with fuel and then it flew to San Francisco. Instead of getting there at approximately 10:00 PM we got there at 2am with five kids and the employees on the aircraft were super rude to our teenage kids. United airlines has the worst customer service we’ve ever seen on an airline they are just completely horrible they don’t take care of their passengers, especially people traveling with children. We had to stay in San Francisco overnight and then get all split up with the family because there were seven of us to be able to get flown home my husband left with four children at 9:45 and I could not get a flight with my other son until 4 o’clock the next day. It was completely horrible the process of getting rebooked took over two hours in the night time with nobody waiting in line and we had to have five people help us to get this all sorted out with the manager stepping in.

|  Slow, thats how I feel everything goes on this airline. On my flight to visit family I didn’t make it to my destination until approx 26 hours from when I boarded the first flight. 3 flights later. We sat on tarmac at LAX for who knows (no one knew) said something with the bathrooms. They need to step up the efficiency made me miss my connecting. Sat on the plane for over an hour when I was almost the last one to board on the way back. This is just becoming commonplace with United I think. Please, people, we have places to be!

|  Tel Aviv to San Francisco. Polaris business class seat configuration of 2x2x2 in this Boeing 787-8. Not a typical configuration and a bit out of date set up. The seats are flat bed but all the lower part is not 180 degrees so if you are tall this seat is not comfortable at all – half part of your leg are in a strange angle. Food is not eatable and very basic. Service in minimal. Overall they do the minimum to take you in a 15hr flight. This time with no entertainment system at all -it was broken for all passengers

|  I was a bit nervous about flying United because I've heard so many bad reviews, but we flew from Dublin to Tampa via Washington and then Tampa to Dublin via Newark and on all 4 flights we were met with nothing but courtesy, efficiency, friendliness and helpfulness. There were delays encountered on the Tampa to Newark flight due to weather, but we were kept informed all along the way and were even booked onto a standby connection should we have missed our original connection in Newark. We caught the connection with minutes to spare and fully expected our luggage to miss the flight, but to our surprise and delight it was right there on the carousel when we arrived in Dublin. There was an off-duty Cabin Crew member sitting next to us on the Tampa to Newark flight and she was also helpful and friendly, even though she was off-duty. She got information for us about our connecting flight and showed us where the gate was. I would have no problem in recommending United to anyone, and will definitely be flying with them again.

|  Quebec to Newark. The staff was incredibly nice, but they had to follow whatever United airlines policy was. I was in Quebec City, where they speak both English and French. My carry on bag was forcefully checked in to be in cargo and it was not handled delicately, I was not told to take my laptop or valuables out, at least not in English, and my screen cracked in the process. I don't blame the staff, I blame a lack of communication and United Airlines wanting to check people's bags in so they don't have to deal with people needing to get their belongings out. Also, who ever handled cargo almost lost my luggage, I had to wait almost 24 hours to find out if they found it because it was a late transfer to the right connecting flight. From the update I got, it was in Chicago when my connecting flight was from Newark to San Jose.

|  Flying United was a great experience. A wonderful captain who kept us detailed through the flight and manuvered thru the turbulence. Me and my family cause a hold up for the other passengers by being the last people on board and the captain waited for us. We had 3 kids and they were more than patient making us feel as though we we're first class when we definitely we're not. The staff was kind and caring and wonderful with kids.

|  I have flown international numerous times and never has my checked luggage been so neglected than with United Airlines on my last trip from Taipei to Raleigh Durham via San Francisco. My luggage was left in the rain and all of my personal belongings were soaked and beginning to smell after nearly 24 hours of traveling. Once home, I was still able to ring out some of my clothing but multiple books, journals and magazines were ruined, swollen and tearing because they had been wet for hours. I was shocked no one even mentioned this to me or took responsibility for everything in the suitcase getting damaged. Luckily, my laptop and other electronics were with me as carry on baggage or they too would have been ruined. I would not trust United Airlines with my personal belongings in the future.

| Was not looking forward to the flights due to previous reviews. ZRH to EWR was fine, food OK (nothing special) but plenty of drinks runs and nice snack before landing. EWR to DEN full and late but staff did their best to dispell fears of tight connections. No food offered in Economy, even for a 4+ hrs flight! Soft drinks offered (and nice cabin crew gave a hot pizza, which was appreciated). DEN to RNO full and free entertainment given due to late departure. Overall, UA does not offer a sophisticated product but every member of staff I encountered was smiling, helpful and professional.

|  Phoenix to Houston to Orlando. My experience with United was superior! They went above and beyond to assist me. I missed my flight because of a traffic issue on the way to the airport. I was rebooked and arrived just 3 hours late, my seats were upgraded. I asked for nothing. After collecting my luggage for a 10 day vacation I went to the auto rental to pick up my car. It was there that I realized I had lost my wallet. A first for me and quite problematic. No license, no money, no credit cards , no atm. No ID at all. The car rental bluntly said, no license,no car! And so abruptly ended my vacation plans because I was to drive nearly 3 hrs to my destination. I was traveling solo. After filing a lost wallet report, I headed back to the United counter to see what I could do. By this time it was 8pm. The agents got very busy on their computers for reasons I did not know. Ultimately, they handed me a voucher for a hotel room, a thermos filled with toiletries , 2 meal vouchers and a return ticket to Phoenix in the morning at 8:30am. While it was a crisis situation for me, their concern and consideration went well beyond anything I expected. I was so very grateful for their assistance and to United Airlines.

|  Chicago to Kalamazoo. The heat was on so high, I felt sick. Everyone around me agreed. I asked the flight attendant and she rolled her eyes at me and ignored me when I asked if it could be turned down a bit. Customer service sucks. No smile, not polite, and plain irritating.

| I unfortunately had an awful experience with United Airlines. Initially, my flight was to be a series of connections from Alexandria - Houston - Chicago - Toronto. Weather delays caused the entire chain of my connections to be missed and land me in Toronto too late to catch my next flight with a different airline. So, they rerouted me so that my connections were now Alexandria-Houston-Toronto. United Airlines refused to compensate me in any way shape or form because they claimed that if I have to catch another flight with another airline, that is not their problem. You are an airline, your job is to get me from point A to point B, how you are refusing to do that is beyond me. I was then forced to reschedule the flight I had missed for another day, but of course I arrive back in Toronto and United Airlines had left my luggage at Houston airport. When I retrieved my luggage the following day, a wheel had been broken, forcing me to purchase another suitcase for the flight I had rescheduled. Not happy.

| Customer service sucks. Our United Airlines flight arrived late due to surprise de-icing? We arrived at gate 94 just in time to watch them close the door in front of us. The gate attendant, refused to make any attempt to get us on the plane and quickly rehearsed her "It's not my problem" script. We next had the misfortune of meeting the operations manager for United in Denver. He repeated the same "It's not my problem" script and then repeatedly refused to even help us to the customer service desk. Complete apathy and lack of ownership. The only small respite was a staff member who reluctantly agreed to help us complete a reimbursement request.

| Flew Newark to Savannah. I fly 4-6 times a year but never United. I have to say, I now know what all of the negative public reviews are about. I was yelled at by the boarding guy because he told me my bag was not compliant with flight regulations. I told him that my bag was compliant but that I had my handbag stacked on top which made it look bigger. He held up the line and made me place the bag in the size checker. I took out my shower shoes which I had just placed in the front pocket and he tried to publicly humiliate me as if I were senile if my bag at the gate. My husband told him that I literally just put them in the front pocket because they were in my hand bag and he was so rude and obnoxious to my husband whom never speaks and is a proper gentleman. Due to Inited’s notorious treatment of its customers, I told my husband it was not worth it and let’s just let her get on with it as my bag clearly fit and was compliant with regulations. I guess my point is never ever again will I fly this airline!

|  Indianapolis to Newark. The flight delayed for 7 hours because of waiting for aircraft. We had to fly with different airline to get to our destination on time to attend an important event. Furthermore, without notification, our seats on a return flight was automatically cancelled. As a result, we have to take a much later flight to go back home. Our overall experience with United airlines has been terrible!

|  London to Washington. United's Polaris Business Class service on this flight was efficient and friendly. The 787's business class arrangement is a bit better than that of the 777, but still lags behind the comfort of some of its competitors. Still, the food has been upgraded somewhat, but gone are some of the original Polaris amenities - ie., the second pillow, the bloody mary carts, etc. Slippers must be asked for. Overall it was comfortable with generally good service. Entertainment choices are immense. My main course, ravioli, was a bit too undercooked for my taste. I did not take the second meal, but it looked quite tasty. My only real complaint here would be the state of the toilet which was a mess within a couple hours of takeoff. Obviously no crew member ever looked. But it would be nice if United had someone straighten up the toilet at least once during the flight.

|  Seattle to Oklahoma City. Flight was delayed for maintenance at Sea Tac airport. They told us it would be about 17 minutes and we would make all connecting flights. Then it was delayed 30 minutes, then an hour before they finally boarded us. They told me I still might make my connecting flight from Denver to OKC, but if not, they would switch my flight to Tulsa which took off 35 minutes later. She said they'd take care of everything mid-air. They told us on the plane there would be CS reps to help us with our connections. It was one guy who simply asked where you were going and he'd direct you to the gate. I walked 30+ gates away to get to my connecting flight. They didn't have me in the system, and didn't have my luggage transferred. He sent me back to a United customer service desk that turned out to be closed when I got there. He closed the gate, so I couldn't make Tulsa either. So I had to go back 30 gates, stand in line for 2 hours, and be told I wouldn't be able to get to OKC until about 12:30. There were so many people in the customer service line, not just people from our flight. I didn't see this with any other airline as I walked through DIA. Once I finally got through the long line, the lady at the Customer Service desk was friendly and helpful as she could be given the circumstances, but United really blew it and I missed my mother's funeral.  I will never fly your airline again.

|  Washington to Zurich. We had a delay of 50 mins, but keep good informed. Seat comfy, IFE great and crew very friendly, always with a smile. We arrived a little late. Food was the mediocre and the same till month, but okay for a 7 hour flight. will fly United again.

|  Fort Lauderdale to Washington via Newark. This is the most terrible airline in the world. My flight was delayed and then my airline was understaffed causing me to miss my layover flight. There were no more flights to DCA for the rest of the night so they put me on a little plane and flew me to Richmond (three hours from my house) so I could then take a taxi all the way home. In the meantime losing my luggage and getting that three days later. Cherry on top - they refuse to give me a refund.

| Nightmare Experience. Flying from Edmonton to Norfolk. Spent 2 hours on the tarmac in Denver before flying to Newark. Newark was cancelling and delaying flights left and right. United rebooked me onto a flight to Norfolk 30 hours later and I was not going to waste a day in Newark. My fiance said he would drive to Richmond to come get me if I could book a flight there. First time rebooking to Richmond, the United Service Assistant was very rude and didn't seem to care about my situation. Ripped up my luggage tag, as it was on the back of my boarding pass, even though I had asked for it back and rebooked me on a flight to Richmond that left at 6.30. It was 6.20. Had to run down to the shuttle to get from Terminal C to Terminal A in order to get to my gate. Plane was gone by the time I got there. Stood in another customer service line to get onto another flight to Richmond. This service assistant was a lot more helpful and seemed like he cared. So thank you to him. Got me booked onto the next flight out to Richmond that night. Got to Richmond and my luggage was not there. Spoke to a luggage assistant there who was really kind and was able to locate my luggage without the luggage tag. Luggage was in Newark still and I could expect to see it delivered the following morning. I've been here for 2 days now and still do not have my luggage. Everytime I check or call the number all I'm told is that "staff are still in the process of locating my luggage". What happened? It feels like after I landed in Newark and the flights to Norfolk were cancelled that my luggage just got tossed aside somewhere and now they can't find it. That or it feels like it's not a priority to them. Maybe I'm being selfish, but I literally only have the clothes on my back and what was in my carry-on with me. I have prescriptions in my luggage that I'm going without. I leave in 3 weeks, so I hope to have my luggage by then. But I'm considering cancelling and rebooking my return trip with someone else because I don't want to have to relive this nightmare again. Wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy.

| San Francisco to Sacramento. Terrible service and attitude. I travel for a living and will continue to avoid flying with them unless it’s the last option! Bags were also late. It would seem fairly simple to me that service with a smile should be of the upmost priority. Hopefully they can and will put effort into fixing their issues.

|  Boston to Chicago. The flight was excellent and beyond expectation. Boarding went quickly and smoothly and we pushed back from the gate 10 minutes early. The IFE started to glitch out during the safety video, so the crew did a manual demonstration and also let us use the IFE for free (United normally charges for it). The service started a bit late but when it did the crew was friendly and energetic. I felt welcomed and it made my flight that much better. The legroom in Economy+ is excellent, it is almost 10 extra inches than regular economy - well worth the money! The seats were a bit tight in width but other than that, very comfortable. The pilots were interactive, keeping us informed. Overall it was a very good experience with United.

| Sacramento to San Francisco. I had some trouble with the self check-in and the staff that helped me were plain rude and arrogant. They showed no interest in helping me out and rolled there eyes at my questions. I had never used the machines before and the staff made me feel like the most stupid person on Earth. When my bag were checked in the man behind the counter threw my bag on the belt, no respect at all. The staff on the plane were lovely but that is ruined by the bad impression at check-in. United should have a talk with their staff about customer treatment!

| My fiancée and I booked our vacation back in September, so this should have been a very smooth trip. A couple days before our flight to Denver which was supposed to connect us to Vegas, United Airlines decided to switch our connecting flight and not update us about the change in connecting flights. Our new connecting flight was now leaving out of Washington D.C ten minutes after we were supposed to land. 1) Nobody can get off a plane and sprint down the terminal to board. 2) Our first flight out of Newark was delayed so our connecting flight left before we even landed in D.C. Now we have lost a day of vacation and hotel reservations that we can’t get a refund. We received a response from a United rep saying we could get more leg room on our next connecting flight, which is only 1 hour. I lost a day of vacation and only get maybe an extra foot of leg room on a one hour flight? No thank you. By far the worst experience flying and you can bet that I won’t be flying United Airlines ever again.

|  Norfolk to Boston via Newark. I have never written a review about a service before, but my experience was so bad with United that I felt compelled to. I had a round-trip from Norfolk(VA) to Boston(MA) with a connecting flight through Newark(NY.) Every flight was delayed or canceled -not delayed by a few minutes but hours. Delayed flights caused me to miss my connecting flights and have to rebook another flight. Delayed flights are one thing that I am capable of letting go. However, they didn't even load my bag on a flight home. When i asked about it they simply said "Oh it was supposed to come on an earlier flight but it got canceled." Okay so it was just forgotten? It feels like if the bags don't go as originally planned they get tossed somewhere and forgotten until I have to call them multiple times. Still currently waiting for my checked bag to come here on the next flight from Newark to Virginia. I was told it would be coming on flight 4925 - that flight was this morning. It's still in Newark. And I asked if they can be sure if my bag will make it on the next flight this afternoon, but they can't even confirm that. I'll just have to wait until they feel like sending it on the next flight. Who knows when that is. Completely terrible experience that I have never had before.  I suppose you pay for what you get. terrible service.

| Redmond to San Diego. I called a United to change a ticket I purchased with my United Airline credit card through the Hopper app. The Hopper app keeps an eye on all the airline prices and compares them for you. It will then alert you when an airline has dropped ticket prices. When I called United to change my ticket to use for another day, I fully expected to pay the usual $125.00 change fee. I was told that since I used the Hopper app, which they consider to be a travel agency, that I was going to be charged $200.00 along with $125.00 change fee. For a total of $325.00. Nice work United Airlines for completely ripping off your customer.

|  Fort Lauderdale to Salt Lake City with a change of planes in San Francisco to SLC (1 hr 32 min.) Airline travel is hard enough without punitive agents. On March 31 we were making a coast-to-coast trip after our cruise. Our return tickets from Fort Lauderdale to Salt Lake City were with United purchased through Expedia. Our day started at 4 am. Most airlines that I know of allow a carry on and a personal item policy. We chose the United flight because it got us back at a decent hour so we could make the 3.5-hour drive back to our home in Idaho. We had tried to print our boarding passes online with the ship’s computer/printer but were unable to with the directive we would have to see an agent at the airport. We were informed, when were arrived at the airport, that we would have to check our carry on bags because of the nature of the ticket we purchased. We weren't happy about it but did so at the extra cost of $25 a bag. We had purchased a basic economy flight ticket so that did not allow a carry on. We were placed in the very back row 38 and had a bumpy and straight-backed ride for over 6 hours. Fair enough. On arriving at San Francisco for our transfer flight of an hour and a half to SLC we had something to eat and waited. We were the last passengers to board the plane. As we were being checked in the United Agent stopped my wife. He/she said the carry on bag of my wife needed to be checked even though we had just gotten off a United jet of the same size and model so there was no question that it fit under the seat and that is the criteria that was listed by Expedia and United: “Carry-on bags are limited to one personal item that fits under the seat in front of you.” I have to interject here that my wife has used this same personal carry on bag for over 20 years of flying with all the major airlines United, Delta, American, Alaskan, and Frontier. No airline agent of flight attendant had ever given her a problem because of its size or dimensions (9x9x18). It always fit easily under the seat, even with the small computer planes that have much shorter routes with much smaller jets. My wife was forced to give up her personal bag before she could board the flight. My wife sent me on to board since my protests were falling on deaf ears. But after taking about 10 steps I turned around and went back to ask the agent if this had anything to do with the ticket we had purchased through Expedia? She/he said yes. So I went to board. My wife boarded about 3-5 minutes later and when she reached our back seats she was seething. She told me to guess what they had charged her to check her personal bag. I guessed $25? No. $50? No. She was charged $175.00! She told me she had felt bullied and belittled by what took place. This whole experience has soured us both towards flying with United Airlines. We have frequent flyer numbers with the airlines and this incident was completely out of character for the airlines that tout the “Friendly Skies”. It was illogical and unprofessional to treat loyal customers in that way.

|  Newark to Dublin. Most unfriendly staff ever. We are a family of 3 flying with a 3 year old, the flight is early in the morning, so we had toddler, who was sleep deprived and  we had separate seats with my husband. We asked at the gate to help us to seat together, explaining that it’s easier to handle our son together, but nobody bothered, basically, we were told, that’s our issue. In the plane my son has tantrum with crying, we tried to talk to other passengers, asking if there is a way to switch, no luck. Flight attendants just pass by saying “You are his mom, deal with it”, threatening to stop the plane taking off if I couldn’t have him seated. My explanation that I need at least my husband’s help or the window seat (preferably the second) are ignored. Finally, there is one very nice flight attendant (the only one who seems to care about passengers) who was able to switch us to the window seats, we calmed down our son and he fell asleep. Other flight attendants gave us really bad attitude, as if being a parent means to have a magic wand that will make a 3-year old behave like an adult and quietly sit through the 7-hour flight. In addition, there was no child meal that I ordered, and he refused to eat whatever they offered for adults (the food looked awful), so he had only muffin and a couple of cookies during the entire flight. Most family unfriendly airline, worst flight ever.

|  Peoria to Ft. Lauderdale via Chicago. The actual flight was fine and the staff was friendly but watching the crew literally toss the luggage on the assembly line to be put on the plane really annoyed me. Thankfully my suitcase has a hard outer shell, but more care should be taken with paying customers’ luggage.

|  Corpus Christi to Houston. Extremely rude flight attendant. I expressed that I had a very short time to make my connecting flight and she just said to leave my baggage outside the plane. You are allowed 1 carry on and 1 personal item. Both of my bags are not in my possession. I believe that United as a whole is a failure and needs to revamp the customer service they use to have. I am extremely disappointed almost every time I fly with United.

| Tampa to Houston. United is very unorganized and unaccommodating. We purchased two tickets at the same time and we are seated 17 rows apart! When we asked if there were any seats closer they had a quick now and asked us to move on. This airline seems to do little to show any shred of customer care. We will not be using this airline again.

| Chicago to Miami. So if I spend first class money, I expect first class accommodations. Purchased two round trip tickets for my wife and I. Both flights were first class. The outbound flight had a wonderful and friendly staff. But I was incredibly disappointed in the food choices. A burger is not an attractive option for a first class meal. Especially one with just cheese as a topping, and no lettuce, tomato, onion or anything. Plus I don’t eat meat, so I was thoroughly disappointed. Worse was the return flight. The seat, tray table and armrest was absolutely filthy. I did not feel comfortable sitting in the seat. It looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in days. Old food crumbs, hair, dust was prevalent. Could not believe United let this happen. I worked my way up in life to enjoy luxury. This ain’t luxury. I’d rather spend my hard earned money with another airline for real first class.

|  Nashville to Amsterdam via Washington-Dulles. We will never fly United again. Due to a mechanical failure, we were asked to get off our flight from IAD-AMS after an hour on the tarmac. We were then asked to check back at the gate in an hour for a status update, at which point they told us to check back in another two and a half hours, though they were already pulling our bags off the plane. It was obvious the flight was not going to take off, but we were strung along for three hours. When it was finally cancelled, we were asked to walk a half a mile from service desk at D15 to C20. Once there we waited for yet another hour in line. Here is where it got absurd…At the desk the United Service Rep printed out a hotel and 6 meal vouchers for us. While they are printing, our Rep and the other customer service reps were looking at the vouchers and talking about the fact they just said "invoice" on them next to payment method and how that was not normal. The manager comes out and tells them that "it will be fine and just keep printing them." The Rep hands the vouchers to us and away we go. We wait in line for the shuttle then wait in line for the Westin service desk only to find out the vouchers do not work since there is no credit card associated with them or no established account with the Westin!!! After waiting to get on the phone with one of the United service reps at Dulles, the rep tells us we must go back to the airport to pick up a new voucher with a number! Fortunately Westin knows how to provide Customer service and convinces the United Rep at Dulles to just send over some form via email and puts us up even without a payment method. This negotiation lasted two hours. At this point we have been traveling for 11 hours with only 1 hour in flight. Also none of our food vouchers work at the hotel for the same reason. The next morning we find out the United has not yet sent the form over or paid Westin for our stay. This is the third United flight I have taken in the last 2 months that has either been overbooked or cancel by mechanical failure. United flights are unreliable and their customer service is appalling. All they do is pass the blame and never resolve the issues they have caused. I urge you to not fly them and hopefully one day their awful customer service will put them out of business.

|  Detroit to Richmond. I fly monthly for my business and have experience with multiple airlines - United is the worst! Flew from Detroit to Richmond VA with an 1.5 hour layover in Washington Dulles. Landed in Washington only to be told there was a 5 hour delay on my flight to Richmond. Considering that I needed to get to Richmond early, I asked if there were any other options. Spoke with multiple United employees and their response was to drive the rest of the way. I had no choice, so I decided to rent a car. Then I was told they would not get my luggage off the plane, even considering the plane was going to be there for 5 hours. After speaking to multiple employees, I luckily found one that retrieved my bag. Now on my return, i drive to Richmond airport and then receive a text telling my that my flight from Richmond to Washington Dulles is delayed 3 hours and I would not make my flight back to Detroit. Luckily I had not returned my rental car yet, I park and go in to speak to an agent. Once again, nothing they can do. I have to switch my rental location back to Washington Dulles and drive there as fast as I can to make my flight back home. No options offered, no offer to cover my rental cost, nothing - dont fly United.

| Kalispell to Raleigh via Denver. I bought three airline tickets in January for our trip in March. On both our flights to NC and returning to MT we were spread out between multiple rows and not able to sit together. In addition we were all in the middle seats of the various rows. It makes no sense to me why a family of 3 traveling together cannot sit together. I will never fly United again.

|  I scheduled a round trip from Ontario to San Francisco. I was told my flight was cancelled due to weather condition at the counter when I was trying to check, and they said they sent me a text, which I received during my check in.
