I asked the lady who works at the Untied Counter, what are the alternative since the flight is cancelled, she told me I can take another flight which is about 2 hours away (Burbank CA), or come back tomorrow, I asked her how do I get to Burbank, she told me "I don't know, I don't deal with transportation." Then I asked her "Am I going to get reimbursement?" she replied: "I only check you in, I don't know about reimbursement, you should call United." I was on a business trip and my schedule was tight, and as I insist on a solution, at the next counter, China Airline's employee felt bad and helped me to found a solution to fly from the same airport going to San Francisco. As I was waiting for my flight, I tried to contact United, I was trying to get an idea of the situation of my reimbursement, and was on queries for 2 hours, until I got on the plane. On the way back, as I got to the counter for check in, United Airline employee told me that my flight was cancelled because they put me on the Burbank flight (without my approval) and since I did not show up on the flight, they cancelled my round trip. They said they tried to contact me and maybe because I was in the sky when they called, but since I didn't call them back, I am liable for this result. At the counter I just wanted to go home and told them I just want to buy a ticket now (I already told my friends when to pick me up, and unlike United, I don't want to change what was schedule.) And the lady was like you can buy it with your phone. I insisted on her booking the ticket for me (I didn’t want to have the risk of, where I brought a ticket online and the counter told me they can't find it) then she tried to book me for about 10 minutes and told me "I am going to have to stop booking for you since you are about to past the 30 minutes limit to board the flight." And Later on I found out the person who is "more" familiar with the ticketing was on lunch. The most disgusting part is their attitude and the situation they put you in, "I am not responsible for your schedule." "You didn't show up for your flight," "I am not in charge of reimbursement," "you should have booked your ticket online." Never ever United.

| United has accommodated me and my family on business as well as pleasure trips over the past 17 years. They have always been helpful when we found ourselves in a quandary and over the years I remember only one incident where I was upset about the quality of customer service when dealing with United employees. Today United came through for me again, far above and beyond the call of fair customer service: my FF status expired in Feb as I had a slow travel year in 2017 and I also missed the March 11th deadline for purchasing a reinsted status, however, a very pleasant and helpful customer rep went the extra mile for me and requested an exception since I’ve been a loyal customer for years - and not only did United reinstate my silver status but they did it for free ($680 value as quoted to me in March). United has my loyalty!

|  Bozeman to Tampa via Houston. United Airlines has to be by far the worst airline ever.  They nickel and dime you for everything and then do not provide what you paid for.  Every employee/representative states"there's nothing I could do (for their own mistake and situation they have created).  Paid extra per passenger to be able to pre-select my seats and guarantee that I would sit with my husband for our long flights (I have developed anxiety with flying).  Paid for my checked bags when booking my flights. I check in to my flight the evening before my flight,  since I do not bring a printer on vacation,  I chose electronic boarding passes.  All info was good, name, correct flight and bags. Once at the airport, an agent told me we had re-check in to get out luggage tags.  We insisted that we were already checked-in with luggage paid for.   She made us use the kiosk, and when I checked in, my name was changed to 'Olivia'.  So now my boarding pass does not match my ID, and they were charging us again for bags I already paid for.  At the counter, a call was placed to United by the ticket agent about the name change.  The person at the other end of the phone stated that another agent had been in my record earlier that day.  That agent denied changing my record.  My name was corrected, a new boarding pass issued,  but no seat assigned.  When we got to the gate, they re-assigned me to s seat different than the one I had paid extra to select at booking, and I was no longer sitting with my husband.  We asked to get my seat back that was assigned to me 45 minutes earlier, but they could not because my original seat was given away. Once on the plane, the bitch who got the seat with my husband would not move.  I ended up in the aisle seat in the last row....by the bathrooms in a seat that does not recline. To top it off, instead of offering to help, the flight attendant told me she was going to escort me off the flight for being upset. United airlines charges over the top prices, charge for everything and do not provide service.  Staff is rude, not helpful and are trained to answer "there is nothing I can do".  The bottom line is:  I will take your money, not provided what you paid for, be unhelpful and rude to you.  Then, you are held hostage and threatened to be taken off your flight when you let then know you want what you paid for. United -Tampa to Bozeman MT: $1500 for 2.  Extra charge for seat selection and bags. Delta- Tampa to SLC: $700 for 2. Extra charge for seat selection and luggage. American - Tampa to Syracuse: $490  for 2.  No extra charge for seat selection. United Airlines is a rip-off with very poor accountability and customer service.  Will pay more with another airline next time.  Very disappointed and United will not fix this. I feel like I was robbed. They do not care about the paying customer once you have given them your money. We will never fly with them again. Flight attendants are unhappy and rude, do not assist for anything. Ticket agents are incompetent and stressed.

|  San Francisco to Boise. I was scheduled for a flight with United Airlines on 3/20/2018. However, the flight was cancelled due to weather condition (which is understandable), but be reminded that United Airlines do not offer any compensation for weather-related cancellations. Not even a meal for >24hr delay. I got onto another United flight the following day, and arrived with a damaged luggage. The baggage service at the airport was not willing to do anything about it, but then mentioned that they will send the bag to a 3rd party in Texas for repair, and I will be contacted by the 3rd party. Two days later, I received a call from United to pick-up my bag at the airport and it never went for a repair. Nothing happened. But it is United, do not expect any customer service whatsoever. United has written rules and fine prints to protect themselves from paying compensation to passengers in all situations, so understand that you are handing over your money without any guarantee of basic service or protection in return. Again, avoid United Airlines at all cost -and remember this for many years to come (it was my mistake to forget past incidents with United many years ago and gave them another chance). A few hundred dollars spent on flight ticket may end up costing you over >$1000 in incurred costs during delays, lost time, as well as damages to your property.

|  Mexico City to Newark. What happened to being treated with courtesy and a smile. I struggled to get to the airport for a 5:30 am flight and they eagerly switched to a more direct flight, “they were doing me a favor”. It meant I had to be at the Mexican airport 3 hours longer and my wait in Newark was going to be 5 hours and I know they were looking to free up seats on the flight I was on originally. I also had an exit isle seat on the flight I was moved from. It would have been all fine if someone just said "thank you for being flexible and helping us out” but instead they tried to make it sound like they were doing me a favor. Further annoyed by the unfriendly 2 female attendants for the flight. Simply just not friendly.

| Manila to Colorado Springs via Guam / Honolulu. Worst flights I have ever experienced. Flight to Guam, we were seated and asked the flight attendant if he could put my wife's purse in bin above us, he gave me a dirty look and shut the bin. I asked him again and he finally took it acting as if it was an issue for him. The flight from Honolulu to Denver was horrible, the seats are too narrow. When we boarded we were in 17D and 17E. When I went to put my one carry on bag in the bins above my seat they were full, and the flight attendant gave me a dirty look and said to put it in a bin behind me. This meant I had to put it about 7 rows behind me. The result was when we landed, I had to wait for everyone to leave plane before I got to get my carry on. The reason the bin above me was full was the flight attendant allowed the couple to our left to use two bins for their carry on baggage. When I pay for a ticket I expect to be able to stow at least one carry on above me in the bin. My opinion was the flight attendant could not care less. The other problem is the seats are about 17" wide and have little recline. I think the management at United needs to try flying and sitting in one of these seats for a 7 hour flight and see how they like it. Overall the service and seating was horrible. If you fly to Asia, I would recommend JAL or ANA as they have great seats and service, plus they provide an excellent meal.

|  Horrible again, missed out on a day again. This trip we sat on the tarmac for 35 minutes because they had no where to park the plane. Missed the last flight and had to spend a whole day in Denver till the following night. After all of that expense we return the next day to find out they have no crew for that flight. So here we sit again. June 2017 they bumped our seats and we missed our own wedding. We don’t care anymore about price. We are going to take our business else where from now on. They are a ridiculous bunch of slackers. In one year we have missed our own wedding In Kauai. And now our granddaughters first birthday. Atrocious I say. Shame on you taking people’s hard earned money on promises you cannot keep. United has no accountability for practices that inconvenience nice hard working people with no recourse besides never flying them again.

|  Chicago to San Francisco. The worst airline from start to finish. Roof at bag tag, bag drop, entry to Security and on board. Absolutely terrible. It is after many flights that I waste my time writing a review. First time I have bothered. Just told my wife to research moving from sf Bay Area just to avoid their hub. Regarding entertainment: connectivity almost always minimal and they explain too many people are using it!

|  Panama City to Los Angeles via Houston, and quite disappointed with the in flight service. First, it was a 4 hour flight over lunch, and international. However snacks (except for one tiny bag of pretzels) and meals were only available for purchase at high prices. Maybe I’m just conditioned to the high standards of Delta and American and expect to have at least a substantial snack on any flight longer than three hours. Additionally, in flight entertainment was not free, but my monitor was not working anyways. Finally, seat comfort is not great. The head rest pushes ones head forward and makes sitting for 4 hours quite uncomfortable. Overall, I’m not impressed. While the staff was very friendly and helpful which I very much appreciate, i will try to avoid this airline in the future.

|  Philadelphia to Washington DC. Worst flight I’ve ever been a part of in years of traveling. We boarded at 7.30pm in Philadelphia and have been awaiting takeoff ever since. It’s currently 11.00pm. Not sure exactly on the wait but in the process we have refueled as well as de-ice for a second time. They did give us a sip of water. United sucks and everyone I knew flying delta and America tonight made it on time with no issues. I will never fly again. Thanks for the service, could have just planned to stay another night in Philly but no transparency.

| Flew from SFO to IAD and tried to book for the economy plus but the only seats available were the middle seats. However the normal economy seats were actually OK. The inflight entertainment were good, however the internet was the biggest problem. I bought internet for the entire flight however due to connectivity issues, I got disconnected. I bought another internet packet for the entire flight and got disconnected for the second time. The flight attendant gave a United Airlines voucher worth 100 dollars (more than twice the value of the internet I bought). The flight attendants were helpful, friendly and humorous - not something I am used to in Asian airlines but I enjoyed it.

| Flew economy class from DCA to JFK with the small plane which was fully booked. The seats are tight and the seat pitch is small. My 4 wheeler luggage could not fit into the overhead compartment (best to bring a small briefcase or backpack next time) and had to be put in the cargo hold. The process of taking the luggage was pretty unusual (we were not given any tags and had to queue out near the door cluttering the exit). The business class seem more spacious at it has a 1-2 config instead of the 2-2 in economy. The guy next to me was a pretty big size to the point I just didnt bother even putting my arm on the armrest. The service was pretty good in my opinion, polite but not out of the ordinary. Not a lot of airlines serve this route so I would have to recommend United Airlines!

|  Newark to Boston was extremely problematic. I had boarded the plane and was seated when a man said to the nearby flight attendant that someone was sitting in his seat. The attendant said to me, “I need to see your boarding pass”. Confused, I asked why. She said, “You’re in the wrong seat”, in a rude and urgent tone. I explained to her that I would need to look through my emails to find my original boarding pass. She was rushing me, told me she needed to board all other passengers, and that I needed to hurry up even though she just told me to do this. I showed her my pass from the first leg of the flight. This made her even more on edge and provoked since it was not the right pass. I then found the pass for the current flight and showed it to her. She condescendingly asking, “And this is for the flight now?”, as she refused to read the pass for herself. I said yes and continued to point to the seats me and my friend were assigned listed on the pass. Without reading the pass at all she pointed to my seat and said, “You’re in the wrong seat. You need to move, you’re in the wrong seat”. She was unfriendly, unrelenting, and very angry at me. A man sitting at the window spoke up and said that he was actually in the wrong seat and it was his fault. The passenger that originally asked for help from to the flight attendant, was at this point, visibly uncomfortable by how the flight attendant was harassing nearby passengers and said it didn’t matter where he sat he didn’t care anymore. I ultimately was in the right seat the entire time. However, I was the only passenger the attendant interrogated rudely and angrily. She did not apologize and looked extremely annoyed after this all occurred. Scared that I would be kicked off the plane if I spoke up, I left without receiving any apology from her what so ever. I felt nervous, uncomfortable, upset, and victimized. Later in the flight, another attendant walked up to my seat. She yelled at me to put my seat fully up, two times in a row. I was shocked because I had never put my seat down in the first place. I looked up at her and she said this to me again while telling me to press the button to put the seat up. I pressed the button and the seat didn’t move at all because it was always fully straight. I said to her, “It is fully up”. She said extremely shortly, “I am allowed to tell you to put it up. That is my job.” Then proceeded to glare at me. I said “that’s fine”. And she rolled her eyes at me. She did not treat any other passengers on board like this except for me. I felt treated unfairly and felt like I could not speak up or I’d be dragged off the plane. In both instances, I cooperated, did nothing wrong in the first place and was severely harassed by multiple flight attendants on board. This was my first time flying with United Airlines and I would never go back. What a terrible end to a great vacation.

| Houston to Seattle. I paid for First Class and was disappointed in the mediocre food quality and limited selection of beverages. The only red wine available was mediocre-to-bad and came ice cold in a glass. no way of knowing what was being poured. The FA simply said that there was a red and a white. I don't eat meat and the only two meal options were meat so I ended up eating rice. I would have picked the chicken out of the Cobb Salad but they had run out of that by the time they got to me in row 3 (of 6 rows). The small piece of cheesecake was convenience-store quality. I wondered if United had chosen to skimp on food quality and quantity as a cost cutting measure. I honestly thought that paying for a First Class seat would bring great service and relieve me from the unpleasant economy situation of United. It real only brought me up to what a normal economy experience might be.

| Punta Cana to Dallas DFW via Washington. I came from Punta Cana, spent an hour at immigration. When I got out of immigration, someone from United was waiting for me asking if I’m going to DFW. I said yes. They checked my bag. Then, they changed the departure gate. I spent 10 minutes in the airport running to get to the new gate. When I finally get to the gate 10 minutes before departure, the flight attendant says that she can’t let me in. I need to check with customer service. I go to customer service, they rebook me for the next day and do not provide me an hotel. When I fly with Delta, they always provide me hotel when it’s their fault and I will spend the night. Also, we left from Punta Cana 15 minutes after departure because we were waiting for some customers. And, when we got to Washington, we waited 5-10 minutes before going to the gate. Thus, I lost in total 20-25 minutes because of the airline and they don’t want to get me hotel saying it’s not their fault I spent a long time at immigration. Meanwhile, I could have make my flight if I did not lose those 20 minutes. Thank you United. I’m not gonna flight with you anymore! I am really upset.

| Flew United Airlines from Los Angeles to Orlando. First of all, they were late boarding and the flight left late. No explanation provided. They said active military could board first. My daughter had her military ID out. Everything was fine until another lady approached and said are you all together and she said our bags could not go on. I have flown all over the world with my family and these bags. Never have I been told that I could not take my carry on aboard because of the size. She was rude and nasty and didn’t care what I said. Nice way to treat the military and family United. Will never fly your airline again.

| So disappointed! I upgraded at the counter to a Premium Economy seat, for the price of USD 115, as I knew I would be landing with jetlag, and needed to reach my next connection out of Amsterdam. Other than the 10 cm extra leg room, it was a waste of money. Not even a free GT. I do not expect to get a gourmet meal onboard any flight, but the food here was not even worth waiting for. The bread was like a sponge, with a BBD far into 2019. Service was ok, but not more than the minimum requirement.

|  Denver to Atlanta. The worst airline I've ever flown. The employees were extremely rude and unfriendly. At the desk, when they charge you because they don't allow carry on bags, the employees do not want anything to do with you, except take your money for a bag that should be allowed as a carry on anyways.  At the gate, when they assign you a seat, they don't even look at you. I guess it makes sense with an airline that creates class warfare in the main cabin of the plane. They have about three different classes of ticket for the passengers who are all sitting in the same section on the plane. And they treat those who has a Basic Economy ticket like farm animals. If not, worse. You have to pay wifi, pay if you want a tiny bag of food, pay to check a bag that should be carry on, and all while they not caring about you at all. They have older planes, the ones that other airlines retired years ago, so they're excessively cramped, and dirty, and little things on the seats and in the aisles are broken or falling all. They consistently oversell their flights, so you may be asked to give up your seat.  Since their ticket prices aren't even cheaper than most, I'll be much more happy paying in the same price range to fly a different airline which allows a carry on bag, provides free wifi, allows you to pick your seat, and doesn't treat you like pond scum. United Airlines should be ashamed.

|  Seattle to Albuquerque. I have not flown United Airlines in years. Decided to give them a chance as I found a cheap ticket. Flight was late taking off for no reason they could give us. We sat on the plane ready for take off an hour before leaving but they assured all of us going to ABQ would make our connecting flight. We landed get to the gate in SFO and they had just shut the door. There was 8 of us who they would not let on. When I called into customer care they would get us there till almost 24 hours later with a flight that would have another connection so who knows if we would have made that. I asked if there was a fight I could get on with another airline that would get me there that night as I needed to be. She looked and said no. I found one on AK Airlines and she said she couldn’t book with them only American. I asked about getting a reimbursement on my ticket with United and she said as long as I didn’t get on the next flight with them. Was on the phone waiting to talk to manager and I got hung up on. I purchase ticket with AK Airlines that can get me there that day. Call back as I’m walking to their gates. He only refunded me half the ticket since I used the other half. Stated I would have to email a complaint to get other part of ticket back. Well after months of emails and calling I have not received the other half back or anything towards that AK Airlines ticket. They say there is nothing they can do. All I was asking for was $35 dollars! Plus when I got to the AK Airlines gate United had put one lady on that flight so they could have done it. Long story short horrible customer service with no results except a $50 off my next flight with them. I will never fly them again so told them I’m not interested in that!

| My trip with United from Chicago to Bozeman has been all around bad. Not only do they charge you for any bag you try to ship, I arrived two hours early to the airport and I was still almost late because of the undermanned and under-enthusiastic staff as I tried to ship my bag. To top it off, I was confronted about my seating on what amounted to be a half-full flight and forced to sit in the back even with empty seats around. Disgraceful. I understand it was not the seat I had bought, but with so few people on the plane, I was astonished to be asked to move.

|  Honolulu to Chicago O'Hare. I was stuck on an 8 hour flight kept just above freezing temperature. Flight crew passed out more blankets but my toes were frozen, men were wearing hats and coats. I shivered for six out of eight hours on the flight and twelve hours after that. Never again. They offered me a glass of ice water mid flight and I suggested a space heater. That's the last time they interacted with me. The United airlines app that lets you watch free shows and movies does not work on Android. When I complained about the cabin being kept so cold they offered me a $100 voucher toward another flight. I told them to keep it.

|  Key West to Toronto via Newark. Thank you to both the staff of the ground and on the aircraft who were very helpful and patient when weather delayed the first leg of our flight. We had constant updates in the airport as the situation was changing. When it was apparent we would not be able to catch the second leg (unfortunately the last United flight of the day to our destination) They found seats for us on a partner airline. Staff was polite and really persisted to find a solution. Flight was uneventful and cabin staff friendly and efficient.

| Flew United Airlines from London Heathrow to Los Angeles. Aircraft very clean. Crew were pleasant and nice. I had paid extra for Economy plus for the legroom. The food was actually very good. The only issue is the tiny portions. The seat back padding is minimal. There is room for the seats to be 1 inch wider each side. Overall considering the terrible reviews that United usually gets, I think they were better than my flight over to London on Virgin Atlantic.

|  Houston to Frankfurt via Atlanta. Traveling for Spring Break with my family. Got delayed first day and rebooked on next day and cancelled next day. We couldn’t leave Houston for 2 consecutive days. We had to cancel our travel. Thank you United, never use them again. Domestically Southwest are much better,  internationally much better to rely on Lufthansa, Air France, KLM. United is just unreliable and can’t manage its fleet.

|  My husband and I flew from Newark to Las Vegas. We purchased the tickets a few months before the flight and I was advised to contact United to inform them of my pet allergies. I called 10 days before the flight and was told that there were no animals booked for either direction. I was then told to call back 24 hours prior to the flight as there were a few available seats and the pet policy requires 48 hour prior notification. I called back and was offered a seat in the pet-free area (for $200 more each direction) which I declined as there were no pets booked and we were in the home stretch, the 48 hour notification deadline. I was told to notify the gate agent on arrival. At the airport my bag was pulled for inspection as they x-rayed my book and did a thorough check on my EpiPen. When we finally arrived I let the agent at the gate know about my allergies and was informed that he didn’t know if there were any animals on the flight. He told me that it was policy to book anyone with allergies on the next available flight if there were pets onboard. I asked if the next flight had any pets booked as my husband tried desperately to pull me away from the counter but, not before I heard the agent reply that he didn’t know. He did know that my husband and I would be seated in separate rows, 15 rows difference to be exact. As we boarded, our carry on was removed and banished to the bowels of the plane. I said farewell to my luggage and husband, got seated, cracked my book, and took a deep breath. That’s when I began giving my seat mate some serious side-eye to see if she was covered in cat hair as I scratched at my hives and waved away pet fur. I took 2 Benadryl and started hitting the bottle, of eye drops that is. Hour fours, two more Benadryl (that’s four if you’re counting) and a full bladder. I stood up to use the restroom and peered over the seat directly in front of me and that’s when I see it. A stressed out, full shed-mode, Pomeranian sitting on his owners lap. He pants as his owner strokes his fur creating the snow globe from hell. Who knew sitting 15 rows away from your husband would come in handy. I passed the baton (bottle of pills and tissues cause he’s allergic to dogs too) and ran to the critter free zone. To be fair, I am an animal lover but, the pet policies have to be addressed. I’m not the only allergy sufferer and you’ll have a hard time convincing me that this particular dog was a seeing eye dog, a seizure dog, a PTSD pooch or anything but the fluffy family pet. I followed the airlines rules and look where it got me, the run around, and a trip to urgent care for a sinus infection. Oh yeah, crazy small seats, no WiFi, piss poor customer service! Taking JetBlue to Aruba this month. No more United flights for me.

| Flew United from Chicago to Beijing. Lacking customer service skills. The $150 upgrade was only so I could get a window seat. All of the regular economy seats were only offering middle seats. They take up half of the economy cabin with upgrades, so if you buy a late ticket, you have to upgrade to get a decent seat. Flight attendants were rude (both flights), and the food was awful. I normally have such great experiences with international flights, especially with Delta. This was beyond disappointing.

| I have been flying a minimum of 3x a year for the last 25 years. I never really have problems, other than the occasional unexpected flight delay due to weather. I also haven’t flown United in a couple of years. I purchased my economy tickets through Expedia for a little 5 day trip. Prices didn’t vary but about $5 as compared to others. When I went to do online check in 24 hours prior to flight, I learned I had to check my small suitcase, that I have always carried on before. I travel very light. One small carry on and one backpack. I was told I was not allowed the suitcase and had to check it and pay $25 each leg. Ridiculous. I then had to wait in baggage claim, which I never had to do before. I’ve decided I will not be flying United again for this very reason. This change in policy is taking you out of the market as compared to other airlines. People that travel light typically go economy, and they travel light to avoid delays like waiting in baggage claim. Bad decision United.

|  Oklahoma City to Destin via Houston./ I have been flying a minimum of 3x a year for the last 25 years. I never really have problems, other than the occasional unexpected flight delay due to weather. I also haven’t flown United in a couple of years. I purchased my economy tickets through Expedia for a little 5 day trip. Prices didn’t vary but about $5 as compared to others. When I went to do online check in 24 hours to flight, I learned I had to check my small suitcase, that I have always carried on before. I travel very light. One small carry on and one backpack. I was told I was not allowed the suitcase and had to check it and pay $25 each leg. Ridiculous. I then had to wait in baggage claim, which I never had to do before. I’ve decided I will not be flying United again for this very reason. This change in policy is taking you out of the market as compared to other airlines. People that travel light typically go economy, and they travel light to avoid delays like waiting in baggage claim. Bad decision United.

|  Booked flight 6 months ago. Our transferring flight to come home was pushed forward about 2 hours. Our flight lanes on schedule, as soon as we departed the plane I asked customer service if we were going to miss our flight. They immediately confirmed before going through customs or security. At this point we had already traveled for 21 consecutive hours, this additional delay increased our total travel time from 23 hours to 30 hours. Especially tough when traveling with an infant. I believe United was fully aware that we wouldn’t be able to make our connecting flight but did not notify us because we would have canceled our tickets. On the other hand, if it would have lead to us staying in a hotel for 1-2 nights I believe United would have let us know. Basically they are only out to protest their bottom dollar and have no consideration for the inconvenience they caused. We declined the $50 travel voucher they offered and will not be using United again.

| Flying from Bozeman, MT to Maui, HI with a layover in SFO, the first flight said it was delayed by nearly an hour and a possibility of missing my next flight, however our flight from BZN made it just in time for myself and several other passengers to high tail it to the connecting flight to Maui (OGG). The gate was still open with passengers loading, the ticket agents said to see the gate attendant to myself and the other 2 folks who were also connecting(with a line of people there). After several minutes (and the gate was still open) the agent finally looked up my boarding pass and said they had actually sold my full fare first class ticket to someone else, because they thought our flight would be too late! The agent was very curt and rude, offered no compensation, he put me on the next flight 4+ hours later in a bad coach seat next to a screaming baby with no food service on an evening 5.5 hr flight! That flight by the way also did not take off on-time as we sat on the aircraft for another 50 extra min making it a nearly 7 hr flight time. not the first terrible flight on United either.

|  Sydney to Cancun via Houston. Within 2 hours of take off was told there was no red wine left, with 13 hrs still to fly, we had had two glasses of red wine each. Staff were non existent, didn’t come when the Call light was serviced, and when did appear were very rude as we had clearly interrupted them. Overall cleanliness and condition of plane was disgraceful and we were apparently on a new Boeing 787. Were told internet and spirits were available but once in the air found out this was at an extra charge. We are dreading the return flight home but unfortunately have no other choice. Pay the extra and fly with someone else.

|  West Palm Beach to Newark. The overall experience has been absolutely horrible. Our flight was suppose to be at 11am but was delayed until 3:30 because of a “technical issue”. Shockingly there was no mechanic at this airport to fix the issue so one had to come from Orlando which took 4hrs. Older people who were waiting for news in wheelchairs were treated with disregard. New people were put on this plane by the airline only to face this grueling experience. Finally, after almost 5hrs of waiting, the flight was cancelled. Completely disgusted with the unprofessionalism and lack of care that took place. Will never fly United again.

|  Denver to Des Moines. This once mediocre airline has slumped even further down in their level of customer care. They have taken away the option to check in online from passengers that don't carry additional luggage. Customers with only a personal item must now check-in in person. What a way to increase efficiency and wait lines. I now get to spend more time away from my personal life and at their terrible terminals. This airline is a waste of space and the same attitude that ended with a customer being beat up with on a flight clearly seeps into all manners of their customer interactions.

| Flew Washington, D.C. to Cleveland. United forced me to check my suit and charged me $50 for it knowing full well that it fits in very tight spaces. Their baggage policy also almost made me miss my flight since they dont allow online check-in if you say you are not checking any bags. In other words they are going to squeeze you to the point of missing your flight in order to get that extra baggage fee. Well, they just lost my future business. Goodbye and good riddance United. I will even pay extra to avoid United next time.

|  Miami to Newark. I went against my better judgement in booking a round trip flight with them. This airline has by far the worst customer service I have encountered. They lack customer support and assistance when it comes to dealing with flight changes and cancellations over the phone. The representative I spoke with canceled my flight without confirmation and prevented me from flying out to my destination on time. In addition I had to book a flight for double the amount of money out of another airport and United provided no compensation or refund for my inconvenience. I will never fly or recommend this airline again and please all beware of the airline attempting to scam you.

|  Munich to Chicago. Aircraft interior looked as very old one. Cabin crew not nice, very tired, not pro-active for customers. Were very unhappy each time they were asked for anything. Seats quite unconfortable as for such a long distance. Next time I would select another airline. Meals very small and I was really hungry after landing.

|  I was having a puppy flown from Layfeyette Loisianna to Salt Lake City Utah. It was supposed to arrive at 9:30pm and when I showed up they told me the flight was delayed 2 hours. No phone call, no email, no notification. They said she would be in Salt Lake at 12:15A and when I got back to the airport for the 2nd time, they told me my puppy wasn't even on the plane! They used the excuse they didn't have enough runners to board the plane fast enough? Get real people. United Airlines petsafe department sucks. I paid a lot of money for this dog and I still don't have it in my possession.  On a side note, United Airlines customer service is even worse. The employees didn't have a care in the world. Heartless, non sympathetic and very rude!

| Original flight canceled due to weather. Understanding this creates havoc. App was good at sending message, but contacting a human to see what options were took over an hour on hold. Re booking direct flight was not possible. Our diversion through Houston worked out OK, but staff along the way were extremely rude and the treatment of basic economy class passenger is like they are dirt. I read and tried to follow the luggage rules. I paid $50 for the privledge of checking two bags. My wife and I consolidated into one small carry-on bag. I was among the last group to board, with everyone else carrying much larger bags aboard when a gate agent yelled at me to stop and demand I pay a $50 dollar fee to gate check. When I told her I had paid the fee online for two bags, she "let me go with a warning" but told me to leave bag unattended at the gate (which I refused to do) this is against every announcement and safety procedure airports have. I took it with me to the plane, and asked a stewardess if I should check it at the door. She was friendly, and I was allowed to leave luggage where at least an airline baggage handler took it directly and joked he would have it in New Orleans before I got there. The plane was filthy, dirty tissues in the safety card pocket. Trash on the floor, wrappers and cellophane. PA system didn't work. No internet on this flight (broken). The short hop flight from Houston to New Orleans was about as tight as they can make it (I'm 6'2"). I find it hard to believe this passes the safety rules for evacuation speed, these seats are so close. The message from the airline is clear - if you opt for basic economy, we will make your trip so bad. A fellow traveler joked he had more legroom in the toilet and was tempted to hide out sitting in there for the rest of flight. So, I tried to follow all the rules. I am a pretty easy going person, compliant with others. But this experience was pretty awful.

|  Houston to New York. Don't have much to say beyond what everyone has basically come to expect of United: minimal amenities, non-existent customer service, and generally quality suitable for a 3rd world country airline. On the flight  they charge extra for everything, just like the low-cost airline that they are, with the exception of 1 drink and "free entertainment" if you bring your own device. Of course, they don't provide a port for charging said device, and also don't actually let you watch most of their entertainment unless you install some software, which on a Mac simply doesn't work (it keeps asking for Flash even if you install it), and on a mobile device requires downloading their app, for which you need Wi-Fi, which, who'd have guessed, you have to pay for. As for the very limited selection of movies that don't require said software, they still don't work on a computer, but on a mobile device are just close enough to working that you'll spend the majority of the flight (not remotely an exaggeration) staring at a frozen screen as it presumably buffers for 15-20 minutes at a time. I suppose the only thing setting this United flight apart is that this time we flew with their new "Basic Economy" concept, where for more or less the same price, they manage to exceed even their normal standards of how clear they can make their contempt for you as a passenger (to be honest, little difference beyond disallowing even carry-ons, but they do make sure to constantly remind you of it, which is especially egregious considering that's something even the low-cost airlines allow).

|  San Francisco to Kansas City. United Airlines was terrible from the moment we stepped foot in the airport. One employee would tell us that our bags would be fine to carry On, while another would tell us that we'd have to check them, just minutes before boarding when it was already too late. We ended up being stuck in San Francisco, CA and needed to just take the second leg of our trip instead of starting with Bakersfield to San Fran, San Fran to Kansas City because we ended up being stuck in San Fram due to a family emergency. We called customer service and explained the situation to which they replied that our entire flight would have to be cancelled due to a "No show" since we wouldn't be on the bakersfield to San Fran flight. We explained the situation again and stated that we'd still be paying for the flight but just wouldn't be on it. They eventually said that they got it taken care of and that we could take the San Fran to Kansas City flight and skip Bakersfield so we were under the impression that everything was taken care of. The next day (the day before the flight), we went to check in to our flights and were unable to do so on the United Airlines app on our phones. We called customer service again and were told that our flight was cancelled completely and that we were going to owe $380 each plus what we had already paid for our flights in order to get them reinstated due to "fare changes" and we would have to take the Bakersfield to San Fran connection again. We explained again that this was not possible and what we were told the day before about not having to take the bakersfield part of the flight and that we were told everything was taken care of. The customer service representative stated there was nothing they could do and that we'd have to pay the fee and take the connecting flight if we wanted to make it back to KC. When asked to speak with a manager we were placed on hold for almost 30 minutes and then they came back to tell us that it was a mistake on their end and we were able to take San Fran to KC with no additional charges. While on the San Fran flight the flight attendant was extremely rude. There was a line of people trying to board and she attempted to push past me to close one of the overhead compartments. I asked her if she could wait until we sat down and she said, "I need to close these now! They're full! Back up for a minute" In a very brisk and rude manner. She was slamming the doors on the compartments and pushing past people. A couple minutes later when she seemed to be over her tirade, another gentleman on the plane asked her if she was having a rough day. She stated, "I left something expensive on one of the other planes and they wouldn't give it back." He said, "I'm sorry to hear that I hope your day gets better." To which she then continued to go slam more of the overhead compartments and order the passengers around. My entire United Airlines experience has been awful and we will not be using them again. Terrible customer service is an understatement.

| Flew Ontario to Washington DC via San Francisco. I fly at least once a week both domestic and international. I try to avoid United Airlines if possible. I have not had a fight where a cancelation, delay or another major problem hasn’t occurred in the last 10 years. Last time I took to DC, the canceled the return flight because of the crew. This time we were delayed about 45 mins. I purposely pack one carry one and we were forced to stow below even though there are 20 plus spaces in the upper storage. I have never found a nice flight attendant. I will continue to be a JetBlue fan.

|  Sydney to Detroit via San Francisco. The worst airline ever. Never had so much problem no only with their schedule time which delay on my flight from Detroit to SF also SF to Detroit. They also cannot coordinate with their ground group. When we land in SF from Detroit and Sydney. We were standing at least for 20 minutes to wait for the group service to start. On top of that, they won’t even hold our connected flight for 10 minutes due to their own delay. I almost think I am traveling in some remote country with their 10 people operated airline. Warning, do not take United Airlines.

| Flew Orange County to Chicago. I haven’t flown United in over a year due to their constant delays and poor customer service. I decided to try them again as my company booked me on United. (For the past year I have made them re-book me on a different airline when they booked me on United). United does it again, I booked an aisle seat as I tend to get claustrophobic cramped against a window for any long flights. United changed my seat to a window. As usual their customer service was very poor. I don’t understand why when you book a specific seat 2 weeks in advance that the choose to move a person to a worse seat. I guess I shouldn’t have given them a second chance. Next time I’ll have the company re-book with a quality airline.

| Orlando to Boise. I once again realized why I've avoid United Airlines. Their customer service is an absolute joke. Do not expect them to own any of their mess ups. On top of it all, I tried calling one of their service numbers only to spend 20 minutes on the phone with someone who could barely speak English . Quit outsourcing jobs United and work on a culture of customer service, like some of your competing airlines. I will remember to continue flying Alaska and Southwest.

| Flew Edinburgh to Hawaii via Newark. Our recent vacation included 4 flights with United Airlines and, from check in to landing, everything went like clockwork. Every flight was on time and all cabin staff were friendly and efficient. Complimentary soft drinks and water were available on all flights and, when meals were provided, the quality was excellent. United Airlines provide good value for money and we would have no hesitation in recommending them to potential travellers.

| I was scheduled to fly out yesterday from Omaha to Newark and it was canceled due to weather. The gentleman at the desk told me there were no flights till Monday and suggested I get my refund. I see today that there are flights. I'm am at a loss of money because it was imperative that I be there. I will no longer suggest using United Airlines again!

|  LaGuardia to Los Angeles via Houston. They will sell you flights with connections that you won’t make in time. Be real careful when booking with these people. They will make you wait until next day if you miss a flight and won’t offer you even a glass of water. The worst airline experience.

|  San Francisco to Miami. Pretty unimpressed. There was bad weather in San Francisco which is not their fault but they didn’t put enough fuel in the plane and we had to land in Sacramento then fly to San Francisco. I missed all my connections and was given a new flight the next morning causing me to miss my connection in San Juan - a cost to me. I now have to sit and wait around an hour to get my bag (a carry on that I had to check because the flight was jammed full. I realize some things are out of there hands but they didn’t offer anything to make my experience better, they have no connection to lounge access so can’t even give you that to compensate or priority boarding for the inconvenience. Their best advice was file a claim online, and we all know how that goes. I think my days flying with United are over.

|  Las Vegas to San Francisco. Horrible customer service. My wife and I booked our tickets through expedia and we never were given the option to choose seats. At the airport, we asked them if they can do something about that. Instead of trying to help, the lady started cutting us off while we were talking and telling us that we need to pay more attention when booking tickets through expedia.

|  My husband just sent me a picture of him aboard his connection flight from Chicago to Cincinnati. His knees are forced into the crack of the 2 seats in front of him and the aisle. He cannot move. This was the same issue on his previous flight. How is this legal or safe? We will never fly United again unless seat spacing changes for the better. Sadly, many airlines now are shortening the space between seats to make more money. Absolutely awful.

|  Toronto to Allentown via Newark. Have 4 hours delay, we are already in the plane so we can’t leave the plane unless we decided to deplane and go again for the entire US and Canadian check. I missed my ride from Newark to Allentown  and next available one is 19 hrs from now. I went to customer service and ask for compensation and they give me advice “to call a friend to pick me Up instead”. I tried calling United airlines customer service If I could get my refund and they told me it will be 7-10 days from now.

|  Montreal to Hong Kong via Newark. My trip started and ended in Montreal, with stops in, Newark, Hong Kong and going home Singapore and San Francisco. United staff on the ground and inflight were very friendly and efficient. I was very impressed expecting the worst after reading reviews. The seats were far too hard to be comfortable, the lavatories too small for a plus size person. The food quality was okay. I look forward to my next United flight.

| United has always let me down whenever I have flown with them. They are usually delayed and had me wait over two hours for a flight before. So when I was going home by them again I accepted that it wasn’t going to be a fun trip. I didn’t know it was going to be this bad. First off my flight started off late and the plane got to the airport 20 minutes later then we should have. They did not tell us why we were late though. Not only was it late but we had to wait longer than necessary to get our carry-on luggage that wouldn’t fit on the actual plane. Due to all of this we missed our connecting flight. When we finally found the right gate (since it was switched on us at least twice) the flight had already boarded and the door closed. The attendant at the desk was rude and condenscending when she told us that it was closed and the plane left. We proceeded to wait in the customer service line for two hours in order to talk to a rep who didn’t know anything and had to ask her supervisor on every little question. She tried to figure out why the flight was late but found no reason or explanation why. She said yes the flight was delayed but since there was no reason for it she could not get us a hotel room or even a discount on one. The next flight to South Dakota wasn’t until ten the next morning which would have been too late for the event we needed to get to. We asked if we could be refunded and found a flight back to Tulsa. After a lengthy phone call they decided that they can only get us on the next flight back to Tulsa which was at 2pm the next day and if we want to be refunded we will have to call a number and jump through some more hoops even though it’s the airlines fault for us missing our connecting. We asked if we could possibly fly back on Sunday. Since we were already in Denver we didn’t want to shoot our entire weekend down the drain. She replied with a no due to policy. So here we are in the Denver airport at 10.30 at night with no luggage food or a room. We are missing a baptism. With how we were treated and hurt I am now going to make every effort to never fly United again. I will also never recommend this airline.

|  Montreal to New York with United, connecting to Avianca and Tam to Sao Paulo / Salvador. My partner and I won't fly again with United Airlines. First of all, they started by "forgetting" to reimburse us a pair of tickets (worth more than 3000$), even after we called to make sure we had not been ticketed. When we had tried to purchase our ticket, they were not able to confirm to us our tickets within 24 hours, so their policy was that our tickets would be canceled - we would not be charged. We took extra precautions by calling them to make sure we were not charged, and were reassured that we would not be charged. One month later we find out in our credit card statement that we had actually been charged. This is not a mistake of charging 10$ extra to costumers, it's more than 3000$! Moreover, we had to wait about 2 weeks to get the full reimbursement once we called them. And lot's of talking over the phone. Second, during our trip, we wanted to change the origin and date of one of our flights. However, when calling United Airlines during multiple days and talking to several agents, some would say we could not change the origin of our ticket. No where on the ticket does it say we cannot change the origin. Also, we spoke to about 5 agents who told us all kinds of different rules and policies (often contradictory) - all with the same end: they would not let us change one of our flights. They told us we had to "stick to our initial route" and there were not changes possible. The call center staff is  unprofessional, scattered around the world and all saying different policies, rules, etc. We wasted so much time. As mentioned, we will never fly with them again, we feel scammed, they took our money and that's it.

| Flew San Francisco to Los Angeles. I booked so called "Basic Economy" which is a new way that United Airlines uses to trick and trap customers. Of course I ended up paying $50 for two carry-on bags for each of us (one of them is really small and just because it has 4 wheels). If this is the way they treat customers and make money now, they are digging their grave aggressively. Company like this is really badly managed and have no reputation whatsoever. UA is on my never-to-take again black list and I will warn all people I know to be careful to watch out for their tricks.

|  Houston to Los Angeles. Before my first flight departed, I expressed concern to a flight attendant, because there was only 16 minutes from when the flight landed until my next flight started boarding. She stated to me that we would probably be arriving early so there would be enough time for me and they could ask the passengers to remain seated letting me off the plane. Neither these things were true. I get to the gate at LAX three minutes passed when boarding was meant to end. It is isolated and not a single employee nor other passengers are around. I pace around looking for someone but the doors are shut. I rush back to a staffed customer service stand for answers. The woman I had the displeasure of talking to was in "Customer Service." Can I have your last name? No. Do you have an employee identification number? I can't give it to you. She calls my gate and discovers the employees were in the jetway. She then continues to bang away on her computer keyboard for several minutes. There was absolutely NO attempt to help me make my flight. She notifies me that the soonest I can leave is not until tomorrow afternoon. I tell that is not going to work for me. She does not care. That was that. What else can you do? Nothing. How else can I get there? You can drive. I openly express my frustration. About how I asked for help from the flight attendant, she does not care. I demand that there must be something else she can do and at this she picks up the phone to call security. She then says to me "we're done, you are not willing to listen, we're done." And at this, refuses to help me and sends me away. I come back to her and said that I was going to need a hotel room for the night. She responds with, "I am not helping you with anything." You are not going to get me a hotel? She uses this as an opportunity to lecture and chastise me about I should have listened to her and if I wouldn't have left the terminal [to find a human being to help me] then I wouldn't have missed my flight. I have a diagnosis of generalized anxiety disorder which I am medicated for. This employee caused me to go into a panic attack which I could not breathe and started to black out. I tried explaining to her I have an anxiety disorder to which she responded with, "yeah I can tell." It was the most violating and humiliating thing anyone had ever said to me. How dare one of their employees mock a paying customer who expresses that her medical diagnosis is affecting her.

|  Denver to Minneapolis. My flight was supposed to go out at 1:12 PM then got delayed six different times. Finally boarded the plane at 3:15 and ended up sitting on the plane for 2.5 hours. I decided to deboard the plane having already missed a funeral that I was supposed to be at in Minneapolis that afternoon. Filed a claim to get my bags return to Denver international airport after having to check my carry-on bag due to overcrowding on the aircraft. Spoke to a woman at United customer service who assured me my bag will be back the following morning at 7 AM. Return to the airport after having to get a hotel that evening. Returned to the airport only to find out my bag had come back to DIA, then was sent back to Minneapolis. Had to wait six hours at the airport before my bag was returned.

|  Houston to Atlanta. Literally never again. I bought new baggage to accommodate their “basic economy” requirements to ensure I wouldn’t have to pay their $25 handling fee + checked bag fee ($30 for my flight, it’s different based on aircraft etc). From ATL to Houston, no problems - return from Houston to ATL though, they stopped me at the gate and said I couldn’t take my bag onboard despite the blue they put on my bag at check in approving it for my ticket. I insisted they were wrong and they tried to argue. I was close to losing my temper and they just said “ok ma’am go on,” as if they were just trying to appease me. Never acknowledged that my bag was the right dimension for my ticket. I went out of my way to follow their rules and was treated like I tried to get away with something. I’ll never use them again, and no one in my company will either. The ticket wasn’t even economical.

|  Denver to Portland. United Airlines has one of the most asinine and exploitative reservation and ticketing practices of all the airlines. Breaking Economy into a Basic Economy removes half the options for passengers upfront, and further alienates them by requiring an in person Check In process at a kiosks if they have any bags at all. Their app literally will not let you check in online if you are basic economy, without charging you $25. I fly out of Denver so United represents 75% I can take and they know how to get you on flight selection, ticketing, check in.

| Flew Los Angeles to Chicago. Never again. Rude rude workers and the fact that carry-ons aren't allowed anymore is annoying. We weren't assigned a seat until we were boarding and our group was separated. When we were checking in there were 2 workers attending everyone checking in.

| Paris to Austin via Washington. United is the worst airline for international travel. I honestly dont know where to start. The rude employees, the bathrooms on the flight, the “food”, the uncomfortable seats, the cleanliness of the cabin is all bad. I intend on flying any other airline for all my travel personal or business moving forward. This airline digusts me.

|  Tampa to Houston. Staff mistreated us while we were attempting to check in at the front desk. We walked up to the computer to start our check in process and got to the point at which we needed a United official to assist (since we were flying basic economy). It took the 5 ladies behind the desk about 15 minutes to make their way to us. This is remarkable knowing that only about 4 computers were in use and we had our hands raised/waving for 5 minutes. The employees  ignored us until we  waved at one while reaching over the counter. When the lady finally made her way over to us she took us to check the size of our backpacks in the personal item container. It was a tight fit but they could definitely fit. The lady began to explain that if we did not check our bags, they would charge us at the gate a higher fee. We have ridden basic economy on about 6 flights each (a total of 12 flights) and have never had an issue fitting our bags under the seats in front of us. This lady was saying "they are going to grab you at the gate and make you pay $100."  She then went on to record our information after approving us. We didn't get charged, obviously, since our bags fit in the personal bag space. United has lost us as customers.

|  Appleton to Chicago via Houston. Not happy. Flight delayed due to maintenance. For 5 hours. Now missed my 2nd flight due to that. Stick in Chicago for 5 hours. Will arrive 6 hours 45 minutes later than promised. Missing my dinner meeting. I don't want to spend the morning afternoon and evening in a airport.

| Due to fly United Airlines from Dallas to Delhi via Newark. Boarded and waited on the tarmac for 3 hours only to be unboarded and made to go to a different gate. Meanwhile, they send an email saying the flight had been delayed due to a late crew member and the Feb 17 flight at 9pm has been postponed to Feb 18 at 2pm. Meanwhile they abandon the passengers, customer service desks were unattended until 6am and the stranded passengers were given water and pretzels for dinner.

| Flew Las Vegas to Chicago. Our flight attendant charged me $50 for complimentary carry on and was completely rude. Said to another customer while helping me I have Diamond and Platium customers to help. Completely rude to me and others. I paid the fees, swallowed the rudeness and went on my way. Just very disappointed in this service as this is a customer service world and with all the terrible publicity United has had you would think they would try harder. I hope others don’t get this terrible no star service, but if that’s what United is going for.

| The worst service ever. I purchased a ticket from Seattle to Syracuse NY with one stop in Chicago to find out when I got to Chicago that the connection flight is delayed by four hours. No apologies at all. They just really don’t care. Last month they cancelled my flight from Syracuse to Seattle going through Chicago causing me a full day delay and added hotel room and rental car cost for one additional day since they did not tell anyone about the cancellation until I got to the airport. Again they don’t care and they refused to reimburse me for the extra night hotel room. I will never ever use this airline again. Avoid them at all costs.

| This airline is ridiculous with their basic economy! It’s not even about no more carry-ons - it’s about not being able to switch to a later flight during a family emergency. I was only flying from NYC to Rochester. I needed to change my return flight to a later date. The original ticket is $150 plus $50 in taxes - makes sense for a 45 minute flight. To change the ticket since it’s “non refundable” - and technically I’m not getting a refund just changing my flight - is a $50 conversion fee and then a $200 fee to switch the ticket! So they’re not helping I’m just buying another, more expensive ticket. Ridiculous. Never flying United again!

| My United Airlines flight from Colorado Springs to Denver was at 6am and it got delayed 2 hours. Meanwhile, my flight was the only flight delayed. Then, we finally boarded 2 hours later and we pull out from the gate, and they stopped for “maintenance” for a over an hour. They barely even informed us on what was going on. Worst flight ever, never flying United again.

| I travelled on United Airlines from Las Vegas to Chicago on the 14th February 2018. I was in Basic Economy and understood what that meant. When I tried to use the machine to check in I was unable to do so and referred to an agent. They checked that I only had a personal item and gave me a boarding pass marked as such. We had a tail wind and made up about 40 minutes flying time. Tea and coffee was free on the flight. I also was willing to be offloaded but they did not need the extra seat. A good flight all around and I will be flying United again.

|  Palm springs to Grand rapids via Denver. So after finally being deplaned because of maintenance problems, I have been re routed to a flight that takes off two hours later, has a four hour layover at my next stop and gets me home after midnight. I've been dropped from first class to economy. And when I asked if there was any sort of compensation for this mess they have created, I was told I can call customer services. I asked to be put on a different airline so I could arrive home sooner as I have to be in the OR at 7 am tomorrow and was told I couldn't. It is unbelievable how you are treated as a paying customer. Why would anyone ever fly?  When asked why they couldn't have figured out these maintenance problems last night we were told that they don't check the plane until shortly before take off.  It's unbelievable!

|  About six hours into my 15 hour flight from Singapore to San Francisco I was attacked by bed bugs from the blanket used - I was traveling Polaris class. Bites all over my chest - took eight days for them to go away. Worst flight ever - contacted United to alert them to this problem. United offered $150 as a "Goodwill Offer." My intent was to alert them to this problem so that no one would have to endure such a horrible experience. Found their offer to be a slap in the face. I declined the $150 offer which I consider to be "Bad will."

| Flew Dallas to Chicago. This may be the only airline in the world to treat a nervous 19 year old girl with the most rude and unapologetic attitude. This was my first time flying alone so yes, I was a bit nervous. No one told me that asking questions was completely ridiculous. Being told that "I'm old enough to know these things" or that "its not rocket science" is beyond rude. United, you wont be getting my business again.

| Absolutely terrible experience! Stay away! Every single time I have flown United Airlines something goes wrong! They had "maintenance" issues and canceled our flight. This was after a 6 hour layovers. They would not refund my first class ticket and made me wait another 2 hours for my bags! What a horrible company!

|  I travelled on United Airlines from Maui to San Diego via San Francisco. It was an overnight flight from Maui so I got to San Francisco around 4am. I had a couple of hours before our connecting flight which allowed getting breakfast at SFO and also coffee while waiting. All around an enjoyable set of flights involving a connection through San Francisco.

|  Los Angeles to Newark. I was traveling today with my son (who was sleeping on the stroller) and husband. Before we enter immigration at the entrance we met these two ground officers(women) who are checking bording passes. The one who took our bording passes looked at asked us to tell our names by showing each bording pass. We did as she said. But she asked us to repeat it. But we don't know why. My husband repeat it again also said we have to catch the flight at 10.45pm So let us go. (It was almost 10.30) she looked at me and said step back and take off my tiny purse which was hanging my neck and shoulder. So i had to step back and take off my backpack my jackets to take my purse and put it inside. I was just couple steps away from immigration. I know she wanted to make us uncomfortable in front of everyone.  We felt so helpless specialy when we had a sleeping baby with us. This made me so upset during whole flight. This is the first bad experience i ever had.

| United Airlines is the worst airline I have ever dealt with. I was charged $400 for two tickets to be changed, was hung up on while on hold three times by customer service people, and was told to call a different number which was an automated attendant. Was finally after one hour told they would not apply the $137 credit of my original tickets to an upgrade. The seating space is torturous and the airline crew are rude.

|  Philadelphia to Washington Dulles. I am very upset at this point. I was scheduled to leave Philadelphia going to Washington then connecting to Atl. Flight 6319 was an hour late getting to Philadelphia. Intead of boarding at 7:25pm to depart at 7:50pm. Flight arrived at 8:35pm and plane took off at 9:08pm. We arrived in Washington 9:55pm or close to that time. Flight attendants reassured everyone that their connecting flights were still on time we would be fine. When I got to the gate for my connecting flight it was closed. No other flights are leaving out tonight. So I have to sleep in the airport. Catch a morning flight to Atl. The purpose of the email is communications should have been had between 6319 plane and 6322 plane. 6322 never knew of our delays so they proceeded to leave on schedule. I feel like just changing my flight and me sit and sleep over night in an airport is very insensitive. Poor customer service. I fly often and will never fly with United again. I was on a flight once yrs ago and there were a group of people on an international flight. That airline waited for their flight to land because they understood that the plane delays should not effect the passengers. I fault the staff and pilot for lack of communication. Hopefully this will bring about some change.

| Flew San Francisco to Tel Aviv. 787-800 at the Polaris first - Business seat 6B. United service is something I can't understand, they do the minimum during all flights. Right after takeoff most of the team disappear, during the long flight (15hr) I couldn't see air crew activity if you needed anything, the one at the galley was eating or reading emails. They forgot to give the amenity kit to 90% of the business class passengers, the plastic bags of blankets and water bottles left on my seat (at the seat upper storage area) were all over the flight and overall the Polaris that should be Business First is cozy and small for passenger above 185 cm with 2x2x2 configuration (meaning the window seat need to jump over you). Overall not a legacy airline at all, long way to go.

| Flew San Francisco to Auckland with United Airlines. Check-in staff were unenthusiastic. Service at the United lounge was terrible. The male attendant at the reception desk had a bad attitude. Some of the flight attendants were lukewarm. Overall the attendants' service was nowhere near the Asian airlines, such as Singapore. Polaris business class is decent but still falls short of Singapore's quality. Onboard Wi-Fi was slow even when loading webpages, and they explicitly said streaming videos wasn't allowed. On airlines like China Eastern I could stream videos smoothly. Airlines like Singapore pay attention to every detail, such as the check-in staff. United falls short every here and there. After the mergers, United has monopolized tons of routes, so now they make money off of the monopoly and don't care about service quality whatsoever. Will not fly them other than on exclusive routes.

| Grand Rapids to Newark. I had a bad feeling when I booked with United but as this was for a job interview and I was asked to fly out in three days, I didn't have any other choice but to take whatever flights were available - my original sense of dread turned out to be justified and I certainly will not be flying with United again. The flight was scheduled to take off at 7:30 PM, it's 9:38 PM and I'm still here. Initially, they announced a 3 hour delay, then, figuring that wasn't inconvenient enough, they changed it to 4 hours. So instead of arriving at my destination at 9:30 PM as I was originally scheduled to do so, I will be getting in at 1:40 AM - no big deal. And of course the United employees at the kiosk make it quite clear through their laissez faire attitude, and at times downright rude behavior, that they really don't care about the fact that paying customers are waiting out a 4 hour delay. It's very obvious United doesn't give any thought to customer service. When asked what the issue is, they respond with "Oh, the plane is undergoing maintenance." Funny, I figured maintenance would be done routinely, not when it has the potential to ruin as many lives as possible. And, shouldn't there maybe be a backup plan? Is every single United plane currently being used with no consideration given to the possibility of unforeseen mishaps like this? I especially like the response I received from the snooty United employee when I asked if there were any other flights available - "No, probably not..." Probably not? Umm, do you mind checking perhaps? Which she begrudgingly did after I asked. Real problem solvers they got there. I'm also really glad I signed up for both their email and text message alerts regarding flight changes. I received neither. I'm sure they just didn't want to fill up my inbox or use up my monthly text message allowance. I suppose United figured this was the best way to earn back some respect. Nice job guys, this will certainly be my last flight with this airline. United has steadily been losing credibility amongst my circle of professional colleagues, and it's not difficult to see why.

|  This was a very pleasant weekend excursion to celebrate my birthday. I flew Tampa to Denver on Friday and then returned to TPA the next day via Washington Dulles. Check-in at TPA was immediate and simple, but Denver was another story. The Premier Access line was only 3 or 4 minutes long, but had I been a normal economy passenger, the line stretched interminably. Boarding for all three flights was disciplined and orderly. all flights pushed back early, departed promptly, and arrived ahead of schedule. On the TPA-DEN and DEN-IAD flights I had the forward, over-wing exit row window, with the middle seat unoccupied. On the IAD-TPA segment, the whole exit row was open, but I was upgraded to an aisle seat in first class. This experience confirmed for me that the exit row seats are the best in the plane and beat 1st class on narrow-body aircraft, particularly if one or both adjacent seats are unoccupied. On the DEN-IAD flight, I purchased the southwestern omelet for breakfast, and I was very pleased with the taste and the presentation. The crew on all flights were pleasant and efficient, my luggage arrived promptly, and I thoroughly enjoyed the trip.

|  Houston to Phoenix. 10 in our group. Missed our flight because cruise ship was fogged in. Called United, said we couldn’t make our flight. Agent rebooked all 10 of us on a later flight for no charge. Very impressed. Thank you United. Will definitely fly with you again and will tell everyone about our satisfaction.

|  Denver to Washington. They have shrunk the width of the seats to such an extreme you feel crammed. There is literally no wiggle room and I'm not a large person. I feel sorry for the man next to me. Boarding on time, flight crew pleasant. They need to make room for real people and stop monetizing their passengers.

|  Tel Aviv to San Francisco. I was excited to try the Boeing 787  new Polaris at united. We had a nice welcome with the team and find my 6B seat The configuration is a bit tight- 2x2x2. Usually I see 1x2x1 in this 787 for business class. The seat was comfortable but the issue the for 185 cm and up- there is no space of your legs. Really disappointment. Service was so so, when I asked for the flippers that are in the menu ( we are so proud of verity of things we can offer to you just ask the air crew…- as it was written…) air crew forget what you asked - overall disappointment

|  Chicago to Des Moines. Worst service ever. Flight was delayed 3 hours and they switched the departure gate 3 times. All participating United Staff seemed thoroughly confused and did not know details about the flight. I would not recommend United to anyone of my friends or family at this point.

|  Everything was good with the flight, my issue was that they lost track of my baggage and I ended up receiving it 10 days later, they did not give me any compensation for the issue and every time I called them to ask for my baggage they were clueless to where they were and when they would arrive. Very disapointed because of this.

| Flew United Airlines from San Jose California to Houston Texas. I bought a ticket for my aunt who has Alzheimer's and bought her premium economy so she has more leg room and made sure she had an aisle seat to grab an attendant if she needed help. They moved her seat four times! Each time I had to call and say, she can not be put in economy, that is not what I paid for, and she can not be in a window seat! She has to be able to flag an attendant if she needs something! They tried putting her in a window seat, economy instead of premium economy, etc.. Dealing with a person that has Alzheimer's is bad enough, dealing with a horrible airline that I had to call several times to argue about why they cant move her seat is just horrible. They have notes in their system that she has this medical issue and I think they are trying to take advantage of that!

| Worst flight experience of my life. Sat on the runway for two hours in Baltimore, so I missed my connecting flight in Newark to Norfolk. Was forced to spend the night in New Jersey, and the airline refused to give me a hotel voucher. I had to pay $100 for a hotel due to the airlines negligence. The customer service was incomprehensibly rude. It was as if they thought this was funny. I have never experienced an airline as terrible as United.

|  Raleigh Durham to New York. The worst of any service that I have encounter. They were late for my first flight which result that I could not get on my second flight to Hong Kong. I got my travel agent go online and there are flights available but the site agent will not honor. The first agent is ignorant and the second agent is trying to verbally fight with me. I'm paying for this ticket but treated badly. I should have know when I chose this United Airlines. this name is not fitted for them.

|  Honolulu to San Francisco. Our flights to and from Hawaii were great! Even though there was an issue with the WiFi they made sure everyone was able to log on quickly and gave iPads for those who couldn’t log on. Also we ended up confusing our flight that was on Alaska and a similar flight and time was at United. When we realized this at the United help desk it was too late to get to our Alaska flight within seconds they put us on their flight and offered to move our bags to that flight as well.  Also those German waffle cookie things are heaven.

|  Boston to Hong Kong via Newark. My flight BOS-EWR was delayed due to late arrival of the aircraft and I had a short connection in EWR to continue towards HKG. The customer service is unhelpful, as if the delay is your fault, not theirs. They refused to board me on an earlier flight, they could not offer re-routing nor sponsor the ticket with another airline to secure my journey. The delay was ultimately tight for my connection, but every UA representative I spoke to suggested the other flight would have likely waited. It did not. It left six minutes earlier than scheduled. Despite asking to the flight attendants while on flight whether my connection would have waited, the response was that United - differently from every other Star Alliance company - does not offer this "service".
